loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: Muslum is a 46-year-old farmer who raises livestock in the southern region of Saatli. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 2002 when he purchased a cow and a calf. He is doing very well in his business selling calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders. The orders for calves have increased, and purchasers ask to buy more calves because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. But fwith the money he has now, it is impossible to expand his business, so he applied for a 1200 USD loan. For this amount he is going to purchase four calves to raise.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nasiran

texts.en: I am Nasiran B.. I am a mother of nine: four sons and five daughters. I live with my family in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. My husband is a very ambitious person; he wants to help his children by offering them a good future. He operates a shoe store in a nearby market. Eid (a Muslim religious festival) is around the corner and we would like to secure a larger  variety of shoes for our store. We lack the necessary funds for this purpose and hence are requesting this loan so that we may secure higher profits this Eid.

loans.use: Buy greater variety of shoes

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.ru:
Vilayet D. was born in 1958 is married and has a child. He was born and raised in the city of Karakjunlu. He has been raising cattle for more than 7 years. At the beginning it was very difficutl, but in 2004 he obtained a $300 credit from the Ahsulin branch of Normico. This money allowed him to increase the size of his business. Currently his business is in need of additional financing.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Дунямалиев Вилаят.1958 года рождения.Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Родился и проживает в село Каракоюнлу. Более семи лет занимается скотоводством. Проначалу было очень трудно, но в 2004-ом году после обращения в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала он получил кредит на сумму тросто долларов. На полученные деньги успешно расширил свой бизнес. Вилаят нуждается в повторном кредите.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is a 43-year-old farmer who raises livestock in the small village in the Saatli region. He is married and has three children. He has two years of experience in raising livestock. He started his small business in 1999 when he purchased a cow, and during those many years was selling milk and yogurt to the local people and bazaar traders. But life changed and became difficult, especially in villages. Tahir wanted to improve his life and the conditions of his family, so he started to raise calves and sell them for meat production. During the last two years it has been the only financial source for his family. For a large family of 5 members, it is very hard just to sell only one or two calves every two or three months. So Tahir would like to enlarge his business and purchase more calves for raising and breeding. For this purpose he applied for 700 USD. He will spend this loan purchasing two calves for an estimated price of 300 USD, and then buy fodder for 100 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and fodder

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn T. V., 32, is a widow and lives with her two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She runs a stand selling women's clothes, earning around $6 each day in revenue.  Mrs. Thorn T. V. is currently applying for a loan amount of $1000 to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her client needs, and to use any remaining money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her client needs and the leftover of the money is used to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas T., age 53, is a vendor selling clothes in the market, earning around $5 each day.  Her husband, age 55, is a carpenter, earning around $5 each day.  They have four children, one who is a student and three who are married and live separately.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more clothing for her inventory to diversify her products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her inventory.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: I am Kosar B. from the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of three children: two boys and one girl. All of my children attend school because I feel it is their basic right. My husband is a carpenter by profession, and he makes objects out of wood. Currently his business is small, and he wants to expand it. For this purpose, he requires a loan of $350. He plans to buy wood in bulk to produce more for his business.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men K. O., age 47, works selling grocery products, earning around $7 each day in revenue.  Her husband is a broker buying and selling palm sugar, making about $5 per day.  They have four children, two who are students, one who is a laborer, and one who helps her with her business.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to increase her inventory by purchasing a greater variety of products to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Behruz Group

texts.ru:
Ahmad A. is the leader of the group. He was born in 1974, is married and has a child. He has been working on the market for the past 6 years. This is his main occupation and for this reason he transports the goods himself. Uguloi sells groceries and other household items. She is married and has 4 children. Another member of the group is "Behruz", Mahroma. She sells groceries as well. She has 4 children and is forced to sell coals in order to supplement her family income. She has been working on the market for the past 5 years. Zilola sells candies. She is married and has a child. She used to sell many different small items, but currently is specializing in candy. Momokiz is another member of the group. She sells small items. She is just starting her business. She has been working on the market for a year now. She has three children.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Ахмад Ашурматов является лидером группы. Он 1974 года рождения, женат имеет одного ребенка. На рынке торгует уже 6 лет. Это его основная его деятельность, поэтому, он сам привозит товар. Улугой также торгует продуктами питания , кроме того она продает промышленные товары. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Еще один член группы "Бехруз", Махрома. Она также продает продукты питания. Мать 4-х детей, дополнительно что бы поркармить семью она вынуждена продавать уголь. На рынке 5 лет. Зилола торгует конфетами. Замужем имеет одного ребенка. Раньше Зилола торгавала различные мелкие товарами. Сейчас конфеты ее основной бизнес. Момокиз также член этой группы. Она торгует мелочью. Она только начинает развивать свой бизнес. На рынке 1 год. Мать троих детей.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of food products

loans.name: Izatoy's Group

texts.en:
H. Izatoy has a big family and is the mother of 8 children. For more than 2 years, she has been selling household goods. She sells her goods very quickly. Her business partner is S. Mavluda. She is married and has 5 children. She has been selling cotton oil for over 10 years. They are very friendly and help each other all the time, in different situations.

They both became clients of Microinvest in 2003, and H. Izatoy is an active client of Microinvest. During their partnership with this organization, they have been reliable and responsible clients. They are now requesting a loan through Kiva in order to purchase more goods to sell and expand their business.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Neit

texts.en: Mrs. Neit S., age 36, works as a vendor selling grocery products and biscuits in front of her house, earning around $4 each day.  Her husband is a farmer, making around $2 each day from selling what they produce.  They have two children who are students.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer for her farm and use the remainder of the loan to buy pigs to breed for additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer for her farm and use the remainder of the loan to buy pigs to breed for additional profits.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Neit Sopheak has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Farida H. was born in 1964. She lives in a village called Karakoyunlu of the Agsu region. She has four children. She has been raising cattle for about ten years now. Since raising cattle is a profitable business in Agsu region, the family decided to expand the business and came to Normicro for help with credit. After receiving the first credit, the family bought several cows. Since Farida's family is rather large, they want to further expand the business and need additional credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Гасанова Фарида 1964 года рождения.Проживает в село Каракоюнлу. Имеет четверых детей. Около десяти лет занимается скотоводством. Так как в этом регионе скотоводсто прибыльный бизнес, семья решила расширить свой бизнес и поэтому обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала .Получив кредит семья купила несколько коров.Поскольку семья у них большая, они хотят расширить свой бизнес они повторно нуждаются в кредите.

loans.use: To increase quantity of animals

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen S., 45, is a mother of three children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she not only works as a broker, buying yam and rice crops from the growers and selling them for a profit, but also works selling fruits at her house, earning collectively around $4/day in revenue. Her husband is meanwhile employed by a local organization, earning on average about $2/day. Mrs Sen S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more yam and rice crops to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more yam and rice crops to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Egam

texts.ru:
Egam J. has been processing timber for over 20 years. His son helps him in this business. Processing and sales of timber business is his sole source of income. He would like to obtain a loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Джуманов Эгам занимается переработкой лесоматералов около 20 лет. В этом бизнесе помогает его сын. Переработка бизнеса является его основным источником доходов.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.en:
Huriniso has been selling rice in the Spitamen food market in the district of Khujand, Tadjikistan, for over 10 years. She has many customers, and quickly sells the rice, especially now during the harvest season. She buys rice from peasants in large quantities for a low price, and sells it all in two or three days.

Huriniso is an active client of Microinvest. She is requesting a loan now to purchase more rice. Many of her customers placed ordered several months ahead of time, because the rice she sells is the best quality.

loans.use: Purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Aflan

texts.ru:
Born in 1947, Aflan B. lives in the village Gegely. He is married and has 7 children. To provide for his large family, Aflan opened a cattle farm. As soon as Agsu branch of NorMicro was open, he applied for a loan to purchase a few animals. Now, his hard-working family is ready to take another loan to grow the farm business further.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бакиров Афлан.1947 года рождения.Женат. Имеет семерых детей.Родился и проживает в село Гегели.Так как семья большая, и чтобы обеспечить свою семью Афлан решил заниматся скотоводством.После открытия филиала Нормикро в Ахсуинском районе семья сразу же обратилась в этот же филиал чтобы получить кредит.На полученный кредит семья купила несколько голов скота.Эта трудолюбивая семья чтобы расширить свой бизнес опять нуждается в кредите.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod D. was born in 1970; he has a family with three children. Currently, he sells house wares. But this is not his only source of income. Being the sole bread winner in his family, Dilshod also raises crops and re-sells cattle. Dilshod would like to get a loan to expand his house wares business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Дадабоев Дилшод 1970 года рождения, отец троих детей. В настоящее время он торгует галантерей и хозяйственными товарами. Но это его не настоящий источник дохода, так как он является единственным кормильцем семьи и что бы прокормить семью , он также занимается сельхозкультурой и перепродает скот.

loans.use: To expand the house wares business

loans.name: Ikram

texts.ru:
Ikram S. was born in 1967 in the village of Gegeli in the Agsu region. He has a family with four children. In his village people either raise animals or raise crops. Ikram raises animals. In order to expand his business, he came to Normicro that works with Kiva. He needs credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Ширалиев Икрам.Уроженец село Гегели Ахсуинского района.1967-года рождения.Семейный. Имеет четверых детей.Поскольку в этом селе сельчане в основном занимаются скотоводством и земледелием он выбрал первое.Чтобы активно заниматся он обратился за кредитом в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала.Этот человек нуждается в кредите.

loans.use: To increase quantity  of animals

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Tohir H. started his business 3 years ago. He sells drinks and food. Tohir found out about MLF MicroInvest and turned there to expand his business. Today his business reach has increased and he plans to borrow from MLF MicroInvest in the future. Tohir is married and has 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Тохир начал свой бизнес 3 года назад. . Он узнал об Микроинвесте , и обратился в Микроинвест для расширения своей деятельности. В данный момент его торговая зона раширилась и он планирует кредитоваться в "Микроинвест " и в будущем. Он женат имеет троих детей. Его основные продукты являются напитки и различные продукты питания.

loans.use: For resale of food and drinks

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat has been selling a variety of groceries, such as cookies, candies, and pasta, for 15 years. She works at Spitamen food market. She is married and has 3 children.

She is an experienced salesperson, and quickly sells her goods. Today she has many repeat customers, who are very satisfied with the high quality of the goods that Saodat sells.

Saodat is requesting a loan from Kiva so she can purchase several new items to sell to attract new clients.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety of products to sell

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Born in 1957, Aydin A. lives in Agsu. He is married and has 6 children. For more than 30 years, Aydin A. has been a barber. More than 5 years ago, he opened his own barber shop. To service his customers better, Aydin needs to purchase modern tools. He applied for this loan to finance the purchase.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллайев Айдын.Родился и проживает в г.Ахсу.1957 года рождения.Семейный. Имеет шестерых детей. Более тридцати лет занимается в сфере обслуживания- мужской парикмахер. Более пяти лет тому назад открыл личную парикмахерскую.Для качественного обслуживания населения ему не хватает современного оборудования и поэтому он нуждается в кредите.

loans.use: To purchase modern barber tools

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Ana María is a young entrepreneur that dedicates herself to selling men’s and women’s clothing. She has been running her business for five years. Ana María has a 5-year-old son that attends school. Her husband is butcher.

Ana María confides that all the efforts she is making are to provide necessary care to her unique son. She also is thinking about begin a university career. She had left school for a while, as she had to find the way to take care of her son. Now that he is older, she has more time to herself and she wants to finish secondary school so that she can go to the university next year.

Ana María is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk in Santo Domingo, the capital, to resell in her community. She wants to reduce the frequent trips she makes outside her town to get the merchandise. Ana María, in the past, has proved to be a very responsible person. She had already taken a loan from FSMA and she repaid it on time.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to supply her business.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María sells men’s clothing. She is 38 years old and has three children. Her husband works in a construction company.

María has been operating her business for one year. Every two weeks, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to acquire garments to resell in her community. Currently she makes a weekly profit of USD 125.00.

The businesswoman is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk to supply her business. Wholesale purchase will reduce frequent and costly trips outsiD. her community to get the goods, so she will increase her income and improve her margin of profit.

María had previously obtained loans from FSMA and she was able to repay responsibly.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is said to be a many-sided woman. She is the kind of person that is willing to improve her life and is ready to strive to achieve her goals. She has three sons, aged 17, 16 and 13. All of them attend school.

Faustina has been selling women’s and children’s clothing for ten years. Recently she started to sell sandwiches and juice with a loan she took from FSMA. She operates the two activities in a much crowded place. The elder son helps her sell the goods. Her businesses have been very profitable insomuch as she could repay the loan and put asiD. money to keep on investing in her activities. At present, she has more facilities to help meet the expenses of the family and she is in better condition to improve the education of her children.

Faustina needs funds to purchase raw materials to supply her sandwich and juice business. She will keep preparing the dishes and will let her son run the business in the morning. She will concentrate upon the clothing sales. She explains that with just one activity she won’t be able to bear all the expenses of her family. She hopes she can get the funds soon to ensure the subsistence of her sales and make sure she can keep on improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to prepare sandwiches and juice for a small business.

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.en:
Luisa María, 47, is married, with twelve children (eleven girls and one son). They all attend the secondary school of the town.

Luisa María and her husband are butchers. Her husband’s works in breeding the animals. Luisa dedicates herself to the sales of the animals. She has fitted out a space next to her house and there she operates the business. She also sells fried maniocs and fried chickens.

She explains that she had been running that business for more than ten years, but she was obliged to stop the operations because of health issues. Fortunately, she recovered her health and she could restart the business two years ago. Now the business generates a weekly profit of USD 70.00.

Luisa María is asking for funds to make the business progress. She wants to improve the hygienic conditions of the space where her husband and she run their business. Given the loan, Luisa María will be able to remodel the location where the shop is operated, offer better services to her customers, and will assure the quality of the goods she is selling to people.

loans.use: Remodel the location where business is operated in order to improve the hygienic conditions of the place.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is 58 years old and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. The family lives in a small rented house.

Pascuala actually is unemployed. She is a seamstress and used to work part-time for an haute couture company. Pascuala says that the home is short of money since her husband is getting older and can't work as hard as before.

She has decided to start a small business within her house. She plans to sell cloth and sew tailor-made clothing. She expects business will be successful since she has a famous reputation as seamstress in the town.

She is asking for credits to purchase a quintal (100 pounds) of different kinds of cloth to sell in her community. She will also repaire her old sewing-machine so that she can prepare clothing the customers order.

This way, Pascuala’s family will have a second source of income and she will be in a condition to help her husband support her family financially.

loans.use: Purchase cloth to sell and to repaire a sewing-machine to prepare clothes.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio is 56 years old and married to Ceferina Brizuela. They have four children together and all of them are currently residing in Spain.

Amancio used to work as a bus driver in the city center and later became a school bus driver, which he still does.

He is a very hard-working and honest person, starting his day very early in the morning, and that sacrifice has borne fruit. With earnings from his job, he's been able to start a convenience store that his wife runs.

Amancio is requesting a loan so he can repair his bus and purchase parts to keep it running.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Amancio Ramírez tiene 56 años, esta casado con la señora Ceferina Brizuela, ellos tienen 4 hijos y todos se encuentran actualmente residiendo en España.

Don Amancio en principio trabajaba como transportista alternativo en el centro de la ciudad, después consiguió la habilitación y permiso para ser transportista escolar y actualmente se dedica a ese rubro.

El señor Ramírez es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta, inicia sus actividades desde muy tempranas horas de mañana, y dicho sacrificio ya le ha dado sus frutos; con las ganancias ha logrado montar una despensa la cual es atendida por su esposa.

Amancio necesita reparar su vehículo y comprar nuevos repuestos para mantener en condiciones su vehículo.

loans.use: Repair vehicle

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is 24 years old and a mother of a 3-year-old daughter. She has a small shop that sells snacks, fried foods, and household goods. She has been running her business since joining MBK. Her husband is a farmer, but sometimes he earns extra money by driving people on his motorcycle. He usually earns $1.50 per day. She requests a $100 loan to buy more snacks and goods to fill her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill the shop with more goods.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is 50 years old. She lives with her 19-year-old son. Her other children have married and live separately. She and her husband sell snacks, vegetables, and household goods. They usually earn $15 per day, and it's just enough to cover their family needs. She requests a $125 loan to buy more goods and make her shop more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill the shop.

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en: Kiki is 21 years old and married. She has been selling snacks since joining MBK. She usually earns $5 per day. Her husband D. is a worker, who earns $20 per week. She requests a $125 loan to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Itoh

texts.en: Itoh is 28 years old and a mother of a 9-year-old son. She has a small shop that sells snacks and household goods. She could earn $8.50 per day. Her husband is a laborer who earns $2 income per day, so she has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill the shop

loans.name: Nurhasanah

texts.en: Nurhasanah is 35 years old and a mother of a 15-year-old son. She sells clothes on credit. She could earn $5 per day. Her husband A. is a motorcycle driver, who earns $2 per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more clothes to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oneng

texts.en: Oneng is a 36-year-old mother of an 11-year-old son. She lives with her son and also her parents and she is the one who provides all the family's needs. She sells household goods and some foods such as Indonesian aalad (gado-gado). She can earn $10 per day. She requests a $50 loan to expand her business and hopes that she can earn more money to finance her child's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés is 36 and is married to Graciela, 37, and they have two children

They have run a convenience store out of their home for the past five years, and Andrés' wife is a teacher at a school in their neighborhood.

They are hard-working and responsible people. According to their neighbors, they also help in the community.

They are requesting a loan to purchase supplies for their convenience store, such as sugar, noodles, soft drinks, snacks, milk, bread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Andrés tiene 36 años y esta casado con la señora Graciela de 37 años, y tienen 2 hijos.

Tienen en su casa una despensa, desde hace 5 años, y su esposa es docente y enseña en la escuela de su barrio, por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, según referencias de los vecinos, ellos también realizan trabajos comunitarios y obras sociales junto con los vecinos del barrio.

Solicitan el crédito para comprar mercaderías para su despensa, tales como azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, panificados, leche, etc.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for convenience store such as sugar, noodles, soft drinks, snacks, bread, milk, etc.

loans.name: Emas

texts.en: Emas is 32 years old, a mother of a 15-year-old son. She produces and sells fermented cake made from soybean sediment, with her husband. She usually sells them to the market and can earn $8 per day. She requests a $50 loan to expand her business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add production capital

loans.name: Nelly Josefa Altagra

texts.en:
Nelly sells shoes for men and children. She is 39 and has one 16-year-old daughter that is finishing secondary school. Nelly has been separated from her husband for three years; shortly after her separation, she started the business in order to make a living and take care of her daughter.

Nelly has great dreams for her business. She hopes that someday she could have a location where she can run the sales activity and not have to sell in the streets and public places. She says she will continue working hard to achieve that goal.

With her loan, Nelly will purchase shoes in bulk to sell in her community. She likes to sell off her products at once and go back to the capital to buy more goods to supply her business.

loans.use: Acquire shoes to sell in her community.

loans.name: Lucila Petronila

texts.es:
Señora Peta, as her close friends call her, is 44 years old. She lives in Sector América of the Moche district of Trujillo, La Libertad. She finished high school, and she has two children that she must provide for. She breeds several kinds of animals such as cows, calves, pigs and hogs that she slaughters on weekends. She then sells and delivers the meat to her clients in Moche; The high quality of the meat she sells has made her quite well-known. Señora Peta is a founding member of the Mientras Tanto (in the meanwhile) Group “San Borja”. It was from this group that she received her first loan of S/.300.00 (about $101.00), which she used to buy a small calf and bull. She fattened them up, sold them, and little by little she purchased more animals. The most recent loan of S/. 1,000.00 (about $336) she received was from Manuela Ramos, with a four month payback period. She used that load to buy feed for her pigs and hogs, which she fattens in order to sell at New Year's celebrations. Señora Peta dreams of seeing her children grow up to be professionals and of buying a house in the city so that her kids could study and live there.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Peta, es así como le llaman la gente mas cercana, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Estudió secundaria completa; tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella. Se dedica a la crianza de distintos animales como vacas, terneras, cerdos y carneros los que sacrifica los fines de semana para vender y repartir su carne en Moche a sus clientes que a podido conseguir desde que empezó con este negocio; se ha hecho muy conocida por la calidad de carne que vende. La señora Peta es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” en él obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $101) con los que compró una ternera y 1 torito que aun estaban pequeños, los engordó y los vendió y así poco a poco ha comprado más animales. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 (aproximadamente $336) para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, le sirvió para comprar el alimento para sus cerdos y dos borregos, los cuales engordará para venderlos en las fiestas de fin de año. La señora Peta sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y con comprar una casa en la ciudad para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y vivir ahí.

loans.use:
Purchase of food for domestic animals.

Compra de alimentos para animales caseros.

loans.name: Rosa Linda

texts.en:
Rosa, 35, is known by the people of her community as a tireless and persistent woman. She always finds something to do in order to make things better. Her husband is a lieutenant and works in Santo Domingo, the capital.

Rosa runs a small cafeteria within her house that she started four years ago, with her husband’s help. She sells food in the morning and in the night. She also prepares natural juices, chocolate with milk, and sells energy drinks. She has a well-established clientele.

Rosa would like to have better location to run her enterprise. She dreams of having a big cafeteria which is very famous and profitable.

She will use her loan to buy drinks to supply her business, since she is short of beverages and people consume a lot of drinks. That way, she’ll better satisfy her customers’ needs and will have enough money to help her husband support her three children.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials and drinks to supply a small cafeteria

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 50-year-old widow. Her three grown-up children go to the university and have their own families. So, she is living alone.

Carmen recently started selling women’s clothing from her house. She says that earning money on her own and not being totally dependent on other people makes her feel autonomous and gives her more control of her budget.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk to sell during the Christmas period. Additional money will be used to help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.en:
María Magdalena is dedicated to selling fried plantains, maniocs, meat and natural juices. She is a very experienced businesswoman and has been running her business for more than five years. Her business is famous and she has a well-established clientele.

María Magdalena gets the vegetables from within the community, where there are a lot of fields; she gets the products for low prices because she buys big quantities of goods. However, she is currently short of enough products to satisfy all her customers' needs. She will invest the loan requested to get more raw materials to prepare the food. María Magdalena will also start to sell seven days a week. That way, she will be able to attend to more customers and increase her income so that she can better fend for her four children.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of raw materials to prepare food for a small business.

loans.name: Dominga Escolástico

texts.en:
Dominga defines herself as a goal-oriented, active and assiduous person.  She is 29 years old and has two sons, aged 9 and 7, that attend school.  Her husband works as truck driver for a company.
Dominga’s business consists of buying and reselling plots of land.  This is a new business for her, and she is rapidly learning how to be a good real estate agent. This entrepreneur graduated with studies in Computation Systems.  She is thinking about taking postgraduate classes.  She is requesting a loan of $300 so she can improve her business, continue caring for her family, and save money to further her studies.

loans.use: To purchase of pieces of land for resale

loans.name: Yunisi Mariel

texts.en: Yunisi is a young, active, open-minded, persistent and hard-working girl.  She is single and lives with her mother and five brothers and sisters.  Even though her parents work, they can’t bear all the expenses of such a large family.  Yunisi says it’s her responsibility to help her parents. Three months ago, she began selling gold-filled and silver-plated jewelry.  She sells her goods in the neighborhood and to her classmates and teachers at the public school she attends. Yunisi plans use her to put aside money so that she can go to the university in a year‘s time.  She is very confident and knows she will do well. The 18-year-old entrepreneur is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase of more jewelry with the aim of increasing her sales volume and earning the money for her education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He and his family live in Zaporozhye. Alexander works in the Osipenkovskyi market selling perfumes. He has been in this trade for 10 years and has gained rich experience as a private entrepreneur. Presently, Alexander has about $2400 in inventory. His turnover capital is about $1600, and his monthly net profit amounts to $1200.

Alexander is a very hard-working, hard-charging, and responsible businessman. He has great managerial skills which he applies to the familiar challenges of entrepreneurship and which have become the key to his business success. We believe that Alexander’s ability to build on his strengths and his commitment to his venture will help his business grow and allow him to continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Candina

texts.es:
Señora Candina is 41 years old and she lives in the Sector América of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. She only went to school for a year and does not know how to read or write; she provides for her 4 children. Señora Candina raises pigs and hogs and knits shawls, bags, etc. and sells them in the mountain part of Huamachuco. She from that part of the Sierra de La Libertad, but several years ago her children took her to live near the coast since she was having problems with her husband. One of her neighbors asked her to join the Mientras Tanto Group "San Borja." She joined but was wary at first. However, she is very grateful now and recognizes that the loans she has received have really helped improve her business. Her first loan was for S/.100.00 (about $34) and she used it to by yarn for making shawls. With the most recent loan from Manuela Ramos, S/.100.00 (roughly $201) with a four month pay period, she bought skeins of wool and feed for her animals. Señora Candina dreams of having a house in downtown Moche since the place where she lives now is very removed from the city.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Candina tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Solo tiene un año de estudio pero no sabe leer ni escribir; tiene 4 hijos los que aun dependen de ella. La señora Candina se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, cuyes y al tejido de chalinas, bolsas, chompas y los vende en la parte de la sierra en Huamachuco. Ella es de esta parte de la Sierra de La Libertad, pero hace varios años que sus hijos la trajeron a vivir a la costa debido a que tenía problemas con su esposo. Una vecina le invitó a formar parte del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” ingresó con mucha desconfianza pero ahora está muy agradecida y reconoce que los préstamos recibidos le han sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar en su negocio. Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.100.00 (aproximadamente $34) compró lana para tejer chompas y chalinas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00 (aproximadamente $201) para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, compró madejas de lana para poder tejer, y alimento para sus animales. La señora Candina sueña con tener su casa en la ciudad de Moche ya que el lugar donde actualmente vive está muy retirado de la ciudad.

loans.use:
Purchase of food for her animals. Purchase of wool for fabric.

Compra de alimento para animales caseros. Compra de lana para tejido.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey K. lives in Drogobych where he owns a resort complex with a sauna and a swimming pool. His hotel offers high quality service and relatively low prices which make it a desirable vacation destination for many tourists. Sergey has been in business since 2002. Currently, his gross income for the resort is about $7000 per month, and his net income is about $5000.

Sergey wants to complete some remodeling in parts of his resort complex and make it an even more comfortable getaway for families. Moreover, he wants to hire skillful employees with medical degrees to increase the range of physiotherapy treatment services he offers. We believe Sergey’s determination and passion for his business will help him concentrate his efforts and turn his resort place into a cozy retreat and successful business.

loans.use: To do remodeling and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has a son name Nikolai. She lives in Zaporozhye and sells trendy shoes in the Borodynskyi market. Tatyana has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has about $6000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $1200.

Tatyana wants to improve her living standards and open new vending facilities. She is a proactive entrepreneur and always takes every opportunity that comes her way. She knows that many of her customers have needs to be addressed, and she does her best to see and meet these needs. Tatyana is a responsible leader who knows how to keep the big picture in mind which characterizes her as an individual capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To open a new vending kiosk and increase her inventory

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Señora Charito from the Banco Comunual Shatojinas Laboriosas owns her own home-based business, located on the highway toward San Martín de Alao in the Shatoja district of El Dorado, San Martín. She sells groceries and clothing for men, women and children, and has been doing so for 12 years. With the loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 2,500.00 ($ 838.00), which will be paid off with six payments, she will buy different kinds and brands of noodles (08 packages), canned fish (04 boxes), bagged rice and sugar (02 bags of each product), liters of oil, eggs in crates, bread for daily sale and clothes for men, women and children. She is 38 years old, a mother of 2, and she hopes to continue expanding her business so that she can become more independent and thus provide jobs for other women. She is very pleased with what she has achieved since she is no longer financially dependent on her husband and can now make decisions.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Charito del Banco Comunal Shatojinas Laboriosas, tiene ubicado su negocio en un local propio en su misma casa, por la carretera a San Martín de Alao, distrito de Shatoja, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, viene desarrollando la actividad hace 12 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 838.00), el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (08 paquetes), conservas de pescado (04 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (02 sacos de cada producto), aceite en litro, huevos en jabas, pan para venta diaria y ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, 02 hijos y espera seguir creciendo en su negocio para así seguir siendo más independiente y de esta manera poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres. Se siente muy contenta de lo que ha logrado ya que hoy no depende económicamente de su esposo y puede tomar decisiones.

loans.use:
Purchase of various products (groceries).

Compra de productos variados (abarrotes).

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Señora Carolina belongs to Banco Comunal Las Samaritanas, and her business is located within her home. She lives in the Shatoja district of El Dorado, San Martín. She sells beauty products by catalog (Ebel, Avon) as well as groceries. She has been selling groceries for about 12 years and beauty products for 5 years. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos worth S/. 800.00 soles ($ 270.00), to be paid off in 6 payments, she will buy products that are high in demand in her area such as: different types and brands of pasta (2 packages), canned fish (2 boxes), bagged rice and sugar (1 bag of each), gallon- and liter-sized oil (to be sold retail); in addition to replenishing her stock of beauty products. She is 39 years old, has 2 daughters and a son. Her daughters are older and live on their own outside the city. Señora Carolina is grateful that she had the opportunity to raise them to be professionals, thanks to her and her husband’s efforts as well as her daughters' hard work and dedication. Their achievements show that their parents' sacrifice was worth it. She would like to exclusively increase her sales of beauty products, since with them she contributes to improving the local women's self esteem and personal care.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carolina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Samaritanas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa. Vive en el distrito de Shatoja, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo (Ebel, Avon) y también abarrotes, la venta de abarrotes la desarrolla desde hace 12 años aproximadamente y la venta de productos de belleza hace 05 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 soles ($ 270.00), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará algunos productos que son muy requeridos en la zona como: fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (02 paquetes), conservas de pescado (02 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 sacos de cada producto), aceite en galón (para su venta al menudeo) y en litros; además surtirá el stock de productos de belleza. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujeres y 01 varón, dos de ellas son mayores de edad y viven fuera de la ciudad, son independientes. La señora Carolina se siente orgullosa de la oportunidad que tuvo de hacerlas profesionales, gracias al esfuerzo de ella y su esposo y el de sus mismas hijas por poner empeño y dedicación demostrándoles así que valoran el sacrificio de sus padres. Desea crecer en la venta exclusiva de productos de belleza, ya que con ello aporta en su comunidad mejorando la autoestima y cuidado personal de las mujeres de su localidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of various products (groceries). Purchase of beauty products.

Compra de productos variados (abarrotes). Compra de productos de belleza.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es:
Señora Leonila belongs to the Mientras Tanto Group “Las Florcitas D. Progreso” and lives at Jr. Tacna Nº 135 in the San Martín region of San Martín, Tarapoto. Her business is located at Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 1130 (Paradero de Combis). She sells traditional foods like juanes, tamalitos and humitas and rents rooms in her house. At home, her mother helps her make the juanes, and thanks to the support from Manuela Ramos and the loans, she feels confident about taking on the high season for sales since she can buy bagged rice, utensils (plates, spoons, cups) and keep her clientele satisfied. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), which she will pay off in 4 months, she bought 3 bags of rice, plates, spoons and cups, and is also doing some repairs in the rooms she rents out. Señora Leonila is 56 years old. She is very pleased with her work since she only sells during the morning and can take care of her mother during the afternoon. She is an example of a woman that has always gotten ahead on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leonila pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Florcitas D. Progreso”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, con domicilio en el Jr. Tacna Nº 135. Su actividad económica la realiza en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 1130 (Paradero de Combis), se dedica a la venta de juanes, tamalitos y humitas, asimismo alquila cuartos al interior de su casa. En casa, le ayuda su mamá en la elaboración de los juanes, y gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, por medio de los préstamos, se siente segura para afrontar la temporada alta en la venta ya que puede comprar el arroz en sacos, los utensilios (platos, cucharas, vasos) y satisfacer a su clientela. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró 3 sacos de arroz, platos, cucharas y vasos, así también está realizando algunos arreglos en los cuartos que alquila. La señora Leonila, tiene 56 años, se siente muy contenta con la actividad que realiza ya que sólo vende por las mañanas y en las tardes le permite dedicarse a su mamá. Ella es un ejemplo de mujer que siempre ha salido adelante sola.

loans.use:
Purchase ingredients. Upkeep the rooms for rent.

Compra de insumos. Mantenimiento de habitaciones en alquiler.

loans.name: Virginia Antonia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and has five grown children.  The youngest is 20.  Her husband is a taxi driver and has his own car.  Money from the taxi driving is the principal source of income for the family.

Virginia is requesting a loan of $300 to make repairs on the taxi with which her husband earns the money to put food on their table.  Taxi driving is a very profitable business, and because she is helping her husband manage the finances of his business, the money he earns will go farther towards supporting the family and keep his taxi in good shape.

loans.use: To invest in car repairs for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Antonia Mota

texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and has four children (ages of 20, 18, 13 and 12).  They all attend school.

Antonia sells vegetables and ripe fruits, a business that has been her principal source of income for the past four years. She is requesting a loan of $225 to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits. This will enable her to supply more customers, earn more income, and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and ripe fruits for her produce business

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón is 36 years old and married to Mirta Pereira, 29, and together they have two children, who go to school and also help the family business by preparing and selling salted sandwiches and desserts for parties.

Ramón runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like milk, sugar, noodles, fruits and vegetables. He's been doing this for a little more than a year. Previously he worked at a shoe store, but he wasn't earning enough income so he decided to open his convenience store.

Ramón says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings, and now he's planning on selling larger quantities of all kinds of drinks like soft drinks, juices and beer, since summer is approaching and demand for cold drinks will rise considerably. The loan he's requesting well help him meet this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ramón F., tiene 36 años, es casado, su señora se llama Mirta Pereira de 29 años de edad, tienen 2 hijas, van al colegio y además ayudan con los ingresos familiares preparando y vendiendo bocaditos salados y dulces para fiestas.

El Sr. Ramón, administra el negocio familiar, que es una despensa, donde comercializan todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, fideos, frutas, verduras, etc. de esto hace un poco más de un año, ya que antes se dedicaba a la zapatería, pero como no dejaba buenas ganancias decidieron abrir una despensa.

Ramón nos cuenta que les va muy bien, el negocio genera buenas ganancias, y ahora tiene pensado adquirir en grandes cantidades bebidas de todo tipo como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, etc. ya que estamos en temporada de mucho calor y la demanda de bebidas frías aumenta considerablemente. El préstamo solicitado será utilizado para dicho fin.

loans.use: Purchase drinks like soft drinks, juices, mineral water, beer, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Seven months ago, this 20-year-old opened a small business preparing and selling sandwiches and hot dogs.  She lives with her 23-year-old partner and her two children.  María sells her sandwiches in a public place in the morning, and from her house in the afternoon.  Her partner helps her sometimes, taking the goods to his job and selling them to his coworkers.
Maria is requesting a loan of $250 to increase her sales.  With the loan, she will be able to purchase more foodstuffs and increase her output.  She will also buy fruits so she can prepare natural juices and expand her offerings to her customers.  Additional income will help the couple care for their children more easily.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to expand her food production business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, 32 years old, lives with her partner, a bus driver, and three children. She has been in the business of selling women's clothes for six months. Her new business has helped her family improve education and food for her children, and helped to pay rent on their apartment. She is requesting a loan of $250 so she can purchase more clothing in bulk and service more customers. This will provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to enlarge a business.

loans.name: Clemena

texts.en: Clemena is 20 years old and has three sons (ages 4, 2 and 1).  For over two years, she has been in the business of selling cake and natural fruit juice. Her weekly profit is $60.00. Her biggest overhead expense in this business is buying ice for the drinks. She is requesting a loan of $250 so she can purchase a used freezer, which will enable her to chill more beverages cheaply and earn more profit from her sales. It will also help her raise the income to take care of her sons and allow the eldest to begin school next year.

loans.use: To purchase a used freezer to keep drinks iced.

loans.name: Nuna

texts.en: Nuna is 22 years old and has four children (three boys and one girl).  Only the eldest goes to school.  Her husband works with dust carts to remove rubbish from the community. For more than five years, Nuna sold women’s clothing, but she had to close the business due to illness. Now she is ready to begin her business again, because her husband's income isn't enough to cover the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase initial stock of clothing and shoes. The additional income from her business will greatly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes to supply her business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is a 31-year-old single mother of two beautiful little girls, ages 2 and 5. She lives her mother along her two daughters.

Blanca currently runs a convenience store that she started in the year 2000 with a small amount of funds that her mother gave her to help her get started. Her mother works at a well-known hospital in the city.

Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her convenience store such as sugar, tea, oil, flour, cheese and noodles, so she can increase her inventory in time for the holiday season and new year's.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Blanca B. de 31 años de edad es madre soltera, de dos hijas hermosas niñas de 2 y 5 años respectivamente. Ella vive con su madre y sus dos hijas.

Blanca actualmente se encuentra al frente de una despensa, el cual lo había iniciado en el año 2.000 con un pequeño capital que le había entregado su mamá para ayudarla económicamente. Su madre es funcionaria de un reconocido hospital de la ciudad.

La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa, tales como azúcar, yerba mate, aceite, harina, queso y fideos. De este modo podrá aumentar su stock de mercaderías para estas fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, tea, oil, flour, cheese, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel R. is 44 years old, has been separated for 15 years, and has three children ages 28, 24, and 23. The oldest of her children is married and lives independently, the second lives and works outside the country, and the third is in the fourth year of law school.

Isabel began her furniture-making business in 2002 with the small savings that she had collected from her previous job. Currently she has a well-established clientele that come to her for her excellent craftsmanship and her great service. Among the projects that she works on are the following: toys (cars, trucks), chairs, stands, tables, etc.

Isabel is asking for a loan in order to purchase wood, paint and nails in order to make chairs and wooden trucks and thereby satisfy the great demand that she has for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel R. de 44 años de edad, separada hace 15 años, tiene tres hijos de 28, 24 y 23 años de edad. El mayor de ellos es casado y vive en forma independiente con su familia, el segundo vive y trabaja en el exterior y el último de ellos esta cursando el 4to. Año de la carrera Derecho (leyes).

Se inició en la fabricación de muebles en el año 2.002 con un pequeño ahorro que había juntado de su anterior trabajo, actualmente ya tiene su clientela bien formada, que recurren a ella por su excelente trabajo y su amable atención. Entre los trabajos que realiza podemos citar: juguetes (autos, camiones), sillas, reposeras, mesas, etc.

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas, pinturas y clavos, para realizar sillones y camiones de madera, y de esta forma satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene de estos productos.

loans.use: For the purchase of wood, nails, and paint.

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
The opportunities have never been scarce for Maria, who has worked incessantly in diverse trades to support her family. Maria has formed her own businesses depending on the occasion and the demands of the community. With her earnings she has been able to proviD. food for her two children and send them to school. They are now grown and have become productive members of the community. She feels happy that she has completed her work as a mom, although this job truly never ends because she will always be concerned for their wellbeing.

Now she finds herself in her home alone with the company of her husband who is also working every day with the objective of improving their family’s economic situation. This constantly motivates Maria to work hard and she decided to start a small business in her house breeding and raising pigs. She happily watches as the number of pigs increase. Because she now sells some of the piglets, she has been able to create a substantial and stable source of income that she uses to support herself and her husband.

Maria now wants to improve the area where she raises her pigs and also improve the quality of feed that they receive. Her goal is to increase her profits and to breed and raise even more pigs.

Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

Translated from Spanish by Ally, Nikki and Tommy of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Las oportunidades nunca son escasas para Marina, ya que siempre ha trabajado en diversos oficios para sostener a su familia, durante mucho tiempo fue formando sus propios negocios D. acuerdo a la ocasión y a la demanda D. su querida comunidad y con éstas les pudo brindar educación y alimentación a sus dos hijos que ahora se han convertido en hombres D. bien. Ella se siente muy satisfecha D. haber cumplido con su labor D. madre, aunque este rol no culmine jamás y siempre este pendiente D. su bienestar.

Ahora se encuentra en su hogar únicamente en compañía D. su esposo y ambos trabajan día a día con el objetivo D. incrementar su nivel D. vida. Este hecho la anima constantemente y ha decidido emprender su pequeña empresa en casa criando cerditos y observa con gran alegría el incremento del número D. estos ya que los comercializa cuando aún están pequeñitos y D. esa manera logra sustanciales ingresos económicos para sostenerse.

Desea mejorar las instalaciones D. su criadero y elevar su nivel D. alimentación con el objetivo D. incrementar sus ganancias y el número D. los mismos.

Apoyemos a esta mujer esforzada y hábil a conseguir lo que se propone.

loans.use: Increase the nutrients in her daily animal feed and improve the space that she uses to raise her piglets.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia’s desire of improving her life has endowed her with many abilities. Day after day she works incessantly selling food and managing her little grocery kiosk, which is installed on the corner in her hometown of Saños Grande, so that she may offer daily food to her family. When she was eighteen, her mother granted her so many lessons and developed in her sales talents. Celia feels very satisfied to be an important provider for the household economy and she works hard to support the wellbeing of her family. Her oldest son would like to contribute to her goal by adding a bakery in her little stand to supply fresh bread daily. They plan to continue working to save up and make their new investment idea happen.

For this goal, Celia requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of everyday goods. Support Celia; she awaits your important decision.

Translated from Spanish by Jian and Ryan of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Los deseos de superación de Celia la han dotado de muchas habilidades. Día a día trabaja incesantemente para poder brindarle el sustento a su familia vendiendo comidas y atendiendo su pequeño kiosco de abarrotes instalado en una esquina de su comunidad natal de Saños Grande, desde hace dieciocho años, cuando su mamá le otorgó estas enseñanzas y desarrolló en ella la habilidad comercial. Celia se siente muy satisfecha de ser una protagonista importante en la economía de su hogar y se esfuerza por mantener el bienestar dentro de su hogar. Su hijo mayor deseoso de contribuir con esta tarea le ha propuesto implementar una panadería en su pequeña vivienda para abastecer a su localidad con el pan diario y se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para ahorrar y con ello emprender la materialización de su nueva inversión.

Con este fin solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad; apoya a Celia, ella aguarda tu importante respuesta.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of groceries.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza very much wishes to improve her current situation because she wants to give her two children the possibility to attend university so that they can have a better future. What she learned herself has helped her to improve her family's situation and to help her husband in his sales of firewood.

She decided to raise chickens in her home in order to commercialize their sales and has recently begun to implement a space to raise hogs as well, with the goal of being able to save money and in the future be able to practice her profession as a seamstress she learned while working in a tailor shop and to purchase the tools and equipment she would need for such a business. While she continues to raise chickens to sell in the local market, her current goal is to increase and improve her chicken coop and increase the investment capital in her husband's business, with the goal of contributing to the career goals of their children, as well as improving her family's standard of living. We ask on behalf of this selfless mother for your support to help her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Maritza tiene muchos deseos de superación porque quiere otorgarles a sus dos hijos la posibilidad de acceder a la universidad con el objetivo de forjarse un futuro mejor. Lo que aprendió le ha valido para sacar adelante a su familia y su esposo por su parte contribuye con la venta de leña. Decidió criar pollos en su casa para comercializarlos y hace poco ha empezado a implementar su criadero de cerdos, esto con el propósito de ahorrar y a futuro ejercer el noble oficio que aprendió durante su experiencia de trabajo en un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, aunque para ello falta mucho sigue proyectándose y planea poco a poco comprar lo necesario para implementar su taller. Mientras tanto seguirá dedicándose a la crianza de pollos para comercializarlos en el mercado local, su pronta necesidad es implementar y mejorar su granja de pollos e incrementar el capital de inversión del negocio de su esposo con el objetivo de seguir contribuyendo con el desarrollo de las metas que se han trazado sus hijos, además de incrementar su nivel de vida familiar. Hagamos que el noble propósito de esta abnegada madre pueda convertirse en realidad.

loans.use: To improve her space in which she raises chickens and an increase in investment capital for the small business her husband runs.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
The good seasoning that Marisol uses daily for her family has become an aid in economic success that sustains she and her family. Thirteen years from when she first married, she saw the need to begin to contribute to the household income in order to support her family. Her mother-in-law, understanding this need, gave Marisol a position working at a chicken fighting ring, with the goal of holding a comfortable and agreeable job. Today, she has become one of the best anticucheras cooks in her region and would like to continue working in this field. Every night she prepares everything in order to start her sales and she washes her grill very well at the end of every day as well. Day after day she sees her business growing and she feels very satisfied, because she can support her two children comfortably without any great difficulties. Marisol has great dreams and one of those is the future opening of a touristic restaurant and is certain she would be very successful.

Today, she not only works selling anticuchos but also has a cow at her home from which she is able to give her family daily milk. She wishes to improve her business selling anticuchos and asks for this loan with the objective to obtain the sum requested in order to construct her dream little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

L. buena sazón D. Marisol siempre ha sido resaltante en su familia y esta cualidad hoy L. sostiene económicamente. Hace trece años desD. que se casó observó L. necesidad D. un sustento adicional para sostener satisfactoriamente a su familia y su suegra pendiente D. este hecho le cedió el puesto que tenía en un coliseo D. pelea D. gallos con el objetivo D. que se desempeñe en un oficio cómodo y agradable.Hoy se ha convertido en una D. las mejores anticucheras D. su zona y piensa seguir dedicándose a esta actividad. Cada noche prepara todos los implementos para iniciar su venta y lava muy bien su parrilL. al término D. su jornada. Día a día su negocio va prosperando y se siente satisfecha D. ello, porque pueD. otorgarle a sus dos hijos el sustento diario sin ninguna dificultad.Marisol tiene grandes anhelos y entre ellos está el D. aperturar a futuro un restaurante turístico que D. seguro será un éxito. Actualmente no sólo se dedica a L. venta D. anticuchos también en su casa tiene una vaca para que pueda brindarles diariamente leche a su familia. Desea mejorar su negocio D. venta D. anticuchos y apeL. a tu noble corazón con el objetivo D. obtener L. suma que solicita para construir poco a poco el sueño que tiene en mente.

loans.use: Implementation and purchase of new utensils in order to continue with her business selling anticuchos ( beef heart fried over a grill).

loans.name: Angélica Yanet

texts.es:
The love of a mother is an irrepressible and intense emotion for Angelica, who works very hard to try to offer her two small children the best. They are her reason and motivation in life. And so, she took advantage of the opportunity to install a business in her own home. She decided to purchase a photocopier that her sister-in-law offered to sell to her. Her progress in this business has been very satisfying. Nevertheless, there is plenty of competition and this means that she must be diligent in the up-keep of her business. She has plans to improve her services in her small establishment, repairing her photo-copy machine as well as the customer space. Afterwards, she would like to work independently in her trained profession as a social worker.

While she continues to work with the photocopier she also has a farm of guinea pigs and chickens. She began this farm with only a small number of animals and would very much like to see their number and variety grow. Angelica is asking for a loan in order to invest in her farm and photocopy business so that she can buy feed and repair her photocopy machine. Your support would be a significant and important contribution to Angelica's businesses and growth.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El amor de madre es un sentimiento incontenible e inmenso para Angélica, que se esfuerza para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos que son toda su razón y motivación de vida. Así aprovechó la oportunidad de instalar un negocio en su propia casa cuando; decidió comprar la fotocopiadora que ofertaba su cuñada. Su desenvolvimiento en esta ocupación está siendo muy satisfactoria; sin embargo existe actualmente mucha competencia y esto le exige ser más diligente en esta labor; tiene planes de mejorar los servicios de su pequeño establecimiento, reparando su máquina y el espacio en el que atiende a sus clientes, posteriormente piensa ejercer de manera independiente su profesión de trabajadora social. Mientras tanto seguirá trabajando con la fotocopiadora y también en su reciente granja de cuyes y pollos, iniciada con un pequeño número con el inmenso deseo de acrecentar la cantidad y variedad de los mismos. Ahora Angélica solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de hojas y el mantenimiento de su máquina fotocopiadora. Tu apoyo será muy significativo e importante para Angélica.

loans.use: To purchase paper and to repair a photocopier.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Maria is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked very hard at the various jobs she learned over the years, especially after her five daughters left home. She maD. the decision to receive training at an agricultural training center in her town, so that she could learn how to begin raising guinea pigs in her small house.

After many years of hard work and dedication, she can now see the fruits of her labor. The number of guinea pigs has increased rapidly and they keep getting bigger and more beautiful. She feeds them alfalfa, which she grows on her land, so that they can receive the best nutrition. She dreams of eventually becoming one of the best guinea pig exporters. To achieve this, she needs to improve her operation. She plans to use a large portion of the land she cultivates to expand the guinea pig business. So that she might begin this project soon, she turns to you for your good-hearted help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria, es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja diligentemente en los diversos oficios que aprendió con el paso D. los años; después D. que sus cinco bellas hijas se marcharon para forjar su propio futuro. Entonces fue que decidió preparase en un centro D. instrucción agrícola y ganadera D. su ciudad para instalar un criadero D. cuyes en su pequeña casa. Luego D. muchos años D. esfuerzo y dedicación hoy pueD. observar los frutos D. este labor, ya que el número D. cuyes que mantiene en casa se incrementa rápidamente y cada vez son más grandes y hermosos; ella les proporciona la alfalfa que cultiva en los terrenos que posee a fin D. que estos puedan recibir el mejor nutriente.Sueña con ser en un futuro una D. las mejores exportadoras D. cuyes y para ello necesita mejorar su granja y ha pensado utilizar un amplio espacio D. su terreno D. cultivo para implementarla y para que este anhelo se cristalice pronto acuD. en ayuda D. tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: To build a new space for raising guinea pigs with the goal of becoming one of the largest and best guinea pig exporters.

loans.name: Gilberto Félix

texts.es:
Gilberto is a young man with a great desire to get ahead in life. He is trying to get a start in life and save money so that he will be able to marry. He realizes that when this happens, he will be the principal income earner for his family, so he is preparing himself to assume that role. He has been working in agriculture for the past four years and, at the moment, he is working his parent’s land. Little by little, by working in each planting season and harvest season, he is saving his money so that he can eventually buy a large and fertile piece of land.

He lives in his parent’s house and shares the humble home with his mother, two younger brothers, and one of his sisters, who has a baby. He is in charge of the providing for them because of his father’s absence. The fields still aren’t completely planted due to the lack of capital for making investments. For this reason, he is hoping for help from your generous heart so that he can receive the loan amount he has requested for the purpose of buying a greater amount of seed and fertilizers. His goal is to increase his income, for the wellbeing of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilberto, es un joven con inmensas ganas de superación, está emprendiendo un prominente proyecto para formalizar su hogar posteriormente, él reconoce que cuando este hecho suceda se convertirá en el principal sustento de su familia y se está preparando asumiendo desde ya a cabalidad este rol.Desde hace cuatro años viene dedicándose a labor agrícola y por el momento está trabajando las tierras de sus padres; poco a poco con su desempeño en cada época de siembra y cosecha está ahorrando para adquirir un terreno de cultivo extenso y fértil. Aún vive en la casa de sus padres y comparte las humildes instalaciones de su hogar con su madre, dos de sus hermanos menores y una de sus hermanas con un pequeño bebé, él está a cargo de su manutención y bienestar por la ausencia de su padre. Los campos aún no están cultivados en su totalidad por la falta de capital de inversión, a raíz de este hecho solicita la ayuda de tu generoso corazón para obtener la suma que solicita y adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener mayores ganancias para el bienestar de su querida familia.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sandra Medali

texts.es:
Sandra is a young mother with a great desire to get ahead in life. Due to pressing economic need, her husband had to leave to work far from home; Sandra now lives with her mother and her two year-old daughter. Faced with this situation, three years ago she decided to take the initiative and dedicate herself to agricultural work. In spite of the long hours of work, it gives her strength when she sees her daughter full of life and well fed. She has decided to continue working to assure herself of a better future.

She is currently planting potatoes, olluco (a starchy tuber similar to a potato), wheat, and fava beans. At harvest time she sells to middle men; this does not provide her much in the way of profit, however, and so she is considering joining with some of her neighbors to sell things directly by taking them to Lima. While waiting for harvest time, she is working at raising animals. It is necessary for her to optimize the quality of her products, and so she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers. Let’s help this young mother to keep working for the wellbeing of her mother and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra, es una joven madre con muchos deseos de salir adelante; por la necesidad económica apremiante que afrontaba su hogar, su esposo tuvo que salir a trabajar lejos y ahora ella vive en compañía de su madre y su pequeña de dos años. Frente a esta situación ella decidió tomar la iniciativa y dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas desde hace tres años; a pesar de las duras horas de labor que ha emprendido le fortalece ver a su pequeña llena de vida y bien alimentada. Se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para asegurarle un futuro mejor; por el momento está sembrando papa, olluco, trigo y habas, cuando cosecha los vende a intermediarios; este hecho no le brinda muchas ganancias y por ello está pensando en asociarse con varios de sus vecinos para poder venderlos directamente llevándolos a Lima. Mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha se está dedicando a la crianza de animales.Le es necesario optimizar la calidad de sus productos y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes. Ayudemos a esta joven madre deseosa de seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su madre e hijita..

loans.use: To buy fertilizer so that she can optimize the quality of her products.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is 55 years old and has been married for 33 of those to Guillerma López, 52. They have six children, two of whom are married, one who is living abroad, and the other three still live with them. One of their children who lives at home is paralyzed from a soccer accident.

Thirty-three years ago, Ricardo was employed at a private business and, at the same time, was taking a carpentry course that lasted six months. At the end of it, he decided to start his own business with the little savings he had from his work.

Ricardo is very proud of his business because with it he can provide for his family. He's requesting a loan to purchase wood, nails and glue because he has been given a large order and needs these materials to begin the labor.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Ricardo O. de 55 años de edad esta casado hace 33 años con la señora Guillerma López de 52 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados, uno de ellos se encuentra viviendo en el exterior y los tres últimos aún viven con ellos. Uno de sus hijos que vive con ellos quedó paralítico cuando practicaba football (soccer).

Hace 33 años, Don Ricardo, era empleado de una empresa privada, al mismo tiempo seguía un curso para carpinteros que duró 6 meses, al final de este curso decidió emprender su propio negocio con un poco de ahorro que había juntado de su anterior trabajo.

Ricardo se encuentra muy orgulloso de su trabajo, ya que con el puede solventar los gastos de la familia. El hoy solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, clavos, pegamento ya que ha recibido un pedido grande y necesita de estos materiales para empezar su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, glue, etc.

loans.name: Petronilda

texts.es:
Petronilda is 44-years-old, married and lives with their four children in their own home. Her husband, Isabelino, is 50 and his work requires him to travel to the country, leaving Petronilda to take care of the home.

Petronilda runs the family business, renting tables, chairs, tablecloths among other items out for social events, and also makes decorations and sells all kinds of food for parties.

The business is going well. Petronilda says that the most difficult thing to overcome was a fire that destroyed the food supply and curtailed business operations. But little by little they restocked the business with a lot of hard work. The experience has strengthened her and united the family. Now, with more faith than fear, they have decided to enlarge the business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La sra. Petronilda M., tiene 44 años, es casada, su marido se llama Isabelino y tiene 50 años de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa propia. Su esposo viaja de forma permanente al interior del país, por tanto la responsabilidad del hogar lo asume Petronilda.

Petronilda administra el negocio familiar que es el de servicios de alquileres de mesas, sillas, manteles entre otros, para eventos sociales, también realizan decoraciones y comercializan todo tipo de insumos para fiestas.

El negocio marcha muy bien, ella nos cuenta que el momento más difícil que atravesaron fue un incendio que sufrió el depósito de sus insumos y que destruyó totalmente los activos del negocio. Poco a poco fueron reponiendo todo el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Esta experiencia les fortaleció y unió como familia, ahora con más fé que temores, deciden ampliar el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, tablecloths, silverware, etc.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio is 47 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. He runs a convenience store where he sells all kinds of much-needed items such as fruits, vegetables, noodles, rice, sugar, coffee, snacks, and juices and beverages.

Previously Basilio had a tire shop at one of the busiest areas of the city, but because the work required him to be there almost 24 hours of the day and the earnings weren't great, he opened up his convenience store with his savings. He's very happy with his business, since it generates good income and allows him to spend more time with his family.
