Tepalua has been selling her handicrafts to shops around town, but she wasn’t making enough money, especially with the cost of transportation from her village to town.  With her first loan, she was able to open her own handicrafts shop.  This is Tepalua's second loan and her business is progressing well.  She is planning to open a flea market stall where she could sell more handicrafts and other varieties of Samoan products.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa always had an enormous desire to help with her family’s economic well-being, particularly since the income of her husband, a mototaxi driver, was not enough to cover the daily expenses of the household. In this way, this noble mother began to sell candy in Santa Ana Park in her town, dividing her time between her job and the daily activities of motherhood. Her eight-year-old son, who has devoted himself to helping the family alongside his mother, energetically helps her with her candy sales. All their hard work is done with the goal of purchasing a mototaxi vehicle that will yield economic benefits to support their beloved son, a son who is always ready to help. Our economic support will be a great investment in the hands of this upright mother; she requests this loan to continue building her dreams, and only hopes that you won’t deny your support to this family.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen Rosa, siempre tuvo el inmenso deseo de colaborar económicamente con el bienestar de su familia, ya que el dinero proporcionado por su esposo, que es chofer de mototaxi, muchas veces no era suficientes para satisfacer los gastos diarios que demandaba su hogar, es así que esta noble madre empezó a vender dulces en el parque de Santa Ana de su localidad, compartiendo su tiempo entre esta labor y el de sus actividades cotidianas de madre. En la venta de golosinas la ayuda de manera muy animosa su pequeño hijito de ocho años, quien junto a su madre se ha comprometido con el desarrollo de su familia.Todo este esfuerzo lo realiza con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un vehículo mototaxi, con cuyos beneficios económicos seguirá brindando apoyo a su querido hijo que siempre ha estado presto a ayudarla.Nuestro apoyo económico será una gran inversión en las manos de esta noble madre es por ello que solicita un préstamo para seguir con sus sueños y sólo espera de ti no lo dude apoye a esta familia.

loans.use: Acquisition of wider quantity and variety of candy.

loans.name: Juana Elza

texts.es:
Elza is a hard-working, vigorous woman from a large and humble family. The tough nature of her life made her realize very early on the value of hard work; thanks to this lesson, she gets along well in the various activities that she’s worked at throughout her life. Currently, she devotes herself to raising and selling young animals and to agriculture. She works out of her home, and with her income she is able to provide a higher quality of life to her son, her greatest joy in life ever since her husband left her as the sole provider of the household. She is requesting a loan to purchase more small animals so that she can sell them once they reach adequate weight. With this investment, she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s get behind the plans of this selfless mother.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elza es una mujer vigorosa y trabajadora, proviene de una familia amplia y humilde, el carácter duro y dificultoso de la vida hizo que conociera desde muy pequeña el valor significativo del trabajo, gracias a eso ella se desenvuelve sin ningún problema en diversas actividades que le ha tocado realizar durante su vida; actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animalitos y a las labores agrícolas, estos trabajos los realiza en su pequeña casita y con el ingreso que le genera le brinda una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, quien es su mayor alegría ya que su esposo la abandonó y ella se convirtió en el único sostén de su hogar. Solicita un préstamo para comprar más animalitos pequeños para luego venderlos cuando alcancen un peso adecuado, así mismo con esta inversión podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias e incrementará su calidad de vida. Solidaricémonos con el propósito de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity and variety of small animals to sell at market when they reach maturity.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
In the Peruvian jungle, there is a great quantity and variety of wood, and since ancient times, this blessing from Nature has motivated Peruvian artisans to use this material to create a variety of products. Don Franco P. is one of these diligent men that use the experience he has acquired since childhood to create high-quality works. With his wife’s help, these works are frequently requested by other citizens of his town as well as by the visitors that arrive in large numbers.

His efforts are motivated by the desire to provide his family with a better future, even in the midst of the poverty that often lashes at his community. To do this, he must leave the city and work far from his loved ones, leaving the storefront and running of the home to his beloved wife, who has diligently taken on the role as both head of household and of the business her husband began.

She has contributed enormously to the growth of the business and has provided innumerable novel ideas for its reinforcement. Without a doubt, their greatest wish is to have a little house where they and their children can live; they are requesting your help to solidify their goals. Let’s all contribute to this noble cause.

Franco was not present when Prisma representatives visited him. As such, his wife is pictured here.

Translate from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

En la selva peruana existe gran cantidad y diversidad de madera y desde tiempos antiguos este beneficio de la naturaleza ha motivado a los artesanos peruanos a utilizar este material en la realización de variados productos. Don Franco P., es uno de estos diligentes hombres que utiliza toda su experiencia adquirida desde niño para elaborar trabajos de gran calidad, en compañía de su querida esposa, que son muy solicitados por los propios pobladores de su localidad y por los visitantes que llegan en gran número. Su gran esfuerzo lo realiza con el propósito de brindar a su familia un futuro mucho mejor en medio de la pobreza que muchas veces es un azote constante en su comunidad; por ello tuvo que salir fuera y trabajar en la ciudad lejos de sus seres queridos dejando al frente de su negocio y conducción de su hogar a su querida esposa; quien diligentemente ha asumido este rol familiar y las riendas del negocio que emprendió su esposo. Ella ha contribuido enormemente con el crecimiento del negocio y ha aportado innumerables y novedosas ideas para su consolidación. Sin duda su mayor anhelo es tener una casita, en donde poder habitar junto a sus hijos y solicita vuestra ayuda para concretar sus metas.Contribuyamos todos con esta noble causa.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity and variety of raw materials to continue making his fine wooden crafts.

loans.name: Faalotoina

texts.en: Faalotoina is a 30 year old mother and is married with 9 children.  Her family lives on their plantation, which is also their main source of income.  Her husband is a farmer and he has been very supportive in taking care of the family.  Faalotoina heard of SPBD through the village women and she decided to do something to make use of her time.  Her parents used to run a shop, but when the father passed away two years ago, it was closed down.  With her first loan, she renovated the shop and started it up again.  Her shop is now running well and she hopes to expand it using this loan (her second).  She is very thankful for the help of SBPD which has helped her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Her hard-working and energetic business spirit urged Benedicta to open a small shop where she sells sweets and beverages in her town’s plaza. She sells a wide variety of products to the crowds that pass through the city’s main streets every day. Both natives and tourists of the city frequently travel through Santa Ana plaza, where her store is located; realizing this, Benedicta’s wish is to broaden and increase the variety of her merchandise, so that she can provide better and more complete services to her customers. Having done this, she hopes to open a food store in the same area in the future. To reach this goal, she is turning to your selfless support and requesting a loan that she will invest in widening and broadening her stock of merchandise so that she can improve her family’s economic situation a little at a time and, above all, support her youngest daughter with her education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Su espíritu de trabajo y su animosidad en el comercio, impulsaron a Benedicta a abrir un pequeño puestito de venta de dulces y bebidas en la plaza de su localidad, en el que ofrece variedad de productos para la multitud de personas que transitan diariamente por las calles principales de su ciudad.La plaza de Santa Ana, lugar en que el está ubicado su acogedora tiendita, es muy concurrida y visitada por los pobladores y también por los turistas, esto ha sido muy bien percibido por Benedicta, razón por la cual su deseo es ampliar y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, con el afán de brindar un mejor y completo servicio a sus visitantes; para que en el futuro pueda aperturar un puesto de comida en esta misma zona. Para alcanzar este propósito recurre a vuestro apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo que los invertirá para ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería y así poco a poco busca mejorar su situación económica familiar y sobre todo apoyar a su hija menor en su formación académica.

loans.use: Purchase greater variety and quantity of products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a self-employed, single lady from the village of Vavau.  Her business is a retail shop that is located in her village.  Itagia has chosen to do this business because she experienced that there are not that many shops in her village, and so, with her coming into the market, there will be good competition.  Her business has become really successful that she is now making a clear profit of 600 Tala ($240 USD) a week.  Itagia will continue with her business and aims to keep offering better prices and the best service to her customers.  With her requested loan, she wants to restock her shop because she believes that there will be more customers during Christmas and New Year’s time.

loans.use: To buy inventory to restock her shop

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en: Karoline is an old member of SPBD.  Her husband is a security officer earning 100 Tala (USD $40) per week.  Karoline was born in the village and has always been a village lady.  Her husband has a heart problem and he’s not a strong man, which means he misses going to work most of the time. This is the reason why Karoline joined the program, so that she can have financal support to start up her business, help out her husband in supporting her family, and be able to earn profit.  Karoline’s four children are all attending village school, and she’s aiming to save up so that she can send them to better schools and also provide them with their school needs.  With her requested loan, she aims to improve her business and save money for their children’s future.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura worked for many years in a “maquiladora” (factory/assembly plant) but, unfortunately, she lost her job during personnel layoffs at the business. Nevertheless, with the bonus/severance she received as a result, she was able to purchase a sewing machine and start building a customer base. At first, she focused solely on hemming or repairing clothes. She gained the confidence of her customers and today they ask her to make skirts and shorts for them, among other things. However, her sewing machine broke and now she cannot work the way she needs to.

She is asking for a loan of $475USD to be repaid over a five-month term. With this money she will be able to purchase materials such as thread, buttons, fabrics, remnants, and other items she needs to make clothes. With your support, Laura and her children will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura trabajó durante muchos años en una maquiladora desgraciadamente hubo un recorte de personal en su empresa y se quedó sin trabajo. Sin embargo con el dinero que le dieron de aguinaldo se compró una máquina de coser y ahí fue como comenzó a adquirir clientes, primero lo único que hacía eran dobleces a la ropa, o arreglarlos, sin embargo después fue adquiriendo la confianza de sus clientes y hoy ya le encargan hacer faldas, shorts entre otras cosas. Sin embargo tiene una máquina de coser que se descompuso y por lo tanto ahora no puede trabajar como necesita.

Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US 475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Laura podrá comprar materiales como, hilos, botones, telas, retazos, y otras cosas que necesita para poder elaborar las prendas. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies to make clothes.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia has four children two of whom, the oldest, are married. The younger ones still live with her and are in school. Clemencia’s husband is a bricklayer and, as such, experiences long periods of time without work as demand for his skill is dictated by the start of a construction project in their area. Clemencia has always wanted her children to study and to get ahead and, for this reason, she began selling natural health products. She gathered customers among family members and the word spread. Today, she enjoys a larger group of customers who want her products.

Despite this, basic living expenses deplete the family’s funds and she does not have enough to purchase additional merchandise. For this reason, she asks for a loan of $475USD which she is prepared to repay over a five-month term. This loan would help her to buy more products, leading to happy customers and more positive referrals for her business. With your assistance, Clemencia will be able to help her children study and pursue their own careers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Clemencia tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos, las mayores, ya están casadas y los más pequeños viven con ella todavía y están estudiando, el esposo de Clemencia es albañil y por lo tanto dura largas temporadas sin trabajo, puesto que esto se los dan cada que hay una obra nueva en su localidad. Sin embargo Clemencia siempre a querido que sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante, es por eso que ella comenzó a vender productos naturistas y empezó a juntar clientes de su familia y la voz se fue pasando hoy tiene un grupo de clientes más grande que le piden productos.

Sin embargo a veces los gastos en su casa son muchos y no le alcanza para poder comprar nueva mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y este dinero le servirá para poder comprar más mercancía y con esto tener a sus clientes satisfechos y obtener buenas referencias de clientes. Con tu ayuda Clemencia podrá ayudar a que sus hijos estudien una carrera.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a new member, and is very happy with the financial support SPBD has provided for her and the family.  She’s a twenty nine year old mother of five children and has already planned their future and is trying hard to work towards achieving it.  Three of her children are now in primary school and the other two are not.  Her husband is self employed in their business, and also has a part time job as a bus driver when he’s needed.  Eseta has experienced a big change in their family, seeing her children happy and healthy, and is capable of doing much better if she keeps her business going well.  With her requested loan, she aims to buy more taro tops to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Lasela

texts.en: Fourty four year old Lasela S. owns a small grocery shop in the village of Lotofaga Alasopo.  Her husband, like her, is also unemployed, but works on the small family taro plantation to earn extra income for their family.  She’s a new member to the program and has an existing shop, but has decided to join SPBD to get financial support for improving her business.  With their combined current income they are able to send their five children to school.  With this loan, she aims to buy more products to sell and extend her shop.  She hopes that any future success will allow her family to live more comfortably, as well as send her children to university.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva G. is a woman who, despite the problems she has faced, has figured out how to take advantage of a situation, learn from past mistakes, and focus on work and getting ahead. Minerva’s husband has a job that is not very secure. At times he may have a great deal of work, and at other times no work at all. Their family’s living expenses continue, however, and don’t stop simply because work and money are scarce. Therefore, she endeavored to begin selling plastic goods for the home. Offering a few items, she began looking for customers among friends and neighbors. She has slowly built a customer base that, thanks to her dedicated work ethic, also recommends her to others.

Regardless, her customers are requesting products that she does not currently have in stock and that she cannot afford to buy. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $550USD which she is prepared to repay over a period of four months. With these funds, she would be able to purchase the merchandise that is in demand during this season. With your support, Minerva would be able to grow her business and help her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Minerva G., es una mujer que a pesar de los problemas a los que se a enfrentado últimamente a sabido aprovechar y aprender de los errores para ponerse a trabajar y salir adelante. El esposo de Minerva tiene un trabajo que no es muy seguro puesto que hay ocasiones en que puede tener mucho trabajo y en otras que no. Es por eso y porque los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos no esperan a que consiga trabajo nuevamente el esposo de Minerva. Por lo tanto comenzó a vender productos de plásticos para el hogar. Y así ofreciendo pocos comenzó a buscar clientes entre sus amigos y vecinos, y después fue haciéndose de más y más clientes que la fueron recomendando gracias a su trabajo dedicado.

Sin embargo sus clientes le están solicitando unos pedidos de productos que ella no cuenta en este momento y tampoco cuenta con dinero para poder comprarlos. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Minerva podrá comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando para esta temporada. Con tu ayuda Minerva podrá crecer su negocio y así sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario Velásquez is a woman who very much likes to get ahead to improve her family’s standard of living. To this end, she began seeking work to help her husband meet their living expenses. With time passing, and her efforts not resulting in getting hired, she started to investigate how to start her own business without the need to invest substantial funds. She began by selling natural products, later expanding her inventory to include novelties such as sandals and combs, among other things. Little by little, she began selling her goods among friends and family.

Regardless, Rosario’s struggle continues as customers demand more products and she tries to reduce the wait time between when she can purchase more items for her inventory. For this reason, Rosario is asking for a loan of $550USD to be repaid over a period of four months. With these funds, Rosario would be able to purchase additional natural products and novelty items so that her customers have more merchandise from which to choose. With your support, Rosaria will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario Velásquez es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y sacar a su familia adelante para que ésta tenga un mejor nivel de vida. Por lo tanto comenzó a buscar trabajo para así poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Sin embargo la búsqueda fue fallida, puesto que pasaba el tiempo y nadie la contrataba. Por lo tanto comenzó a ver de qué manera ella podría iniciar un negocio sin la necesidad de invertir grandes cantidades de dinero y fue así que comenzó por vender productos naturistas y después incrementó su repertorio ofreciendo novedades como sandalias, peinetas, entre otras cosas. Poco a poco comenzó a vender entre sus familiares y amigos.

Sin embargo la lucha continúa y los clientes cada vez van pidiendo más y más cosas y tratando de reducir los tiempos de espera para que les llegue sus productos es por eso que Rosario está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Rosario podrá comprar más productos naturistas y novedades para que sus clientes puedan tener de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Rosario podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Purchase novelties/merchandise for customers.

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie P. is a very energetic mother running her own taro plantation business.  She’s fifty eight years old and has eight children.  Her husband is a strong man who works hard supporting her with their business and praising how lucky he is to have married Faasuamalie.  With her requested loan, she plans to do maintenance to their old fale (a traditional Samoan house) that they have been staying at for more than thirty years now.  She sells taros two days a week and earns the equivalent of USD $80-$100 a week.  She has fully paid back her previous loan with no difficulties and is now requesting a new loan.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and for home improvements

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a forty four year old mother of 8 from the village of Nuusuatia.  Luisa’s husband works as a farmer, but his wages are insufficient to support his wife and kids.  Therefore, Luisa has requested a loan to help purchase supplies such as fishing nets, fertilizers, fishing hooks and other needed materials.  The purpose of the loan is to improve her fishing business and plantation, which will eventually result in enough profit to nurture her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, chemicals for her plantation, and for home improvements

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo E. is an example of the type of person who cannot sit by and do nothing. It has been thirteen years since he retired and, instead of staying home and relaxing, he began looking for a way to start his own auto repair shop/garage. He set up a small space and, with few tools and resources, began to build a customer base that helps simultaneously to recommend his services to others.

Arturo is asking for a $925USD loan, to be repaid over a period of six months, to outfit a new space for his business. His current space is still very small, making it difficult for him to work on the cars. With your help, Arturo will be able to make the most of his passion for mechanical work, be able to offer more to his family, and not have to rely solely on his pension for income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Arturo E. es un ejemplo de las personas que no pueden estar sin hacer nada. Hace 13 años se jubiló y en lugar de quedarse sentado en su casa Arturo comenzó a buscar la manera de hacer su propio taller de reparación de carros. Por lo tanto acondicionó un pequeño espacio, con un poco de herramientas y refracciones fue que consiguió clientes y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes que le piden los trabajos y al mismo tiempo lo recomiendan con sus amigos.

Arturo está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Arturo podrá adecuar otro espacio. Puesto que en el que todavía está es muy pequeño y no puede maniobrar bien con lo carros. Con tu ayuda Arturo podrá sacar provecho de lo que tanto le gusta la mecánica, y al mismo tiempo podrá tener algo que ofrecerle a su familia. Y no sólo vivir de lo que le dan como pensión.

loans.use: Rent a larger space for auto repair shop.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María Candelaria is a woman who makes the most of her sales and handicraft abilities. Candelaria creates different types of handmade crafts depending on the season. The original reason she started working was that their household’s living expenses were depleting all the funds earned by her husband. She began to seek opportunities with which to take advantage of her creative and sales skills. With the help of a friend, she began selling second-hand clothing at a flea market where she could also showcase her handmade articles.

Regardless, she is out of clothes for the holiday season and only has summer items left. For this reason, she asks for a loan of $475USD to be repaid over a period of five months. With this money, Candelaria would be able to buy winter clothing as well as materials to create her holiday season crafts. With your help, Candelaria will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María Candelaria es una mujer que aprovecha sus habilidades de vendedora así como las habilidades que tiene para hacer manualidades. Dependiendo de la temporada Candelaria elabora una manualidad diferente. Sin embargo la situación primordial por la que comenzó a trabajar fue porque los gastos de su casa estaban absorbiendo todo el dinero que su esposo ganaba por lo tanto Candelaria comenzó a buscar cómo aprovechar sus oportunidades de vender y hacer manualidades. Fue así como con la ayuda de una amiga comenzó a vender ropa de segunda en un mercado rodante y ahí ingresó sus manualidades.

Sin embargo para la temporada navideña se le terminó la ropa y tiene pura de verano. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Candelaria podrá comprar ropa para la temporada de invierno y materiales para elaborar sus manualidades para la época navideña. Con tu ayuda Candelaria podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es:
The father of Angélica’s four children abandoned them, and she had to forge ahead despite her sadness over being left with sole responsibility for the family. She needed to work to help her children get ahead. With the advice of a friend who recommended the business as a good means to earn a living, she decided to start selling second-hand clothing. She later began offering her goods at a flea market, a popular location for the sale of used clothes. She sells her merchandise there every day to be able to earn money to pay for her children’s expenses.

Regardless, her expenses are climbing as her children grow and have additional needs. For this reason, Angélica does not currently have enough funds to invest in winter clothes and asks for a $475USD loan to be repaid in five months. With this loan, Angélica would be able to buy the merchandise she needs for her business to be well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El papá de los 4 hijos de Angélica los abandonó y ella tuvo que ver por sus hijos a pesar de la tristeza que sintió al verse sola con la responsabilidad de sus hijos, tenía que trabajar en algún negocio para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y por eso fue que se decidió a poner un negocio de venta de ropa usada. El mes de Abril del 2001, una amiga de Angélica le aconsejó que se dedicara a vender ropa usada ya que esta actividad si deja ganancias, fue así como comenzó, luego empezó a poner sus ventas en un mercado rodante, y la instalaron, donde se ponen todos los que se dedican a vender ropa usada. Y desde ahí vende todos los días para poder sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

Sin embargo los gastos van haciéndose cada vez más grandes ya que sus hijos van creciendo y teniendo otras necesidades. Es por eso que en este momento Angélica no cuenta con un capital suficiente como para reinvertir en ropa de invierno por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Angélica podrá comprar la mercancía que le hace falta para poder tener un muy buen surtido en su local.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Twenty five year old Faafetai T. from Fusi Safata has been doing her best to keep her vegetable plantation running well.  Having no children, she has dedicated most of her time to working her plantation together with the help of her husband.  The reason for the loan is to buy new chemicals, seeds and working tools for her plantation.  Her husband, being a farmer, is also a very big help.  She is grateful to SPBD for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, seeds, and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a woman who likes everything related to beauty/styling and, for this reason, she began to study the profession. She realized that this type of work is one that she can endeavor in with much success. She finished her studies and decided to start her own business, given they were short of funds since her husband had lost his job and they did not have the money to continue paying the school expenses of their two small children. So, with few tools but thanks to having studied the profession, she began to apply acrylic nails and cut hair. Many women were pleased with her services, and today she has a few more clients.

Despite the fact that more people frequent her business, there are more demands from her clientele. For this reason, she asks for a $650USD loan to be paid back over six months. With this money, Guadalupe would be able to buy furniture to improve her business and reflect a better image. With your help, Guadalupe will be able to grow her enterprise and help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer a la que le gusta todo el mundo del estilismo, y por lo tanto comenzó a estudiar esta profesión, y se dio cuenta que este tipo de trabajos es el que ella puede realizar con gran éxito. Por lo tanto al terminar de estudiar decidió comenzar su propio negocio. Puesto que en su casa faltaba dinero, porque su esposo había perdido el trabajo y no tenían dinero para seguir pagando todos los gastos de la escuela de sus dos pequeños hijos. Y fue así como con un poco de herramientas que ya tenía gracias a que estudió la profesión, comenzó a aplicar uñas de acrílico y a cortar el pelo. Muchas mujeres quedaron satisfechas por su trabajo es por eso que hoy ya tiene un poco más de clientas.

Sin embargo mientras más personas son las que van a este negocio, más son las exigencias de su clientela, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Guadalupe podrá comprar muebles para que su estética sea más rentable y tenga una mejor imagen. Con tu ayuda Guadalupe podrá crecer su negocio y así sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furniture for beauty salon.

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese T., thirty six years of age, is a hard working woman who, like most people, has responsibilities.  Unfortunately, Ese’s husband is unemployed.  Together they have five kids who go to school at a nearby primary.  Ese’s main goal is for her plantation to thrive as well as her pork bun business, but in order for that to happen, she needs supplies as well as improvements.  Ese is applying for this loan so that she may purchase ingredients as well as proper cookware for her pork buns, and chemicals and fertilizers to gain maximum yield from her plantation.  In conclusion, she will have more profit with the same responsibilities and a much lighter financial burden.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation, ingredients for her pork buns business, and for school fees for her children

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia’s husband sells used cars, a business in which very few sales result in a good profit margin. There have been times where no cars have been sold during which their debts mounted, forcing them to sell cars for too low a price just to generate some income. As a result, María Eugenia resolved herself to start her own business and – after much careful consideration – she settled on the concept of selling jewelry to her friends and family. With earnings from this activity, she would be able to improve her family’s financial situation during difficult times when the sales of used cars are lagging.

The winter season is the best time for her business given the demand for holiday gifts. For this reason, María Eugenia is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a six-month period. She would then be able to purchase more jewelry to offer to her customers. With your assistance, María Eugenia will be able to improve her family’s financial situation and help supplement her husband’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de María Eugenia se dedica a la compra y venta de carros usados viejitos, y este tipo de negocios son muy pocas ventas con un buen margen de ganancias. Pero había ocasiones que no podían vender el carro y por lo tanto los gastos de la casa se comenzaban a juntar y los absorbía tanto que vendían los carros a un precio muy bajo. Por lo tanto María Eugenia se decidió a comenzar su propio negocio y fue después de pensarlo muy bien que se decidió por vender joyas entre sus familiares y amigos y así con este dinero poder sacar adelante a la familia en esos momento en que las ventas de carros no van tan bien.

Sin embargo la temporada de invierno es la mejor para que las personas compren joyas para sus familiares. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María Eugenia podrá comprar más joyería y así tendrá qué ofrecerle a sus clientes que usualmente buscan regalar joyas que son como una especie de inversión que les podrá servir en algún momento de ayuda. Con tu ayuda María Eugenia podrá sacar adelante a su familia y ayudarle a su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (jewelry) for the holiday season.

loans.name: Talafaaiva

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Talafaaiva A. of Lotofaga Safata runs a plantation for a living. Her husband is a farmer. Together they struggle to support their six children.

Talafaaiva is applying for this loan in order to purchase new chemicals and tools to maintain her plantation. She would also like to use the funds to help pay for her children’s school fees. Her children go to a public school, which she believes is the best shcool for them. She hopes that this loan will help her earn more profit to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and school fees for her kids

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a young person who knows that, to get ahead, one must fight since opportunities do not present themselves to those who rest. Some time ago, school became too great a financial burden for her parents and they could no longer afford to spend so much on the materials she needed. For this reason, Maria del Carmen began to purchase small home electronics (such as those shown behind her in the photograph) at wholesale, and offering them for sale to her fellow students. She uses the funds she earns toward her educational expenses.

She needs to buy more products given that, during this season, her type of merchandise is in great demand. She requests a loan of $750USD, to be repaid over a period of six months. With the earnings from her sales, Maria del Carmen hopes to save enough to buy a small holiday gift for her parents to show them her appreciation. The rest of her earnings would go toward finishing her education, and meeting her goal of one day becoming a person who does well. With your help, Maria del Carmen will be able to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ma. Del Carmen Es una joven que sabe que para poder salir adelante hay que luchar con todas las fuerzas, puesto que las oportunidades no esperan a los que se quedan dormidos. Hace tiempo que la escuela comenzó a representar muchos gastos para los padres de Ma. Del Carmen y ellos ya no podían gastar tanto en materiales. Por eso María del Carmen comenzó a comprar electrodomésticos (como el que se muestra tras de ella en la fotografía) por mayoreo y a ofrecerlos a sus compañeros de la escuela y utilizar este dinero para poder terminar su escuela.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue y actualmente necesita comprar más productos puesto que en esta temporada muchos compran electrodomésticos con sus aguinaldos. Por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así María del Carmen con lo que gane en sus ventas podrá ahorrar dinero suficiente para poder darles un pequeño obsequio de agradecimiento por darle lo mejor a sus padres en esta navidad y también dejar dinero para poder continuar con los estudios de su carrera y un día llegar a ser una persona de bien. Con tu ayuda María del Carmen podrá terminar de estudiar.

loans.use: Purchase novelty items/small home electronics merchandise.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María's husband just loved the "hojarascas" (a kind of dessert) and therefore Luz María started to search for recipes so she could make them for him. Nevertheless he and the neighbors liked the ones she made so much so somebody suggested she should sell this kind of products as her seasoning was excellent, and that is how she got started offering them to friends, and little by little the business grew and now she is selling "hojarascas" to the stores in her neighborhood.

During winter this kind of dessert becomes more popular and therefore Luz María is asking for a loan of $750 which she plans to repay in 6 months. The funds will be used to buy material in order to meet the demand as orders have grown and she is now a wholesaler. With your support doña Luz María can start selling bigger quantities of her products and also help her family prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Al esposo de Luz María le gustaban mucho las hojarascas y por lo tanto Luz María comenzó a buscar las recetas para poder hacérselas a su esposo, sin embargo ya que comenzó a elaborarlas le gustaron mucho y a sus vecinos también fue por ahí que a una persona se le ocurrió decirle que iba a ser buena idea que ella vendiera este tipo de productos porque tenía muy buen sazón. Y fue como comenzó a ofrecerle a sus amistades y después se fue pasando la voz. Actualmente ya surte hojarascas a tiendas que están por su casa.

Sin embargo por ser temporada de invierno este postre se antoja más y es por esto que Luz María está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y el dinero le servirá para poder comprar más material y así hacer los pedidos que tiene puesto que son ya por mayoreo. Con tu ayuda Luz María podrá comenzar a vender en mayores cantidades sus productos y también podrá ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase material to prepare products for wholesale.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
Cipriano Ortiz worked for many years as a bricklayer. Unfortunately, this occupation did not provide him with a steady enough income given the work was intermittent and he was for many long periods without a job. For this reason, he began seeking some type of enterprise where he could generate quicker earnings and move merchandise in short periods of time. He began selling clothing and bedspreads by traveling to San Juan de los Lagos Jalisco, a city where clothing is manufactured at wholesale, to purchase his inventory at lower prices. He then resells his goods in Victoria at a good profit.

Since winter has now arrived, Cipriano considers changing the type of clothing he is offering. Therefore, he is asking for a $650USD loan, to be paid back over a period of six months, with which he can purchase more merchandise (such as winter clothing and bedspreads) that many people will be looking for now that cold weather is arriving. With your help, Cipriano’s family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cipriano Ortiz trabajó durante muchos años como albañil y desgraciadamente este negocio no le daba lo suficiente para vivir, constantemente se quedaba sin trabajo y las temporadas eran muy largas. Fue por es oque comenzó a buscar un comercio en el que las ganancias se vieran reflejadas más rápidas y que el movimiento de mercancía fuera en poco tiempo. Es por eso que comenzó a vender ropa y colchas. Y lo que hace es ir a San Juan de los Lagos Jalisco, que es una ciudad en dónde se fabrica ropa por mayoreo y por lo tanto los precios son más bajos que en Victoria y al revenderla le obtiene una buena ganancia.

Sin embargo la temporada de invierno ya llegó y por lo tanto Cipriano considera que es momento de cambiar el tipo de ropa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía como ropa de invierno y colchas que mucha gente está comprando puesto que los fríos ya están llegando. Con tu ayuda la familia de Cipriano podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell over the winter season.

loans.name: Suati

texts.en: Suati L., aged thirty, is a loyal wife and a terrific mother to her four children.  She started a plantation as a way to earn extra money for her family.  In addition to her plantation, her husband has a job to help provide for the family. He is a taxi driver, but his wage is not nearly enough to cover all their expenses and make a better home for them.  Therefore, Suati applied for this loan in order to help her support her family and home.  She will use the money to improve their plantation and provide good crops for the family to sell and to consume.  When they sell their crops, they will have enough money in their hands for expenses and for their home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Tivalo

texts.en:
Fifty year old Tivalo is a happy mother with five kids. Her children have all moved away from home.

Tivalo runs a cattle farm, ice cake (popsicle in a bag) business and a plantation. None of the business are successful at the moment, which is why she has requested a loan from SPBD. She will use the loan to purchase materials such as fencing wire to keep the cattle in, fertilizers to produce good cattle food and good crops, and ingredients for her ice cake business. Her goal for this loan is to improve her businesses, keep them running and assist the family with its needs and wants.

loans.use: To buy wire for her cattle farm and ingredients for her ice cake business

loans.name: Faleaoga

texts.en: Faleaoga E. of Mainoa village helps run her family's plantation.  Together with her unemployed husband, they are working hand in hand to make a living.  They applied for this loan in order to purchase chemicals and fencing wire to improve their plantation.  Expanding their plantation will improve their lives as they lay a foundation for their family; they are newly married.  Aged 29, Faleaoga is grateful to be in the SPBD progamme.  It has helped her in time of need.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Maualalo

texts.en: Maualalo is a fifty two year old mother of five children from the village of Tufulele. Three of her children are now living in New Zealand and the other two are still in Samoa. She and her husband earn income from selling the produce from their vegetable garden. Maualalo's husband worked hard in order to upgrade their business. He sells their vegetables every weekend at the food market. The business has become successful and they are no longer worried that they will not have enough money to accommodate their needs. Maualalo and her husband are requesting this loan through SPBD to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy new vegetable seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Lau

texts.en:
Lau T. is a good baker who runs a donut business. She’s a married twenty four year old mother of two sons. Lau learned baking in school. She never thought of baking as her talent until she baked donuts for her son’s food stall activity in school. From then on Lau heard the kids talking about her donuts. They asked her son to have her bake more for them.

Lau joined SPBD for financial support to start her business. She now has really high demand from not only students but also the village people. With her requested loan, she will buy enough ingredients to increase her daily production to meet the high demand.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her donut bakery

loans.name: Ni Komang Kantri

texts.id:
Buy & sell cocoa beans is an occupation since one year. Ni Komang Kantri works by travelling to people's houses to buy dried cocoa beans. In one day Ni Komang Kantri buys around 200 kg (about 440 lbs) of cocoa beans, with a profit of Rp 50,000 (about US$5.25)/day. With enthusiasm, and untiringly Ni Komang Kantri runs this business. Her husband I Ketut Denia, is not sitting still to see his wife persistance. I Ketut Denia also works for family household needs. Loan for capital very much help Ni Komang Kantri to add the amount of cocoa beans she could buy, so that profit would increase. After cocoa beans are bought from farmers, Ni Komang Kantri re-sells it to the distributor, who is her permanent customer. This business very much help her household income. For the future Ni Komang Kantri likes to be a distributor of cocoa beans. Ni Komang Kantri plans to expand the area to obtain the cocoa beans, so that she could get more profit, and her business would increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jual beli biji coklat ( Kakao ) adalah pekerjaan yang sudah digeluti selama setahun. Ni Komang Kantri melakukan pekerjaannya dengan cara berkeliling kerumah warga untuk membeli biji kakao yang sudah kering. Kadang dalam satu hari Ni Komang Kantri mendapat biji kakao 200 kilogram. Dengan keuntungan Rp.50.000/hari. Dengan semangat dan tidak mengenal lelah Ni Komang Kantri menjalani usaha ini. Suaminya, I Ketut Denia, juga tidak tinggal diam melihat istri yang begitu ulet bekerja. I Ketut Denia ikut membantu mencari nafkah demi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Modal pinjaman ini sangat menunjang usaha Ni Komang Kantri untuk menambah jumlah biji kako yang bisa dibelinya agar keuntungan yang di dapat pun bertambah besar . Setelah biji kako di beli dari rumah petani, oleh Ni Komang Kantri akan dijual kembali kepada pengepul yang sudah menjadi langanan tetapnya.Usaha ini sangat membantu penghasilan rumah tangganya. Untuk kedepannya Ni Komang Kantri ingin menjadi pengepul biji kakao. Ni Komang Kantri berencana bisa memperlebar area tempat untuk mendapatkan biji kako, agar lebih banyak mendapat keuntungan dan usahanya lebih maju.

loans.use:
To add capital to buy more cocoa beans

Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli biji kakao lebih banyak lagi

loans.name: Ni Komang Sunarti

texts.id:
Besides being a farmer Ni Komang Sunarti also raised fattening piglets. With the capital she had, Ni Komang Sunarti bought 2 piglets for Rp250,000 (about US$26)/piece. Ni Komang Sunarti is persistent in this business, since family economical needs forced her to work hard to think about raising her 3 small children. Her stall is already permanent. Ni Komang Sunarti could profit Rp1000,000 (about US$105) within 6 months. This profit very much help her household expense needs, since if they only rely on her husbands income as tenant farmer, it would not be sufficient to pay for daily expoenses. For future plans, Ni Komang Sunarti likes to raise more pigs so that she could receive more profit, and her family's economy could improve.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani Ni Komang Sunarti juga memelihara babi penggemukan. Dengan modal yang ada, Ni Komang Sunarti membeli 2 ekor bibit babi seharga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Ni Komang Sunarti sangat tekun menjalankan usaha ini karena tuntutan ekonomi keluarga sehingga ia harus bekerja keras dan memikirkan biaya 3 orang anak yang masih kecil. Kandang yang dimilikinya sudah permanen. Ni Komang Sunarti bisa menerima keuntungan sebesar Rp.1.000.000.- dalam 6 bulan. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, karena bila hanya mengandalkan suami yang hanya sebagai petani, kadang tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari.Untuk itu rencananya kedepan, Ni Komang Sunarti ingin lebih banyak memelihara bibit babi agar bisa mendapat keuntungan yg lebih dan ekonomi keluarga semakin baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock & feed

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Kade Armin

texts.id:
By opening a kiosk at home, Gst Armini could profit Rp20,000 (about US$2.10)/day. Gst Tantra, husband of Armini usually sought the items from the market to be re-sold at home. The kiosk business is busy with customers, since in the Armini's area very seldom people do sales. With 2 children, profit is not enough to cover daily needs. Although Armini's house and also kiosk is simple, but Armini is very happy to help her husband for additional income. For the future, capital will be used to renovate the kiosk, since people's need increase, so that items for sale has to be added. That is Armini's wish to enlarge her kiosk. Since after opening the kiosk their live gets better.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan membuka warung sembako dirumah.Gst Armini bisa menerima keuntungan Rp.20.000/hari.Gst Tantra suami dari Armini yang biasanya mencarikan barang dagangannya dipasar untuk dijual kembali dirumahnya.Usaha warung ini sangat ramai pelanggan karena didaerah Armini masih jarang yang berjualan.Dengan membiayai 2 orang anak keuntungannya tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari.Walaupun rumah tempat tinggal sekaligus warung Armini sangat sederhana,tetapi Armini sangat senang karena membantu suami untuk mendapat tambahan.Untuk kedepannya modal yang ada akan digunakan untuk merenovasi warung mengingat kebutuhan masyarakat semakin banyak.sehingga barang daganganpun harus ditambah.Itulah cita-cita dari Armini ingin memperbesar warungnya.Karena semenjak berusaha warung kehidupannya semakin baik.

loans.use:
To buy items for sale

Membeli barang dagangan

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: I am Hamida B. and I belong to a low-income family. I live with my family in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. I am a mother of ten: five boys and five girls. My husband is a very dedicated carpenter who loves his work. My family is big and our income is small. Therefore, we need to expand our business, and require $175 for this purpose. My husband will buy wood in bulk as it is cheaper if bought in cash.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: I am Ayesha B. from a small city, Arifwala, Pakistan. I am 33, married and a mother of five children: one girl and four boys. All of my children attend school except the youngest, who is currently too young to attend school. My husband operates a grocery store in a more busy and crowded nearby market. My children are growing and so our expenses. We feel the need of an extra income now. Therefore, my husband wishes to expand his store and buy a few items such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc. in bulk. We would like a loan of $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy items such as cooking oil, rice, and sugar in bulk for the store

loans.name: Thi Chinh

texts.vi:
Ms Chính is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children. They live in Phú Mẫn hamlet, Bắc Ninh. Her husband raises pigs and cultivates their rice field. She makes bean curd (tofu) and sells it at the local market. This is her family main income, it provides a steady cashflow. The waste from the bean curd production is used to feed the pigs. She's requesting a loan which will be used to stock up her inventory of soya bean. Also she would get a better price if buying in bulk. She will be happy if she could get this loan, it would help her raise her family income. She will repay the loan according to the loan term

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chính 36 tuổi sống ở thôn Phú Mẫn, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có gia đình và 2 con đang đi học. Chồng chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Gia đình chị kiếm sống chủ yếu bằng nghề làm đậu phụ sau đó đem bán ở chợ gần nhà. Làm đậu đem lại cho chị thu nhập thường xuyên và ngoài ra chị còn tận dụng được bã đậu để nuôi lợn. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm đỗ dự trữ dùng dần và mua nhiều chị sẽ được hưởng giá rẻ hơn. Chị rất vui nếu sớm được nhận khoản vốn vay này vì nó sẽ hỗ trợ phần nào để cải thiện thu nhập cho gia đình chị và chị sẵn sàng thực hiện các cam kết đối với nhà cho vay.

loans.use: Purchase soya beans to make bean curd

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: I am Irshad B., a widow from a small city Arifwala, Pakistan. I am a mother of five: three girls and two boys. After my husband’s death, our financial conditions grew very poor. Then, one of my sons started driving a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi). He earns approximately $150 a month. Rickshaw is our major source of income and it is need of repairs now. We need a loan. Your help will let us continue put food on our table.

loans.use: Repair rickshaw

loans.name: Thi Binh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Binh, 39 years old, is married and have 3 kids, all of whom are currently going to school. She is a very active woman. In the morning, she goes to the market to sell pork, then in the afternoon she comes back to work on her frog-raising business. Her family has 8 frog-cages which start continuously so there are always big frogs to sell. She usually sells them to local restaurants. Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whoL. family. Mrs. Binh would like to request some loan to expand her business, increase family income and will use the profit generate from the business to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bình 39 tuổi, đã có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Chị là người phụ nữ khá năng động. Buổi sáng chị đi chợ bán thịt lợn, chiều về chị nuôi ếch tại nhà. Gia đình chị có 8 chuồng ếch nuôi gối nhau nên trong nhà lúc nào cũng có ếch lớn để bán. Chị thường bán cho các nhà hàng lân cận. Tuy nhiên, quy mô nuôi còn nhỏ nên chưa đủ cung cấp. Chị vay vốn để nuôi thêm, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình và sẽ sử dụng tiền thu được từ việc kinh doanh ếch để hoàn vốn đúng kỳ hạn.

loans.use: Mua thêm ếch để nuôi / Buy more frogs to expand the business

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: I am Bashiran B. from a small city Arifwala, Paksitan. I am 44, married and a mother of four children. My husband is a rickshaw driver. He bought this rickshaw with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution, last year. He managed to repay all the installments on time. Rickshaw is our major source of income and it is need of repairs now. Please lend us $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Repair Rickshaw

loans.name: Sukhian

texts.en: I am Sukhian B. from Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. I am 31, married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. My husband is a rickshaw driver and he owns a rickshaw. He uses this rickshaw to offer public transportation services. He now needs $175 for the maintenance of his rickshaw, because its condition is deteriorating. We need this loan immediately because the rickshaw is our major source of income.

loans.use: Repair rickshaw

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath Y., 25, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works in her rice paddy growing rice crops, while her husband works as a fisherman, earning collectively around $8.20 per day in revenue. This couple hopes the loan of $1000 will help them purchase a boat for their fishery and the leftover of the money is to buy cows and pigs to breed, so that they can generate additional profits in the next six to seven months.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and livestock to breed

loans.name: Thi Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai, 31 years old, is marriaged and has 3 children who are currently going to school. At the moment, her family is raising around 1,000 hens. Her daily income is above 150,000 VND (94 USD). She would like to request a loan to buy food for her hens. Everyday, her husband collects the eggs their hens produces as well as buying additional eggs from individual sellers (others families) in the village and then sell it to small retailers. She is planning to borrow money to expand her business (raise more hens).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Mai 31 tuổi đã có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Hiện tại , gia đình chị nuôi gần 1,000 con gà đẻ. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình trên VND150,000. Chị vay vốn để mua cám nuôi gà. Chồng chị thường xuyên đi giao trứng của gia đình và thu gom trứng của các gia đình trong làng bán cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ. Chị có kế hoạch khi vay được nhiều vốn sẽ mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: To purchase food for chickens

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K. L., 26, is married and lives with her husband and one school-aged kid in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a vendor purchasing rice crops from growers and reselling them, earning around $2/day of profit. Her husband has been working as a mechanic, earning on average $5 each day. Mrs. Seng K. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rice crops for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice crops to sell

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum K. H., 47, is a mother of four children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a stand in front of a secondary school selling various kinds of biscuits and candies to students passing by. She can earn on average around $4 per day of profit, while her husband is employed as a high school teacher, making around $2 per day. Mrs. Sum K. H. is humbly requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing a food cart and icebox to also sell sugar cane juice on the street in front of the school. (Her husband who is a teacher is pictured because Sum K. H. was unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a street cart to sell sugar cane juice

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Mrs. Proeung N., 52, is a market-vendor selling scallop and octopus, earning around $7.3/day in revenue. She is married and has six children. Her husband helps her sell at the market every morning and one of her children is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2.40/day in revenue; a number of her other children are married and some are unemployed. Mrs. Proeung N. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory and the remainder of the loan is to buy a motorcycle to assist in the transportation of her products.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of seafood to sell as well as to purchase a motorcycle to transport her products

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S., 33, lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at home selling vegetables and dried yam, earning on average about $2/day of profit, while her husband works for a private company as a driver and generally makes around $5/day. Mrs. Oun S. has recently applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to assist in her business transportation and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory. She believes the motor-bike will not only help to save her family from extra expenses, but it can make her business more productive, faster and effective.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to help grow her grocery business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I am Parveen B. from Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five, four boys and one girl. I am not educated but I understand the importance of being educated. Therefore, I enrolled all my children to school. But unfortunately, my elder children dropped school in the secondary grades. At present, only my youngest son attends school. 
My husband has a vegetable business in the city food market, whereas my eldest son operates a vegetable stall in a market very near to our house. They together earn a profit of $500 a month. My husband has had this business for eight years.  Now, my husband wishes to expand his business for which he requires a loan of $675. We will save the money from these profits to buy a big house for us. My husband’s dream is that his business will prosper and he will be able to open up one more vegetable shop.

loans.use: Expand vegetable business

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
My name is Amna B.. I am married and a mother of seven. I live with my family in Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. My husband makes and sells cardboard boxes that are used to store various kinds of objects including soaps, shampoos, shoes etc. My son operates a motorbike rental store. Currently, he has six bikes in his store. His rental store generates a revenue of $500 a month approximately. Now, he wants to expand his business further, and buy an additional bike. 
My son is very ambitious to grow his enterprise by leaps and bounds. He wishes to buy a big house for us and go on a tour abroad. I wish him success in all his plans. You could help my son fulfill his dreams by lending him $825.

loans.use: Buy an additional bike for the rental store

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: I am a citizen of Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. I was married fifteen years ago, and I am a mother of five children. All of my children attend school, except the youngest who is not of school-going age yet. I embroider clothes, and my husband runs a steel business. He buys steel from various factories and supplies them to different blacksmith shops in the city, who give him orders. A year ago we took a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution for our steel business. The loan invested returned comparatively higher profits. Now my husband wants to take on bigger orders and therefore requires a loan of $350.  He will buy steel in bulk with this money.

loans.use: Buy steel in bulk

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: I am Safia B. from Lahore, a big and busy metropolitan in Pakistan. I am a mother of five children, two boys and three girls. My husband runs an artificial jewelry business. He get orders from various shops in the city and supplies them the required jewelry. Last year, he took a loan and bought the machine that is used to make jewelry. The machine enabled him to work efficiently, which eventually led to better profits. We bought a color television with these profits. Now, my husband requires another loan of $425 to further expand his business. He will buy the raw materials in bulk that are required in the making of the jewelry.

loans.use: Expand jewelry business

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband, who is a scrap dealer. He is hardworking and honest. He requires this loan to expand his business and buy various scrap items in bulk. I am quite good at sewing, and in the future, I plan to use my skills to support my husband. At present, I am a homemaker because my only daughter is very young, and I have to take care of her.

loans.use: Buy scrap items in bulk

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a mother of eight children, seven girls and one boy. My husband is a blacksmith and I am a seamstress. I create different kinds of ladies clothes and cheap diapers for children. I started this business a couple of years ago by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. With that loan I bought a sewing machine, which allowed me to increase production and satisfy my clients. Now I wish to expand my business and buy a large quantity of cloth and threads. Please lend me $350. I am sure this loan will give me economic security and will allow me to save for my children’s future.

loans.use: Buy cloth and threads in bulk

loans.name: Lovina Group

texts.id:
Every time Lovina is spoken, everybody remembers a beautiful tourist site in West Bali, which is famous for its many dolphins in their waters. A group of 15 ladies are inspired by "Lovina', so that they used it as their Group's name. This group consist of ladies who are raising pigs. Three ladies were already selected to administer the group by coordinating everything that are involved wwith the group from money management and other activities, like: as Chair person, as Secretary, and as Cashier. In the past, the ladies in this Lovina Group raised their animals the traditional way, since they did not know how to raise pig the right and effective way, so that the results were not maximal. For that matter DINARI took initiative to help this Lovina Group so that they could get ahead in their business. Besides guidance, DINARI is also giving capital loan to each member in the amount of Rp1,400,000 (about US$154)/member, that afterwards were used to buy feedstock and feed for 1 raising season. With that guidance, and assistance from DINARI, the Lovina Group improves in their Group Management and activities, so that they are convinced to obtain better results in every member's heart.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap mendengar kata Lovina, setiap orang pasti langsung teringat akan sebuah tempat wisata yang indah di bagian barat dari pulau Bali yang juga terkenal dengan kenyamanannya banyaknya kawanan lumba-lumba diperairan tersebut. Sekelompok ibu-ibu yang berjumlah 15 orang terinspirasi oleh ”Lovina” sehingga mereka memakainya sebagai nama kelompok mereka. Kelompok ini merupakan pekumpulan ibu-ibu yang memelihara ternak babi. Tiga orang dipilih menjadi pengurus kelompok yang bertugas mengkoordinir segala hal yang berhubungan dengan kelompok tersebut baik itu dalam keuangan maupun kegiatan-kegiatan yang lainnya., yaitu sebagai ketua, sebagai sekretaris, dan sebagai bendahara. Dalam perjalanannya ibu-ibu yang tergabung dalam kelompok Lovina memelihara ternaknya dengan cara tradisional karena mereka tidak mengetahui dengan baik cara memelihara babi yang benar dan efektif sehingga hasil yang mereka peroleh tidak maksimal. Berdasarkan hal tersebut DINARI berinisiatif untuk membantu kelompok Lovina untuk bisa maju dalam usahanya. Selain memberikan pembinaan, DINARI juga langsung membantu kelompok dengan memberi pinjaman modal usaha kepada setiap anggota sejumlah Rp. 1.400.000,- yang kemudian mereka kelola untuk membeli bibit dan biaya pakan untuk 1 kali masa pemeliharaan. Dengan mendapat bimbingan dan pendampingan dari DINARI, kelompok Lovina mulai mengalami perbaikan baik dalam manajemen kelompok maupun dalam aktifitas usaha yang digeluti sehingga keyakinan untuk mendapat hasil yang lebih baik pun ada dalam hati setiap anggota.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed for fattening

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., 28, is married with one school-aged child and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a broker purchasing rice crops from the grower and sells them out, making on average around $2 each day of profits. Her husband, therefore, drives a motor-taxi, making about $3/day in revenue. Mrs. Sok S. hopes this loan will help her to expand her inventory by purchasing more rice crops.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of rice crops to resell

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sok Sothear has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach L., 69, is a mother of five children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work as brokers buying yam and rice crops from the growers and they then sell them for a profit. They can earn collectively around $4/day of profit. Meanwhile, three of her children are married and the rest are students. Additionally, this couple is humbly requesting a loan amount of $1000 to expand their inventory by purchasing more crops to enable them to generate more profits.

loans.use: To purchase yams and rice crops to resell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
I am 33, married, and have four children. All of my children attend a nearby local school. I live with my partner and children in Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I have been sewing clothes to order for my neighborhood clients for four years.

My husband runs a grocery store in his locality, where he sells daily use items. He wants to invest in his store and stock items such as sugar, oil and legumes in bulk. Please lend him $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy grocery items in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en: Mrs. Oeung S., age 47, runs a stand at a market selling fresh vegetables and grocery products, earning around $2.50 each day. Her husband is a carpenter, making around $6.25 day in revenue. They have six children, some who are married and some who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase yams from the grower directly and sell them in the market for a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase yams to resell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
I am Razia A.. I am married, and I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband owns a donkey cart, which he uses to transport goods from one place to another for various wholesalers.

He does not earn sufficient income to support the entire family. Therefore, we need to expand our business by adding on an additional donkey cart. We will also hire an assistant to help with this added cart. We need a loan.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: Mrs. Chhean M., age 45, works with her husband in their rice paddy growing crops, earning collectively around $3 per day from selling their crops. They have four children, one who works at a company as a driver, one who is a mechanic, and two who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase yams from the grower and then resell them at the market for a good profit. This will enable her to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase yams from the grower and then resell them at the market for a good profit

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
I am Naseem A.. I was born and brought up in Manshera, a small mountainous town in the North of Pakistan. But after my marriage I moved to Lahore with my husband. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver, whereas I create and sew trendy clothes for ladies of my town to order.

I have been stitching clothes since my teens, and I have skill at my work. I am in the process of expanding my business, and therefore I require a loan of $500. I will invest in good quality fabric and notions. With the profits, I plan to buy few household items that we need in our house.

loans.use: Buy required fabric in bulk

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo V., age 38, works selling containers of gasoline, earning around $8/day in revenue. Her husband, age 40, is a policeman, making $1.60 per day. They have four children. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a small van for her business’ transportation to pick up the gasoline and deliver it to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a van to expand her gasoline sales business

loans.name: Douk

texts.en: Mrs. Douk L., 37, is a widow who lives with her four children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income, Douk L. works with her mother (pictured) selling a variety of grocery products, earning on average $16/day. One of her children is a student and the other three are unemployed. Mrs. Douk L. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more products to fill her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand inventory in her grocery store

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
As wife of a tenant farmer husband, Ni Ketut Sari is expected to help her husband to increase family income. Farming and opening a kiosk is her choice occupation, since in that business she could still be a house mother. Kiosk business has been her occupation for a while, however results is far from maximal. Starting from selling few family items main needs, Ni Ketut Sari plans to increase the items for sale so that her customers could get it readily from her kiosk. From the Rp4000,000 (about US$420) capital, Ni Ketut Sari could sell Rp200,000 (about US$ 21), at a nett profit of Rp15,000 (US$1.60). With the requested additional loan to Dinari, Ni Ketut Sari hopes to add capital that she could turn around, and profit could double today's. Therefore it would increase family's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani , Ni Ketut Sari dituntut untuk mampu membantu suami dalam hal menambah pendapatan keluarga. Bertani sekaligus membuka usaha warung merupakan pilihan hidup yang dia jalani, karena dengan usaha itu ia masih dapat mengerjakan semua aktifitas sebagai ibu rumah tangga. Usaha warung sudah lama dia tekuni, akan tetapi belum mampu memperoleh hasil yang maksimal. Berawal dari menjual beberapa macam kebutuhan pokok keluarga , Ni Ketut Sari berencana menambah macam barang yang akan ditawarkan agar pelanggan yang membutuhkan barang akan dapat tersedia di warungnya. Dari Modal Rp. 4.000.000.- yang dia punya selama ini setiap harinya Ni Ketut Sari mendapat penjualan sebesar Rp. 200.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih Rp. 15.000,-. Dengan penambahan modal yang diajukan ke DINARI Ni Ketut Sari berharap akan bisa menambah modal yang akan diputar kembali dan keuntungan yang diperoleh akan dapat meningkat 2 kali lipat dari sekarang. Jadi dengan demikian jelas akan dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mr. Yem N., age 32, works selling garlic, earning around $43 per month. His wife works selling make-up products at the market, making on average $70 per month. They have two children who attend school. The children also help their father sell garlic when their school schedule allows. He is asking for loan of $1200 to purchase more garlic in order to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase garlic for resale

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin T., 48, is a widow who buys garlic from the grower and resells it at the market, earning around $5 each day. She has eight children. One works at a garment factory, earning around $120 per month. One is a grocer, another is a construction worker, and two are students. The rest are married and living away from home. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more garlic in order to meet customer demand and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase garlic for resale

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasiani

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Kasiani is the portrait of a super mother and wife. In her daily life she is able to help her husband to increase family income by selling pulse and accessories for hand phones in front of their house. In that activity Ni Ketut Kasiani opens her business from 07:30 AM and closes at 22:00 at night. From the capital used so far are about Rp3000,000 (about US$ 330), Ni Ketut Kasiani daily sales are about Rp100,000 (about US$11), and nett profit of about Rp25,000 (about US$2.75). That income is not sufficient to pay for daily family expenses, which increases daily. With an additional capital from Dinari for about Rp4,000,000 (about US$440) Ni Ketut Kasiani could increase the selection of sales item, with the hope it would increase sales and nett profit from her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Kasiani merupakan potret seorang ibu sekaligus istri yang luar biasa. Dalam keseharian hidupnya ia mampu membantu suami dalam menambah penghasilan keluarga melalui usaha menjual pulsa dan aksesoris telepon genggam yang berada di depan rumahnya . Dalam kegiatanya Ni Ketut Kasiantini mulai membuka usahanya pukul 7.30 pagi dan akan tutup pada pukul 22.00 malam. Dari semua modal yang dipergunakan selama ini yang berjumlah Rp. 3.000.000,- Ni Ketut Kasiantini mendapatkan hasil penjualan selama satu hari sebesar Rp.100.000.- dengan keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp .25 000,- Dari penghasilan sebesari tu, belumlah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan tambahan modal dari DINARI sebesar Rp. 4.000.000,- Ni Ketut Kasiani bisa menambah jumlah jenis barang yang akan dijual kepada pembeli dengan harapan bisa meningkatkan hasil penjualan dan dan juga keuntungan bersih dari hasil usahanya.

loans.use:
To add capital and increase sales

Menambah modal untuk memperbanyak dagangannya

loans.name: Kushnudi

texts.en:
My name is Khusnudi B. . I am married, and I live with my partner in Lahore, a city with great history and culture in Pakistan. I have been stitching clothes to order for my neighborhood clients for the past five years.

My husband is an accountant at a small store for a meager monthly pay, which is insufficient to support our entire family. Our financial condition has grown better since my son started a spare parts business. My son now requires buying some of the auto spare parts in bulk for which he requires a loan of $500. Please lend him the necessary funds.

loans.use: Buy spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mrs. Tuy S., 52, is a widow who lives with her two children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s needs, Tuy S. works selling rice at a busy market, earning around $10/day. One of her children is employed at a bakery; the other is unemployed. Mrs. Tuy S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more rice to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
I am a mother of three children: two boys and one girl. All of my children attend a local school. I mostly do my household chores, but whenever I get time, I sew clothes for my friends and relatives.

My husband makes cardboard boxes that are required to pack ready-made garments. He needs to obtain bigger orders for these boxes so that he can increase his income. Please lend him $500 to buy the raw materials in bulk that are required to make these boxes.
