loans.use: Buy raw materials in bulk for making cardboard boxes

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long D., 46, has four children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To generate income, Long D. works making Khmer cakes, which she sells in an open air market, earning on average $6/day. Mrs. Long D. gets up early every morning to cook her cakes. Two of her children help her cook them and sell them at the market. Mrs. Long D. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase a motor-bike so that her husband, who is currently unemployed, can start a motor-taxi business.  She would use whatever money is left over to buy some tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike taxi

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza has been engaged in business for over 4 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is located at her house in Spitamen, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. Her initial capital was given by her husband, and she spent it to purchase the first batch of five dresses. He also helped her to reconstruct one room at their house to be the wedding salon. Today she has wide assortment of dresses, and her salon has become one of the most well-known salons in Spitamen.

Dilfuza became a client of MLF MicroInvest in 2006, and her first loan was for 500 somoni (about $150US). During her partnership with MLF MicroInvest, she has repaid her loans on time without any delays. The turnover of her business is fast as she always tries to be innovative with her assortment. Presently she is going to receive the winter assortment of dresses from Russia, and she needs extra capital to purchase them.

loans.use: Purchase warm wedding dresses.

loans.name: Bangkok Group

texts.ru:
A. started his business 10 years ago. He purchases calves and after growing them, he resells them. In addition, he owns a dairy cow and sells dairy products. A. also works in the field, and in his absence his family helps to take care of the cattle.

Mamadjon also grows cattle and produces dairy products. He has 4 children, which is why raising cattle is not his only business. He owns land where he grows corn, wheat and other agricultural products.

D. is another member of this group. He has been raising livestock for 25 years. He has a lot of experience and a significant number of cattle. He has 8 children. His family helps him and also grows agricultural products.

Turgunoi also turned to MLF MicroInvest to get funding for raising cattle and reselling it. She has 3 children and her husband helps her in her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахман начал свою деятельность 10 лет назад. Он приобретает молодняк и уже вырастив скот он перепродает. Кроме этого у него есть дойная корова, т.е. , он также продает молочные изделия. Абдурахман работает еще на поле, в его отсутствии ухаживать за скотом ему помогает его семья. Мамаджон Также занимается разведением по откорму кота и переработкой молочных изделий, у него четверо детей поэтому откорм скота не единственный бизнес в его деле. Для этого у него имеется земля, где он выращивает , кукурузу, пшеницу и другую сельхозкультуру. Джуракулов является еще один член этой группы. Четверть своего века он занимается животноводством. У него большой опыт и досаточно много скота. Он отец восьмерых детей. Его семья помогает ему также и в выращивании сельхозкультур. Тургуной также обратилась в Микроинвест для разведения скота и перепродажы в будущем. Она мать троих детей. Ей в бизнесе помогает супруг.

loans.use: Animal Husbandry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Mrs. Nhim S., 28, is married with two children and lives with her mother (pictured) in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To help the family make ends meet, Mrs. Nghim S. works selling fish to the people in her area, earning around $4/day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction worker. Mrs. Nhim S. hopes to use part of this loan to purchase more fish to expand her stock and the remainder to purchase pigs to breed. She will be abe to realize additonal profits from the pigs about six to seven months later.

loans.use: To purchase fish and pigs

loans.name: Zulakhan

texts.en:
I request a loan of $350 for my husband who operates an embroidered clothes business.

My husband has skill at his work, and he creates clothes with the latest trends. He needs this loan to expand his business and buy fabric, thread and sequins in a large quantity. This loan amount will help us to improve our business and improve our financial status.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mr. Phat S. works as a construction foreman, making around $6 each day. His wife (pictured) runs a stand selling groceries to the people in her area, making a profit of about $4 each day. They have three children; two are construction workers and one is a student. He is asking for a loan of $1000 so that his wife can increase her inventory of grocery products and satisfy clients’ demands. This will increase income for the family.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of products sold in the family's grocery stand.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru:
Mehri started her business 5 years ago when she lost her job and was forced to work at the agricultural market and to sell cottonseed oil. Mehri’s son and her neighbor bring her products to sell from the city. Her neighbor helped her to start her business. She plans to expand her business as the oil is in high demand in her area.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Началасвой бизнес 5 лет назад, когда она потеряла работу и вынуждена была работать на сельском рынке и продавать хлопковое масло. Товар для подажи, привозят из города сосед и ее сын , в начинании бизнеса ей помог сосед, которым она до сех пор занимается. Она планирует расширить свой бизнес, так как масло которое она продает, продается очень хорошо в ее местности.

loans.use: Sale of Cottonseed Oil

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mrs. Vat C., 60, works as a tailor, earning around $1.50 each day. Her husband, 63, makes items used in religious rituals, such as incense, golden coconuts, and decorated banana trees. He sells them in the market, making about $3.50 per day. They have six children. One lives at home and is employed in a garment factory, making about $70 per month.  The others are married and live in their own homes. She is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motor-bike for one of her children, who wants to operate a motor-taxi business. In this way, he will earn additional money to supplement his family’s income. Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike so that her son can start a taxi business.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban Y., 43, is a widow who works selling groceries in her community, making about $5.40 per day. Her husband is a teacher. They have three children; two are teachers like their father and one is a student. She is asking for a loan of $1000  to expand her inventory and meet increasing client demand.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell in her grocery

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
António U. was born in Marrumbe, in the province of Inhambe. He is 43 years old. He studied until high school. He moved from his family’s home when he was 14. In 1985 he met his wife and they have a son. He started working as a technical school in Moamba. Two years later he was transferred to the Institute of Umbeluzi where he continues to work today as a teacher. António first contacted Tchuma program in search of credit but he did like the program because the loans amount were smaller and he had less time to repay them. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and he requests a loan of 25.000mt to buy construction material to build his home. In the future, he plans on finishing his home and to buy furniture to live comfortably with his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizacao : Boane - Bairro 7 IPU Cliente :Antonio U. Actividade : Habitacao Valor de empréstimo: 25.000,00 MT(1.000,00 USS) Aplicação de montante : Compra de material de construcao Inicio : 01-10-07 Fim: 24-03-09 António U. ,natural de Morrumbene, Província de Inhambane tem 43 anos de idade, pai de 1 filho estudou ate nível superior, deixou de viver com a família com os seus 14 anos. Em 1985 conheceu a sua esposa e passou a viver com ela Teve o seu 1º emprego numa Escola Técnica de artes e ofícios na Moamba. Dois anos depois transferiu-se para o Instituto pedagógico de Umbeluzi, onde se encontra a trabalhar ate hoje, como professor. Teve o seu 1º contacto com o credito junto a cooperativa de créditos Tchuma que oferecia créditos individuais, não tendo sido boa experiência porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores, o prazo de pagamento era curto e determinado pela Instituiçao. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema, através dos amigos e dai aproximou –se e solicita o seu 1º empréstimo para compra de um terreno, com este credito de 25.000,00 MT pretende comprar material de construcao. Futuramente a perspectiva é de terminar a obra e começar o apetrecho da sua casa, para viver condignamente com a sua familia.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Rosigul

texts.en:
Rosigul has been engaged in business for over 8 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is located in a food market in Spitamen, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She started her business by selling candies and cookies which she bought from suppliers and made little profit.

Rosigul became a client of MLF MicroInvest in 2003. With the loans, she expanded her assortment of food products. Gradually she increased her working capital and could rent one food shop from the market owner in Spitamen. Today she sells different kinds of food products and she also has the opportunity to buy meat and milk products as she has refrigeration at her food store. She is requesting $600 from Kiva lenders to make her next purchase for her food store.

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of candies, 4 boxes of condensed milk, 5 boxes of mayonnaise, and 20 kg of sausage.

loans.name: Umid

texts.en: Umid's business is mainly seasonal. The main trade is done in summer and fall, but in winter before the New Year's holiday and the Islam holiday of Ramazan, his business becomes active. Melons and watermelons are one of the popular things on the holiday table for Tajiks.

loans.use: Trade of melons and watermelons

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
I am a mother of seven children: three boys and four girls. My husband is a driver at a local company, whereas I stitch clothes to order for my neighborhood clients. We earn just enough to put food on our table and clothe our children. I could not send my elder children to school, because we did not have enough money to pay for their school charges.

Now, my elder son is determined that he will not let the same fate befall his younger brothers. He will work and earn to send them to school. He has learned driving from one of his friends, who is a rickshaw driver, and by now my son is quite expert in it. Please lend him $250 so that he can buy a second-hand rickshaw and support us and his brothers and sisters.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Mertha Nadi Group

texts.id:
This group is Pig farmers group, each member uses the loans for pig feedstock which price is between Rp 300,000 - 350,000 (about US$ 31-36)/piglet. Besides piglets they also raise mother pig ready for husbandary at a cost of Rp500,000 (about US$52) each time. Every mother pig could produce 10-12 piglets, and usually in the mother's adaptation process, surroundings, and feed, problems occured in the piglets growing time, including diarrhea from milk could cause death; pressed under mother's weight, and other animal illness that caused death. After 5 months fattening process, the pigs could be sold at Rp1,300,000 (cout US$136) and each farmer could profit between Rp400,000-500,000 (about US$42-53)/pig.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok ini adalah kelompok peternak babi, setiap anggota menggunakan pinjaman dana untuk keperluan bibit babi yang harganya antara 300.000 – 350.000 rupiah/ekor, dan setiap anggota biasanya membeli dua ekor bibit babi untuk proses penggemukan. Disamping bibit babi mereka juga memelihara induk babi yang siap untuk dikawinkan dengan ongkos pejantan untuk sekali kawin adalah 50.000 rupiah. Setiap induk babi bisa menghasilkan 10 – 12 ekor anak babi, dan biasanya dalam proses adaptasi dengan induk, lingkungan dan makanan banyak permasalahan yang muncul dalam masa-masa pertumbuhan bayi babi tersebut diantaranya mencret karena pengaruh susu dari induknya yang dapat mengakibatkan kematian, ditindih oleh induknya sendiri, dan penyakit ternak lainnya yang mengakibatkan kematian pada ternak itu sendiri. Setelah proses penggemukan dengan jangka waktu sekitar 5 bulan babi dijual dengan harga 1.300.000 rupiah/ekornya dan peternak itu sendiri memperoleh keuntungan 400.000 sampai 500.000 rupiah/ekor.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock, husbandary, animal feed and raising expenses

Membeli bibit babi, Biaya untuk pejantan, makanan ternak dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Elizbeth

texts.en:
I am Elizbeth L. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am a mother of four children, all of whom attend school except the eldest one, who dropped out of school due to a lack of interest in his studies. My husband works at a private office for a small monthly pay, which is insufficient for us to manage our household expenses. I do not go out and work, as I have to perform my household chores and take care of my kids.

A year ago, when my son dropped out school, he became an apprentice at a shoemaker’s shop. There he learned to make shoe buckles. Now, he wants to start up his own business and make shoe buckles. Please lend us $250. With this money, I will get him a machine that is used to make shoe buckles.

loans.use: Buy machine used to make shoe buckles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Segara Mandala Group

texts.id:
”Segara Mandala” Group is a group of ladies in Tukadaya village who has the common will to advance the group and also to increase living standard of each member. This group forms a business, chaired by Ni Ketut Suci Ariani, secretary Ni Putu Sukawati, and bookkeeper Ni Ketut Sudiantari. This group has 8 members. The group's activity consist of borrow & loan between the group, and also raising pigs in each member's home, together with their families. However in raising pigs they are still using the traditional way, so that they could not get maximal result. Via Dinari Foundation, this group got training and consulting of groups business running, mangement the group, and help in raising pigs plus support via loans. With loans for each member of Rp2,500,000 (about US$265), they could allocate it to buy 8 piglets at Rp250,000 (about US$26)/piece, and feed expenses of Rp500,000 (about US$52), the group could enhance feed quality, and also superior pigs. The Segara Mandala group after 5 months raising will sell the pigs coordinated by Dinari Foundation for their marketing, to obtain good market price. With management and better group work, this group could achieve its objectives of togetherness and increase group's living standard.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok ”Segara Mandala” adalah kelompok ibu-ibu di Desa Tukadaya yang mempunyai asas kebersamaan untuk memajukan kelompok dan juga meningkatkan tarap hidup dari masing-masing anggota. Kelompok ini membentuk suatu kepengurusan yang diketuai oleh Ni Ketut Suci Ariani, dengan sekretaris Ni Putu Sukawati dan Bendahara Ni Ketut Sudiantari. Kelompok ini beranggotakan 8 Orang. Dalam kegiatannya kelompok ini melakukan beberapa kegiatan diantaranya adalah melakukan simpan pinjam dalam kelompok dan juga mereka melakukan kegiatan memelihara ternak Babi di rumah mereka masing-masing. Kegiatan memelihara babi ini sudah lama mereka tekuni bersama dengan keluarganya masing – masing , tetapi dalam pemeliharaanya masih mempergunakan cara yang tradisiaonal sehingga mereka tidak mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal. Melalui Yayasan Dinari kelompok ini medapat pembinaan dan penyuluhan mengenai pengelolaan kelompok , management kelompok maupun pendampingan dalam pemeliharaan babi serta dukungan pinjaman dana. Dengan penambahan pinjaman dana yang masing –masing anggota sebesar Rp 2.500.000,- mereka dapat mengalokasikan untuk membeli 8 ekor bibit babi @ Rp 250 000,- dan Rp 500 000,- untuk biaya pakan, kelompok akan bisa memperbaiki kwalitas pakan dan juga jenis babi yang unggul . Kelompok Segara Mandala setelah 5 bulan masa pemeliharaanya akan menjual babinya bersama sama dengan dikoordinir oleh Yayasan Dinari untuk pemasarannya sehingga kelompok akan mendapatkan harga pasaran yang baik. Dengan managemen dan pengelolan kelompok yang lebih baik , maka kelompok akan bisa mencapai asasnya seperti yang tersebut diatas yaitu asas kebersamaan dan peningkatan tarap hidup anggotanya.

loans.use: To buy pig feedstock and feed

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
I am Rita A. from Lahore, a city with great history. I am married, and I have four children. All of my children are very brilliant and attend a nearby local school. I serve as a maid in one of the houses in a nearby posh area of the city, whereas my husband makes thread reels.

He buys the thread from a nearby market and winds it on the reels and then covers them in a plastic cover. He sells these reels in the same market. Our expenses are growing along with our children, and we feel the need of extra income.

Therefore, my husband plans to expand his business for which he requires a loan of $300. He will buy thread and plastic reels in bulk, and my eldest son will help him in the business, too. The increase in profits will help us continue with the studies of our children and will also assist us to improve our financial status.

loans.use: Expand thread reels business

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
My name is Zahara B.. I was born and brought up in a small town called Pattoki. But after I got married, I had to move to Lahore with my husband. Since then, I have lived in Lahore. I am a mother of five children: four boys and one girl.

My husband works at a government institute for a meager income. My eldest son is a rickshaw ( local three-wheeled taxi) driver. My son now plans to buy another rickshaw, which he will rent out to supplement his income. For this purpose we request a loan of $175.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Guilaze Almeida

texts.pt:
Guilaze Almeida M. was born in Massaca district, in Boane, province of Maputo. He is 50 years old; he was raised with both of her sisters who later passed away. After completing the 4th grade he enrolled in a school to be an electrical technician but he was not able to graduate. In the same here he attended driving school.

In 1988 he started working as a driver. The job only lasted a couple of months and after he started working planting potatoes. In 1979 he married his girlfriend and now has 5 kids, of whom 3 are girls. He has a small store and in he also raises chicken in the backyard. He approached Hluvuku-Adsema to request a loan to invest in his chicken business. His dream is to expand his planting area and to do better in the chicken business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Guilaze Almeida M. Actividade: Agro-Pecuaria Valor De Empréstimo:20.000,00Mt(800 USd) Aplicação:Compra De Frangos Para Revenda Inicio: 28-11-07 Fim: 22-03-09 Guilaze Almeida M., Natural de Massaca,distrito de Boane , província de Maputo, de 50 anos de idade teve duas irmãs estas já falicidas, orfao de pai e mãe. Estudou ate a 4 classe na escola oficial de boane. Depois segue para escola de electricidade da baixa tensão para uma formação na área de elctricidade, nao conseguiu concluir. No mesmo ano vai a escola de condução para tirar a licença de conduçao.

Em 1988 começa a trabalhar na empresa de drenos como motorista do Director. No ano seguinte é promovido à chefe de transportes. O emprego durou poucos meses, largou e começou a assumir a conta própria na área da agricultura na produção de batata reno nas quintas que erdou dos seus progenitores. Um tempo depois para com actividade agrícola, por ter sido comprada a empresa que fornecia-lhe energia para alimentar as suas motobombas que usava para o regadio. Em 1979 compra o seu talhão com a sua namorada, e no mesmo ano casou-se e conta com 5 filhos dos quais 3 são menianas. Tem um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e uma capoeira onde tem criado os frangos para revenda. A sua actividade de criação de frangos fica parada por ter sofrido roubo, neste momento vende apenas produtos de primeira necessidade.

Passado algum tempo decide aproximar-se a Hluvuku-Adsema para remeter um pedido de empréstimo para criação de frangos, actividade. Soube da nossa existência da Hluvuku-Adsema apartir do seu sogro, Sr. Matendeudja, residente no Umpala que é nosso cliente. Entende o credito como uma boa ferramenta que possa ajudar as populacões que nao tem possibilidade de entrar nos grandes bancos maiores. Tem como maior sonho desenvolver a agricultura nas suas quintas e ter uma boa producao na area de avicultura.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband who is a rickshaw driver. He already owns a rickshaw but he wants to buy an additional one. He will rent this rickshaw to supplement his current income. I am a mother of three children, all of whom are too young to attend the school. But when they will be of school age, I want to enroll them in a high-quality school. Therefore, we will save the income from this added rickshaw for our children's future.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru:
Muhtaram used to work at a bakery, until she opened her own baking business. Muhtaram bakes sambusy (Tajik national baked food). Muhtaram has 3 children, who sometimes help her in business. Muhtaram bakes and her oldest son delivers the products to the local market. Sometimes, Muhtaram bakes for special orders and events. Most of her products are sold wholesale to stores and street vendors.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мухтарам раньше работала в пекарне, сейчас она сама открыла свою пекарню , где печет самбусы (национальные пирожки). У нее трое детей, время от времени они ей помогают . Она сама делает и печет самбусы, старшый сын разносит на рынок, иногда она печет на заказ на различные мероприятия . В основном она подает оптом свойтовар, где ее товар раздается отдельно по магазинам или уличным торговцам.

loans.use: Production and sales of sambusy

loans.name: Lizete Venancio

texts.pt:
Lisete Venâncio B. is a 34 year old widow. She was born in Boane, a province of Maputo, and raised with her 11 brothers and sisters. She only studied until the 7th grade. She has an 11 year old son. Lisete met her husband in 1994 and moved in with him in the neighborhood of Fiche in Boane. Her husband left for RSA and passed away there. In 1998, after the passing of her husband she started working on her small business.

She first a approached credit program in Gueguegue in the neighborhood of 4 Boane, but this program only offered loans for groups. She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsemathrough friends and her first loan was of 10.000mt, which she repaid. With the income from her business, Lisete supports her family and pays for the schooling of her son. She manages the business herself. Her work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Lisete and her family and it brings products closer to the clients. In the future she would like to buy her own shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao:Bairro 7 Cliente:Lisete Venancio B. Actividade:Comercio Valor de empréstimo :10.000,00 mt (400.00 USd) Aplicação de montante : Compra e venda de milho Inicio: 28-11-07 Fim : 22-03-09 Lisete Venâncio B., viúva de 34 anos de idade, natural de Boane, província de Maputo,cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais numa família alargada de 11 irmaos , tem actualmente 1 filho de 11 anos de idade e estudou até 7ªclasse devido as condições financeiras da família . Conheceu o marido em 1994 e passou a viver com ele junto com os sogros no bairro Fiche em Boane, mais tarde o marido foi a R.S.A e morreu por la. Em 1998 após a morte do marido começou a exercer um pequeno negocio, como forma de sobrivivênca . Teve o seu 1ºcontacto com o credito numa pequena associação denominada Gueguegue localizada no bairro 4 Boane, que oferecia créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma experiênçia boa porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir a responsabilidade grupal. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas e dai aproximou e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para compra de produtos e pagou sem nenhum problema,com este credito de 10.000,00 MT, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria.

Com os rendimentos do mesmo suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares e de saúde da familia. Actualmente esta explorando um pequeno estabelecimento ao lado do mercado Boane. Ela dirige pessoalmente o negocio e na sua ausença o filho é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de colocar o produto mais próximo do residente de Boane, providencia emprego a ela própria. A perspectiva futura é ter um estabelecimento próprio.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chhuon T., age 47, is divorced, runs a flower stand, and lives with her three children. One of her children is a policeman, one is employed at a private company, and the last is a student. She requests a loan of $1100 to purchase more flowers for her inventory and purchase ten piglets to raise for additional income to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her inventory and purchase ten piglets to raise for additional income to support her children.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S., age 45, sells fish at a market, earning around $12.5 per day. She lives with her ailing husband in Kompong Chhnang province. They have three children, two who help her with her business and one who is a student. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a small van for carrying fish. This will increase the quantity of fish she can sell and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a van to transport fish.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: I am Shahida B. from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I live in a small two room brick house with my husband and seven children. My husband and I both decorate bangles with various beads and traditional ornaments. We buy these bangles from a nearby bangle market and embellish them with various ornamental stuffs and sell them to various shops. We request a loan of $250 to expand our business to increase our household earnings.

loans.use: To expand bangles business

loans.name: Leonardo Lucas

texts.pt:
Leonardo Lucas B. was born in Manjacaze in 1971. He studied until the 6th grade at Manguzi Primary School while living with his parents. In 1985 he was transferred to the city of Xai-Xai to live at a school where his uncle taught. There he completed 7th through 9th grades at Xai-Xai Secondary School. In 1991 he enrolled in a 4-year course at Instituto Médio Pedagógico (IMEP). He got married in 1993 and today has one girl and two boys. In 1995 he began working as a teacher at Caniaçado Primary School in the province of Gaza. One year later he was forced to resign due to illness. In 1997 he moved to Maputo where he renewed his contract and worked at Jonasse Primary School. In 1999 Leonardo built a canteen at the school in order to provide his family with a needed additional source of income. In 2001 he was transferred to Mahubo Primary School to work as the Pedagogical Director. In 2002 he was transferred to Juba Primary School in the same position. In April 2005, he returned to Jonasse. In 2007, for the sake of convenience, he was transferred to Boane to work at Umpala Primary School as a simple teacher. At this last school he was again able to open a canteen.

Leonardo heard about Hluvuku-adsema through his friends. He repaid his first loan of 15,600.00 MT without any difficulties. Leonardo intends to use this second loan of 19,000.00 MT to increase his supply of merchandise.

His business has a positive impact on the community because it enables students and teachers to obtain snacks and school material without leaving the school building.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Boane-Mozal Cliente: Leonardo Lucas B. Actividade: Comercio Valor do empréstimo: 19.000,00MT ( 760 USD ) Aplicação: Compra de mercadoria para revenda Inicio: 28-11-07 Fim: 22-03-09

Leonardo Lucas B., nasceu em Manjacaze em 1971 frequentou o ensino primário ate 6ª classe na escola primária de manguzi em Manjacazi na companhia dos pais. Em 1985 foi transferido para a cidade de Xai-Xai, onde continuou com os seus estudos de 7ª a 9ª classe na escola secundária de Xai-Xai, vivendo numa escola da educação pois o tio era professor. Em 1991, ingressou no instituto médio pedagógico (IMEP) na cidade de Maputo, curso este que teve a duração de 4 anos. Contraiu o matrimónio em 1993, com o qual conta ate hoje com 3 filhos, sendo uma menina e dois rapazes. Em 1995 começa a trabalhar como professor do ensino primário na escola primária e completa de Caniçado, provincia de Gaza. Um ano depois, pediu a anulação do contrato devido a doença, em1997 decide deslocar-se para viver em Maputo onde, no mesmo ano, renovou o seu contrato e trabalhou na escola primária e completa de Jonasse. Com a necessidade de ter mais uma fonte de rendimento decide, em 1999, construir uma cantina escolar na mesma mesma zona. Em 2001 foi transferido para a escola primária de Mahubo, onde desempenhou funções de Director pedagógico. Em 2002 foi transferido para a escola primaria de juba com a mesma função. Em Abril de 2005 volta novamente para jonasse, como pedagógico e em 2007 por conveniência do serviço foi transferido para Boane já como um professor simples na Escola primária de Umpala. Nesta Escola, tambem, conseguiu abrir uma cantina Escolar.

Soube da existência da Hluuku-adsema através de conversas com amigos e aproximou pela primeira vez pedindo um empréstimo no valor de 15.600.00mt, tendo reembolsado sem nenhuma dificuldade. Veio desta vez solicitar um empréstimo de 19.000.00mt que pretende com este aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na sociedade pois ajuda os alunos e professores para poderem obter o seu lanche e material escolar sem precisarem de se deslocar para fora do recinto escolar.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Mrs. Chut S., age 26, works in a garment factory, earning around $2.50 each day. Her husband grows and grinds crops and raises pigs, earning about $4/day. They have two children who are students and a dependent sister living with them. She requests a loan of $1000  to expand her livestock by adding 10 piglets and two cows to breed and resell.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding 10 piglets and two cows to breed and resell.

loans.name: Lout

texts.en: Mrs. Lout Teang, 34, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife cooking food for her members, while her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman, earning up to $10/day. Two of her children are students and another one is too young to attend school. Mrs. Lout Teang hopes to use this loan to purchase wood and some construction tools for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and some construction tools for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Mrs. Thuch S., age 44, is a widow and works selling grocery products, earning around $5 each day. She has no children. She requests a loan of $1000 to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to fulfill her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To add inventory to her grocery store.

loans.name: Tezgul

texts.en: Tezgul is a 46-year-old woman who owns livestock for breeding in the southern village of the Saatli region. She is married and has 5 children. She has more than 10 years experience in animal breeding. She loves her business, because she is certain that she can always sell her products. The reason for her confidence is because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani people eat meat almost every day. As she and her husband are unemployed, calf sales is the only financial source for her family. Tezgul works very hard to keep her family in good conditions, however, it is very hard when you have a big family and the prices for products increase almost every day. To improve her economic condition, she needs more funds to expand her business. So she decided to apply for a 1200 USD loan to purchase four calves for an estimated cost 300 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: Mrs. Thach S. H., 29, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To serve her family’s needs, she runs a stand at home selling grocery products, earning around $6/day. Her husband is employed by a private company, making about $7/day. Mrs Thach S. H. has applied for a loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery products.

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Mrs. Tit S. , age 46, is a widow who sells fruits at a market, earning up to $10/day. She has five children, two who work with her in the market and three who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to expand her inventory that her customers want.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Tik

texts.en: Mrs. Tik Y., age 60, works with her husband growing rice crops and raising domestic animals. They have seven children; two who are employed at a medical company, one who is employed by a micro finance organization, one who is a teacher, one who is employed by a local organization, and two who are students. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase more land to expand her farm. This will increase the amount of rice she can grow and sell, thereby increasing the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more land to expand her farm.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Tik Yun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun S., age 43, works with her husband breeding pigs and ducks to sell to a butchery shop.  She earn on average about $2 each day. They have four children who are all married. She requests a loan of $1000 in order to increase her livestock by purchasing more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the southern small village of Fatalikend in the Saatli region. She is married and has two children. She has sold dairy products such as milk and yogurt for more than five years. She has her permanent customers, and many local people and bazaar traders come to her house to purchase dairy every day.

She thinks that now it is time to expand her business because demand for these products has increased very much. Sometimes the number of orders exceeds the number of products her cow can make. She applied for 1200 USD to purchase one milk cow to increase her number of sales, and for two calves for breeding. The estimated cost for one cow is 700 USD and for one calf is 200-250 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a mother of seven children, three boys and four girls. I live in a small rented house with my husband and children. My husband is a daily wage laborer, I make thread reels and my eldest son makes electric heaters. Winter is around the corner and heaters will be high in demand. We want to expand our business and produce a high quantity of heaters.  We request a loan of $250 to buy the materials required to manufacture these heaters in bulk. We hope to generate higher profits this year, which we will save to marry one of our daughters.

loans.use: To expand heater business

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mrs. Huon E., age 30, works selling Khmer traditional cakes, earning about $1.50 each day. Her husband works transporting vegetables and meat to the markE., earning around $3 each day. They have two children who are students. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to more efficiently transport goods, raising his sales volume and increasing the family’s income. Her husband is pictured as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to transport goods to the market.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin N. E., 25, is a mother of two young children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, earning on average about $7/day. Her husband works as a mechanic and generally earns about $8/day. Mrs. Chhin N. E. requests a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory in order to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Salomi

texts.en: My name is Salomi B.. I am married with two children, both of whom attend school. I wish them a good future and a higher education so that they can find good jobs for themselves. My husband buys the gold residue that is turned out when jewelry is carved out of gold. He then melts this residue and makes small gold bars out of it. He is in the process of expanding his business for which he requests a loan of $250.He will buy the gold residue in suitable quantity with this loan.

loans.use: To expand gold residue business

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Ms Lương, 26 years old, has 2 young children. She is a young lady but she works hard. Everyday she sells vegetables at the market. She also raises poultry at home. Her husband is a construction worker, he makes a small salary but it does help his family. They wish to obtain a loan to buy chicken feed. They will save money to pay back the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lương 26 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ. Tuy còn trẻ nhưng chị rất chăm chỉ làm ăn. Hàng ngày chị đi bán rau ở chợ, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn nuôi gà thịt để bán. Chồng chị là thợ xây , thu nhập của anh tuy it ỏi nhưng cũng giúp đỡ được khá nhiều cho cuộc sống gia đình. Anh chị rất mong nhận được vốn để hỗ trợ việc mua cám cho gà. Thu nhập từ đi chợ và chăn nuôi gà, chị sẽ để dành để hoàn trả vốn.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh K. U., age 37, works raising and selling pigs. Her husband works as a broker buying and selling wood and charcoal, earning around $5/day. They have six children, four who are students and two who are married and live away from home. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase additional fuel supplies for her husband’s inventory. This will increase his sales and raise the family’s income level.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of fuel.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno trades children's clothes and shoes in the main market of her village.  She is 28, married, and has one child.  Two years ago, when she just started her business, she sold children's underwear and small number of shoes in her assortment.  After she started working with MicroInvest and received a loan, she increased and improved the assortment of goods. She became engaged in trade after one of her friends asked her to help. Now she is happy she started doing that because now she has constant source of income.

loans.use: Trade of children's clothes and shoes

loans.name: Thi Thiet

texts.vi:
Ms Thiết is 32 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She and her husband grind rice then sell it at the market. She also raises pigs which are fed with the bran & husk waste from the rice grinding. Their income is steady so she thinks that the weekly repayment is easy for her. She's requesting a loan to buy pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thiết, 32 tuổi có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Công việc hàng ngày của hai vợ chồng là đi thu mua thóc về xay xát thành gạo rồi đem bán ở chợ. Ngoài ra, chị còn kết hợp với nuôi lợn để tận dụng nguồn cám có được từ việc xay xát. Thu nhập của anh chị kiếm được khá ổn định nên chị thấy việc trả góp hàng tuần là rất dễ dàng. Chị muốn sau này được vay với số tiền lớn hơn để mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S., 28, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a market-vendor selling fresh vegetables, earning around $6/day, while her husband runs a cart selling fried noodles, earning around $8/day.  Two of their children are students and the rest of whom is too young to attend school. Mrs. Oun S. asks for a loan to purchase more vegetables for her inventory and to buy a motor-bike for her husband’s cart so that it will make his business more productive, faster and easier.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her inventory and to buy a motor-bike to attach with her husband’s cart.

loans.name: Ashirjon

texts.en:
Ashirjon has been engaged in business for over 6 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is located in the food market in Spitamen, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. Her business point is always crowded; that is why she has fast turnover of her goods. She said that food products are always requested by customers and have high demand.

Ashirjon became a client of MLF MicroInvest in 2005. With the loans, she expanded her assortment of food products. From Kiva, she wants to receive a loan to purchase the next batch of food products.

loans.use: Purchase the next batch of food products.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: D. Mahbuba is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She has traded at a clothing market for almost 4 years. The goods she sells are mainly female and male clothes as well as shoes. She would like to use her next loan to buy a winter season assortment of goods.

loans.use: Trade of female and male clothes

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: My name is  Rasheeda B. and I am a widow from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am a mother of six children. My eldest son is the only bread winner of our family. He makes thread on a spinning machine. Pakistan is one of the largest thread producing countries, and its thread is known for its quality. We request a loan of $250 to produce more thread by buying an additional spinning machine, which one of my other sons will operate.

loans.use: To buy a spinning machine

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
Mrs. Sing S., 52, is a widow and lives with her five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her income, Sing S. sells fruit at a busy market, earning about $8/day.  One of her children is a garment worker, aonther one is a mechanic and the rest are unemployed. Mrsh Sing S. asks for a loan to help her expand her inventory to include more fruit her clients want. 

( in the picture, Sing S. is peeling the skin of fruit to her customer with the red shirt)

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to meet her customer demands

loans.name: Thi Dan

texts.vi:
Ms Dân is 22 years old. She lives in Nghêm Xá hamlet, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 young children. She has learned the trade from her husband who is a furniture maker. They custom make beds, tables, chairs ...etc. It takes them 3-4 days to make a bed. Her husband's family has been in this business for a long time so they have a good reputation. This business provides them a steady job. Now they need to upgrade their tools so she has decided to join the fund. She's requesting a loan to buy new tools. She will pay back the loan according to the loan term

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dân 22 tuổi sống ở thôn Nghêm Xá, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có chồng và có 2 con còn nhỏ. Chị lấy chồng và tham gia vào công việc của nhà chông là làm nghề mộc. Gia đình chị chủ yếu đóng giường, tủ, bàn ghế...theo đặt hàng của khách. Cũng phải mất đến 3-4 ngày mới làm xong 1 cái giường hoặc 1 cái tủ. Nghề mộc là nghề mà gia đình chồng chị đã làm khá lâu và có uy tín, cũng là công việc chính tạo thu nhập cho gia đình. Gần đây, một số dụng cụ làm nghề đã cũ và lạc hậu nên chị đã quyết định tham gia vay vốn để mua mới dụng cụ và cam kết sẽ hoàn trả đúng kỳ hạn

loans.use: To purchase tools for making furniture

loans.name: Rasse

texts.pt:
Rasse Antonio T., 54, was born in Maputo where she studied until the second grade. Due to her family’s financial situation, she left home at the age of 13 to live with her grandfather in Boane, where she lives until today. In 1970 Rasse began a small business in order to survive. She got married in 1973 and today has 6 children. Rasse took out her first loan through a small association called G.G.L.S. in Matola that offered credit to groups. It was not a good experience because, besides the loans being very small, the borrowers had to take responsibility for anyone in the group who defaulted on their part of the loan.

Rasse heard about Hluvuku through her friends, and applied for her first loan to purchase products. She intends to use the 15,000.00 MT to increase her supply of merchandise, and with the profits provide for her family’s needs and her children’s education. She is currently hoping to have her own building in a good business environment.

Rasse’s business has a significant impact on the community because it offers clients easy access to her products, and it provides work for her and her children, who are older but without employment opportunities. Rasse runs the business herself, and her children help out when she’s absent. In the future, Rasse would like to have a safe, brick building.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizacao : bairro 4 Cliente : Rasse Antonio T. Actividade : Comercio Valor de empréstimo : 15.000,00mt ( 600 USD ) Actividade: Compra de produtos para revenda Inicio : 28-11-07 Fim: 22-03-09

Rasse António T. nasceu em Maputo em 1953, tem 54 anos de idade, estudou ate 2ª classe devido as condições financeiras da família aos seus 13 anos deixa de viver com os pais e passa a viver com avo em Boane onde encontra se a residir actualmente .Em 1970 comecou a exercer um pequeno negocio para a sobrivivencia .Em 1973 juntou-se com o seu marido e passou a viver com ele ,tem actualmente 6 filhos . Teve o seu 1º contacto de empréstimo com uma pequena associação G.G.L.S localizada na Matola que oferecia créditos em grupos ,não tendo sido uma experiência boa porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casosde um dos elementos do grupo não efectuasse o pagamento .

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas e dai aproximou e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para compra de produtos ,com este emprestimo de 15.000.00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria,com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares e escolares dos seu filhos . Actualmente esta explorando um estabelecimento próprio ,mas sendo o único no local que oferece um bom ambiente de negocio .

A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade pois para alem de colocar o produto mais próximo do cliente providencia o auto emprego a ela e para os filhos já maiores mas sem oportuniodade de emprego. Ela dirige pessoalmente o seu negocio na ausência os filhos é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo. Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negocio e ter um estabelecimento seguro de alvenaria.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin is a young 18-year-old businessman who owns his food store in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Yasin is one of the youngest businessmen in his Varkhanend village in Saatli. He started his business in 2006 when he borrowed money from his friends and opened his small food store. He sells cereals and canned food and other products that don’t need refrigeration. Now Yasin is going to diversify the number of his products and start selling dairy and meat products. For this aim he needs 1200 USD for the purchase of a special food refrigerator.

loans.use: Going to purchase a special food refrigerator

loans.name: Elyor

texts.en: Elyor is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. His business is to sell carpets of different sizes. He bought his goods from the carpet factory in Kayrakum, Khujand, Tajikistan. His business is located in the Spitamen market. He has a stable business and his assets are increasing every month. He has repaid his loan on time without any problems. His turnover is fast and now he has received a big order for three sizes of carpets (2x3,1.5x1 and 3.5x4). He needs extra capital to purchase carpets from the factory.

loans.use: Purchase 20 carpets (2x3), 40 small carpets (1.5x1) and 10 of the biggest carpets (3.5x4).

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: I am Shabana B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  I am married with two children. Both of my children are not of school going age yet, but when they are, I plan to send them to school. My husband supplies construction material such as cement and bricks on order from various construction companies. My husband will be able to take on bigger orders if he can get the necessary funds to buy cement and bricks in bulk. We request a loan to expand our business.

loans.use: To expand existing construction material business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Location: Neighborhood 6 -- Boane/Maputo

Client: Rosalina M.

Activity: Residence

Loan Value: 15000 meticais ($635USd)

Application: Purchase of construction materials

Beginning: Nov 28, 2007

End: March 22, 2009

Rosalina M., 46 years old, is from Xai-Xai in Gaza Province. She is an orphan and has three sisters who are still living. She started school at Maciene Elementary School. In 1978, she went on to the Chokwe Agricultural School to major in agriculture, through 1980.

In 1981 she went to the Accelerated Learning Center in Boane, living in the school home at 20 years of age. After the course, she went to work in Tete province as a middle-school teacher for six years. During her stay in Tete, she married and had two girls, one now grown. Her third child was born in Maputo, in Boane district.

In 1990, she returned to the Institute in Boane and simultaneously transferred to an elementary school. After finishing, in 1993, she went to work in the Agricultural Institute of Boane as a teacher, living in the Institute home.

When land was being subdivided in Boane, she approached the District Administration to request a lot for construction, having had the construction of her house authorized.

After some time off from studies due to her youngest child, in 2004 she decided to go back to school. She applied to the School of Social Science. She studies and continues to work.

She heard of Hluvuku Adsema through conversations with her co-workers and friends in other schools in the district. She decided to submit her first proposal for the value of 15000 meticais to buy construction materials.

Her greatest dream is to see her house built and her children complete higher education.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localização Bairro 6- Boane/ Maputo

Cliente: Rosarolina M.

Actividade: Habitação

Valor De Empréstimo: 15.000,00Mt(556.00USS)

Aplicação: Compra de Materiais de construção

Inicio: 28-11-07

Fim: 22-03-09

Rosalina M., de 46 anos de idade, natural de xai-xai província de Gaza, órfão, tem 3 irmãs ainda vivas. Começa a estudar na escola primaria de Maciene até a conclusão do nível primário do primeiro grau(Ep1) e Ep2 antigamente chamado primeiro ciclo preparatório- assim dito pela cliente. Em 1978 passa para Escola básica agrária de chokwe para se formar na área de agricultura até o ano de 1980.

Em 1981 segue para o centro de formação acelerado em Boane vivendo no lar da escola com os seus 20 anos de idade. Depois do curso, vai trabalhar na província de Tete como professora de nivel medio durante 6 anos. Na sua estadia em Tete casa-se e deste resultam duas meninas, uma já maior de idade. O seu terceiro filho veio a ter ja em Maputo no distrito de Boane.

Em 1980 volta pra instituto de formação em Boane e em simultâneo a sua transferência para Boane para uma Escola primaria. Depois da formcão, em 1993 vai trabalhar no instituto agrário de Boane como professora até o ano em curso. Vive na casa do Instituto.

Durante o período do parcelamento, em Boane, ela aproximou-se a Administracão do Distrito para requere um talhão para construir a sua obra tendo sido autorizada a construção da sua casa.

Durante algum tempo parada nos estudos por causa do seu filho menor, em 2004 decide voltar a estudar. Concoreu para Faculdade de cienciais sociais. Estuda e continua a trabalhar.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA apartir de conversas com seus colegas, nossos clientes, e suas amigas das outras Escolas do distrito. Decide remeter seu primeiro pedido no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção que foi aprovado na sua totalidade.

Tem como seu maior sonho ver, sua casa concluída e a sua filha a concluir o seus filhos com nível superior.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: I am Bushra T. from Lahore, a big and a busy city. I wind thread on plastic spools and then wrap them in plastic covers formt daily wages. My husband works at a private company for a scant wage. If you lend us $175, we will start our own business producing thread spools. With this loan sum we will buy thread, reels and boxes to pack them. We want to achieve a better financial future for ourselves.

loans.use: To start producing thread spools

loans.name: Thi Hay

texts.vi:
Ms Hay is 48 years old. She has 3 children, one is working and the other two are still in school. Since they live near the market (good location), she had opened a clothing store. She has been owning the store for a while now so the revenue from the store is stable. She's requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store. Her husband raises poultry and pigs at home. They would set aside part of their income to pay back the loan

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hay 48 tuổi, chị có 3 con, 1 con đã đi làm và 2 con còn đi học. Chị sống ở khu vực gần chợ nên đã mở cửa hàng bán quần áo. Chị làm nghề này đã lâu và có thu nhập ổn định. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm quần ấo về bán. Chồng chị ở nhà nuôi lợn, gà để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập của cả nhà sẽ để dành một phần để hoàn trả vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase more clothings for sales

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: I request a loan of $250 for my husband who is a rickshaw driver. At present, he rents someone else's rickshaw but wants to buy his own because, after paying the rent, he is left with a very little money, insufficient for us to make ends meet. To supplement my husband’s income, I work at a beauty parlor for a small pay of $50 a month. I have three children all of whom attend the school.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: I am a mother of four children: three boys and one girl. My husband works at a government institute and his pay is very scanty. It was impossible for us to manage our living with his salary.  In order to increase our household income, I started a thread reels business. I get thread on order from various thread producing factories, wind it on small plastic reels and then wrap them in plastic covers. I then supply these reels back to the factory who in turn gives me a reasonable rate of profit. I want to expand my business for which I request a loan of $350. I will buy a machine to wind thread on plastic reels. This way my work will become efficient and I will be able to take on bigger orders.

loans.use: Buy a machine that is used to wind thread on reels

loans.name: Thi Cuc

texts.vi:
Ms Cúc is 24 years old. She is married and has a young child. She is a hard working woman. She has a small butcher stand at the market selling pork and pork sausages. Everyday she wakes up very early to pick up the pork and the sausages from her trusted suppliers to assure the quality. Usually she sells out everything before noon. She would like to obtain a loan so that she could add beef and chickens to her butcher stand. Her income is stable so she will be able to make weekly repayment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Cúc 24 tuổi, có chồng và có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là người phụ nữ chịu khó làm ăn. Chị đi chợ bán thịt lợn và giò chả. Hàng ngày chị dậy từ rất sớm để đi lấy hàng. Chị lấy hàng ở những mối quen nên rất đảm bảo chất lượng và hợp vệ sinh. Hàng chị bán trong vòng buổi sáng là hết. Có những lúc không có đủ hàng để bán cho khách. Chị rất mong được vay vốn để mở rộng mặt hàng của mình có thể là thịt bò hoặc thịt gà. Thu nhập của chị rất ổn định nên việc hoàn trả vốn theo tuần là rất phù hợp với chị.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sales

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I request you a loan of $350 for my husband, who makes thread reels. He needs this loan to buy a machine that is used to wind thread on plastic reels. This way he won't have to wind the thread manually, and his work will be more efficient. We have five children, two sons and three daughters. The eldest son helps his father in the business, while the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy a machine that is used to wind thread on reels

loans.name: Saf Lokho Group

texts.fr:
Chickens are in short supply in Oussouye and restaurants, hotels and other places that serve chicken find it difficult to source enough locally. For this reason, the five young women of the Saf Lokho group hope to form a cooperative to raise chickens ensuring themselves a stable and reliable source of income with relatively little competion. The project will create employment for all five women and allow them to improve their financial situation. They already have space dedicated to the business and are asking for a loan to buy chicks and feed and to refurbish used equipment. With that, they will have everything they need to supply local restaurants and hotels.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Le groupe « Saf Lokho » est composée de jeunes femmes qui veulent faire de l’élevage de poulets de chaire pour fournir le marché local. Nous nous sommes rendu compte que les populations, restaurants, hôtels et autre lieu de vente de repas ont du mal à trouver de la volaille dans le marché. Pour faire face à cette situation, la création d’une unité de production s’avère être une source de revenu stable et durable, dans la mesure où cette activité est très rare dans le département d’Oussouye. Puisque nous avons déjà les locaux qui vont servir à la production des poulets, nous souhaitons avec le financement, acheter des poussins, de l’aliment, renouveler le matériel usé que nous avons, et aussi de faire en sorte que tous les intrants nécessaires au projet puissent être disponible. Ce projet va permettre de créer des emplois pour les membres du groupe et d’améliorer la situation financière de ses membres. C’est ainsi que les produits de l’élevage seront disponibles pour la communauté et pour tous les restaurants et hôtels de la zone qui souhaiteraient se faire fournir en poulets de chaire.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil is a 36-year-old farmer who owns his livestock business in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Saatli. He has more than six years of experience in raising and breeding calves. He started his business in 2001 when he  borrowed his first loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase a cow. It brought good income to his family. He is married and has one child. He sells milk to the local bazaar traders, and he would like to broaden his activities and start breeding calves. He is happy to run his business. He would like to expand by purchasing four calves. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves each for 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Silvano Mateus

texts.pt:
Activity: Residence

Loan amount: 16.000 meticais (677USD)

Loan use: to purchase construction material

Loan start date: Nov 19, 2007

Loan end date: Dec 5, 2009

Silvano Mateus B. was born in Massaco, Boane, in 1972. He only studied until eight grade. In 1986 he joined a troop to train as a militiaman, returning in 1987.

He quit his studies because he had to change shifts, and the conditions were not conducive to continuing his studies.

He lived with his parents until he was 19 years of age, and at 26, he started having a girlfriend, marrying officially once 35 years old.

He currently has four kids, the eldest 14 years old.

He has already worked in several organizations, such as Ara Sul (1989-1995), CMC (1998-2000), Trac Africa (2000-2005), currently working for Bananalândia as a driver.

He has already worked in commerce, traveling to the north of the country to buy beans and corn for resale in Maputo. The results of the sale were not satisfactory, and he later chose to cease this effort.

He got to know Hluvuku-Adsema thanks to his wife. He approached them and asked for credit in the amount of 16000 meticais, and plans to enlarge his house.

For him, credit is a viable, highly progressive fund for rural and urban communities.

In the future, he plans to ask for credit to finish his construction effort.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Silvano Mateus B. Nasceu em Massaca, distrito de Boane em 1972. Estudou apenas ate a 8 ª classe.

Em 1986 foi a tropa para treinar como Miliciano e voltou em 1987.

Deixou de estudar porque teve que mudar de turno e as condições em que se encontrava não lhe favoreciam para continuar com os seus estudos.

Viveu com os pais ate aos 19 anos de idade e aos 26 anos começou a namorar tendo casdo, oficialmente, aos 35 anos de idade.

Tem actualmente 4 filhos sendo o mais velho com 14 anos de idade.

Já trabalhou em varias instituição como : Ara Sul (1989-1995), CMC (1998-2000) Trac Africa (2000-2005) e actualmente esta trabalhando na Bananalândia como Motorista .

Já praticou o comércio, viajava para o norte do país para comprar feijão e milho para revender no Maputo, o resultado da venda não era satisfatório tendo depois optado em desistir.

Conheceu a Hluvuku - Adsema graças a esposa dai aproximou se e pediu um credito no valor de 16.000.00mt e pretende ampliar a sua casa.

Para ele, o credito e um fundo viável e de alta progressão para as comunidades rurais e urbanas.

Futuramente pretende pedir um crédito para concluir a obra.

loans.use: to buy material to build a house

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif is a 43 year-old married man who lives with his four children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He has two cows and sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders. He has nine years of experience in this field. Since dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan, Yusif has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. The income was enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder, so Yusif applied for 1200 USD to expand his activities and start selling calves for meat production. The estimated cost for one calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob M. is a 47-year-old retired army officer and a resident of the Vingunguti area. Since his retirement, he started a business. He runs a retail shop at his home, selling various items. He now wants to expand his business and increase the stock in his shop so as to look after his family. He is in need of $1,200 to help expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim Q. lives in Varkhandi village in Saatli. He is 41 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is running a small farm and breeds animals for meat production and sells them to the local bazaar traders. With the money he earned from selling livestock, he built a shed. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase four calves. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves for 300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 49 years old and is married to Bernarda Alfonzo, who is 40. They have 8 children. The oldest is a student at the university, two others just finished high school this year, and the others are all school aged. The family lives together in their own home in the Simbrón of Roque González.

Juan is a multifaceted person who works in many different fields in order to take care of his family. He farms, raises cattle, and also produces sweet honey that he sells in the capital city. He employs 15 people, and he feels very proud of being able to give others the opportunity to generate their own income.

He wants to continue bettering his quality of life, and he is asking for a loan in order to buy cattle for resale as beef to various butcher shops in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan tiene 49 años esta casado con la señora Bernarda Alfonzo, ella tiene 40 años. La pareja tienen 8 hijos, el mayor es estudiante universitario, otros dos culminan sus estudios secundarios este año y los otros aún están en edad escolar; todos viven juntos en una casa propia y viven en la Simbrón de Roque González.

Juan es una persona multifacética ya que realiza diferentes tipos de actividades para poder sostener a su familia, se dedica a cultivar la tierra, a la cría y faneamiento de ganado vacuno, y además produce miel de caña dulce que comercializa en la ciudad capital. Emplea a 15 personas, y se siente muy orgulloso, ya que desea dar oportunidad a otras personas de generar sus propios ingresos.

Anhela seguir mejorando su nivel de vida, solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado vacuno para su posterior venta de carne a diferentes carnicerías de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en: Bahadur has raised livestock for ten years. He is 45 years old and a married man who has four children. He purchases one or two calves, raises them, and then sell thems to the local bazaar traders. He is doing very well in his business, and it has always brought him good income. However, raising and breeding only one or two calves is difficult and does not bring him enough funds to cover family needs. Bahadur has decided to purchase one milk cow for 700 USD and two baby calves each for 250 USD. For this purpose he has applied for 1200 USD from Aqroinvest.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva is 32 years old, she was married 7 years ago, and now she has two daughters. The oldest is 5 and the youngest 1; her husband is a police officer and she has a lovely grocery store in her own home.

Her first job experience involved working as a maid, but after marrying she could no longer work outside the home once her first child arrived. In order to be able to stay at home and have work and extra income, she decided to open her own business, which Elva currently administers herself.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase basic merchandise such as sugar, spices, pasta, baking products, oil, rice and other items since at this time of year the demand for such products increases due to the parties to celebrate the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva tiene 32 años de edad, hace 7 años se casó y ahora tiene dos hijas, la mayor tiene 5 años y la más pequeña un año; su esposo es policía y ella tiene una linda despensa en su propia casa.

Su primera experiencia laboral fue como empleada doméstica, luego de casarse ya no pudo trabajar fuera de su casa porque vino su primer bebé, entonces para quedarse en casa y tener una actividad e ingreso extra, se propusieron abrir un negocio, la que hoy día es administrada por Elva.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad como ser: azúcar, yerba, fideos, panificados, aceites, arroz entre otros, ya que en esta época del año, la demanda de sus productos aumenta por las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, spices, pasta, baking products oil, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: Khurshud lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 44, married and has 5 children. He is the owner of a small farm where he is breeding calves for meat production. He is a very successful businessman, and to broaden his farming he wants to borrow 900 USD to purchase three additional calves for an estimated cost of 300 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil has lived in Saatli for his entire life. He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. He is the owner of a small farm and sells dairy products and calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 1997 when he borrowed money from Aqroinvest CU, and he established a reputation as a punctual and honest person. Now his next step for successful business continuation is to apply for 1200 USD loan to purchase four calves each for 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his 4 children in the small villiage in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He sells dairy products to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 2001. One cow is not enough to cover all the needs of such a big family. To improve conditions of his life he applied for 900 USD to purchase one milk cow  to increase number of sales, and for fodder for the cow.

loans.use: To purchase milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Nyai

texts.en: Nyai is 40 years old and a mother oF.a 9 year old son. She has been running her business oF.selling toys. She also produces some dolls and sells them. She usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, Iming, is a laborer who earns $2 salary per day. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business to cover their daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period oF.12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Entin

texts.en: Entin is 38 years old and a mother of a 9 year old son. She sells some clothes and veils on credit. She has to go around various places to offer and sell them. She can earn $5 per week. Her husband is a driver in Jakarta. She requests a $100 loan to buy more goods, and hopefully will earn more income to fund her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo C. is 44 years old, single and lives with his brother in a neighborhood in the center of San Estanislao. He has a business in the main market of San Estanislao.

He is a shopkeeper and sells electronics, cellphone accessories, cds mp3 player, radios and other products. Thanks to his good prices and the high quality of his products, Lorenzo has a lot of customers.

Lorenzo hopes to make his store bigger next year, and for this reason he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in bulk so that his will increase considerably.

El señor Lorenzo C. tiene 44 años de edad, soltero, vive con su hermano en el barrio centro de San Estanislao y tiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de dicha ciudad.

El señor es comerciante, el mismo se dedica a la venta de artículos de electrónica, accesorios para celulares, cd´s, mp3, radios entre otros. Gracias a sus buenos precios y la calidad de sus productos, Lorenzo, posee una gran cantidad de clientes.

Desea ampliar su salón de ventas el próximo año, y en esta ocasión, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades ya que por fin de año las ventas aumentan considerablemente.

loans.use:
purchase of merchandise like radios, cds mp3 and dvd players, flashlights etc.

compra de mercaderías como radios, cd´s, mp3, dvd, linternas, etc.

loans.name: Aci

texts.en: Aci is 22 years old, and mother of one child aged 1. She produces and sells crispy chips and usually goes around various places to offer and sell them. Sometimes she consigns them at small shops. She can earn $20 per day. But now she sells them at the market. She is requesting a $100 loan to expand her business and hopes that she can earn more income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase production

loans.name: Leni

texts.en: Leni is 20 years old, and the mother of a child aged 1. She has been selling vegetables since she became a member of MBK. She can earn $15 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns $10 salary per week. She is requesting a $125 loan to expand her business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elis

texts.en: Elis is 38 years old, and the mother of a child aged 6. She sells some foods such as coconut milk, rice, fried snacks, Indonesian salad (gado - gado), etc. She usually earns $6 per day. Her husband, B., is a tailor who earns $10 income per week. She really needs a $100 loan to expand her business and make it sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Yayoh

texts.en: Yayoh is 28 years old, and a mother of a child aged 4. She sells some snacks at her house and at school. She usually earns $10 per day. Her husband sells vegetables and usually earns $10 per week. She is requesting a $100 loan to buy more snacks. Some of the loan will be used for her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more snacks to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is 23 years old and married. She has been selling bags, some of which are made by her husband, who is a tailor. Sometimes she sells sandals on credit and usually earns $3 per week. She is requesting a $125 loan as additional capital for her business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Emis

texts.en: Emis is a 44 year old married woman. She lives with her daughter. She has a small shop which sells some household goods and usually earns $8 per day. She also sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks in the morning. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Yeyet

texts.en: Yeyet is 30 years old, and a mother of a 17 year old son. She has a small shop which sells some household goods. She can earn $30 per day. Her husband, J., is a driver who earns $3 income per day. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is 52 years old and a mother of a 17 year old daughter. She has been selling some fried snacks and vegetables in her small shop. She can earn $12 per day and its just enough to cover her family's daily needs. She is requesting a $50 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Wati

texts.en: Wati is 26 years old, and a mother of a 5 year old daughter. She sells gasoline and usually earns $10 per day. Her husband, M., is a motorcycle driver who earns $4 income per day. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more gasoline and hopes that she can earn more income and save money for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en: Yeyen is 35 years old, and a mother of a 12 year old daughter. She sells some accessories and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, S., is a tailor and usually earns $5 per day. She has to work hard to earn some extra income. She really needs a $50 loan to expand her and her husband's businesses and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Titin

texts.en: Titin is a 49 year old married woman. She sells clothes on credit and usually earns $10 per day. She has to go around to various places to get customers. Her husband, E., is a traditional healer who has no regular income. She really needs a $50 loan to buy more clothes and hopes that she can earn more income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Aisyah

texts.en: Aisyah is a 60 year old woman and she lives with her grandchild, aged 22. She sells some household goods and usually earns $20 per day. Her grandchild, Roby, helps her to run her business every day. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more goods and make the business more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
" I need to build a room for one of my children as the space we have is very limited. I would like to construct it little by little so my family will feel more comfortable. My husband and I have worked very hard to buy this house and we would like to make it bigger for our children. The funds requested to construct a room in my home are $800." Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto para uno de mis hijos ya que el espacio que tenemos es muy reducido, me gustaria ir construyendo poco a poco para que yo y mi familia estemos más cómodos, mi esposo y yo hemos trabajado mucho para tener esta vivienda y queremos hacerla un poco más grande para nuestros hijos” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para construir un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Add a room to the family home.

loans.name: S. Masitoh

texts.en: Masitoh is 31 years old, and a mother of one child aged 4. She sells some noodles and usually earns $8 per day. Her husband, R., is a laborer who earns $40 salary per month. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more goods to sell. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can save money for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Aay

texts.en: Aay is 31 years old, and a mother of a 9 year old son. She sells some vegetables and usually earns $6 per day. Her husband, E., works at a barber shop and earns $18 income per day.
