She is requesting a $50 loan to expand her and her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
"I would like to build a wall around my house to provide more safety and protection for my family, but I have not been able to do that because of lack of funds. Nevertheless, I hope that little by little I will be able to make improvements to my home as it is the inheritance for my children. I request a loan of $500 to construct a wall around my house."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Me gustaría poder construir una barda alrededor de mi casa, para tener más seguridad y protección para mi familia, por falta de dinero no he podido hacerla pero confío en que poco a poco podré irle haciendo mejoras a mi vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de mis hijos”.Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda alrededor de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construct a wall around a house for protection.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
"I own a building which I have not finished due to lack of funds. I would like to finish it as only one room and a wall in front of my house are missing. I have very young children and need to keep them protected. I request $700 to finish the construction of a room and a wall to protect my home."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción que no he podido terminar por falta de dinero, me gustaría terminarla ya que solo me falta un cuarto y poner una barda enfrente de mi vivienda, tengo hijos pequeños y necesito que estén protegidos ”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un cuarto y una barda en mi vivienda

loans.use: Finish construction of a room and a wall for protection

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
"I would like to build a room behind my house to have more space. Houses bought with a social interest rate are very small and I need to make an effort to make it bigger and live more comfortably. I request $450 for the construction of a room behind my house."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Quiero construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda para que haya más espacio, las casas de interés social son muy pequeñas y tengo que hacer un esfuerzo para hacerla un poco más grande y poder vivir cómodamente. Solicito $ 450.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Build a room at the back of my house.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario P. R. is an associate of “Flor del Café,” a microfinance institution situated in the Soritor district of the Moyabamba province in San Martín. She sells Peruvian street food, such as fried sausages and French fries, and a variety of beverages. She operates her business from her own home, where she waits for her customers to provide them with good service. She decided to start her own business because she has the support of her mother-in-law, who motivated her by giving her a street food cart. She likes this business because her house is located in an optimal place that is free of competitors. She took advantage of this opportunity because she counts on the support of her husband and daughters. Through this business, she makes use of her abilities and generates her own income.

With a recent loan from “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” of $667.00 USD, which will be repaid in six installments, she will buy one refrigerator (a quite useful appliance for this type of business) for storing cold beverages. She will also buy assorted carbonated drinks, condiments like ketchup and mustard, cooking oil, and all the products necessary for preparing her Peruvian street food.

She is 42 years old and has three children who help her out with both the business and the housework. She also plans to expand her business in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Flor del Café ” del distrito de Soritor, provincia de Moyabamba departamento de San Martín, ella se dedica la venta de comidas al paso como salchipapas, salchipollo, bebidas de diferentes marcas; Su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa que esta ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya No 1045 del mismo distrito, allí ella espera a su clientela para atenderles con un buen trato. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque tuvo el apoyo de su suegra quien le motivó regalándole un carrito salchipapero porque vió que le gusta el negocio y su casa tiene una buena ubicación y no tiene competencia, ella no desaprovechó esta oportunidad porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijas, de esta manera ella pone en practica sus habilidades y genera sus propios ingresos.

Con el reciente crédito recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 soles ($ 667.00) que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará un refrigerador para que pueda atender con bebidas heladas porque es muy útil en este tipo de negocio, también comprará bebidas gasificadas de varias marcas y tamaños, y algunas cremas que utiliza como ketchup, mostaza en baldes, aceites en galones y demás productos que ella utiliza en la preparación de salchipapas y salchipollo.

Tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, quienes ahora ya la apoyan en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, dentro de sus proyectos está la ampliación de su negocio, con lo que podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and one refrigerator

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla has been her own boss for three years. She considers this an excellent arrangement because she demands more of herself, and is able to achieve better results and profits. She began her business with just C/$5,000.00 córdobas, money contributed by her husband. Still, starting up wasn’t easy as a traveling salesperson, but her will to move forward and give her best to her family (husband and child) led to her to where she is today: contributing to household expenses and improving the economic situation of her own with her own business.

Her business conditions are better now that she has a location on a sidewalk with a stand where she can show her merchandise. Before starting this business, she helped her husband with a different one.

Carla feels comfortable with CEPRODEL, and it has helped her very much. She has a history of eight credits in a year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

CARLA TIENE TRES AÑOS DE SER SU PROPIA JEFA, LO CUAL PARA ELLA HA SIDO EXCELENTE YA QUE SIENTE QUE DE ESTA MANERA ELLA EXIGE MAS DE SI MISMA PARA OBTENER MEJORES RESULTADOS Y BENEFICIOS. EMPEZÓ CON UN PEQUEÑO CAPITAL DE CS$5,000.00 CÓRDOBAS MISMOS QUE FUERON APORTADOS POR SU ESPOSO. SIN EMBARGO SU INICIO NO FUE NADA FÁCIL, YA QUE ERA UNA VENDEDORA AMBULANTE PERO EL DESEO DE SUPERACIÓN Y DE DARLE LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA (ESPOSO E HIJO) COLABORANDO EN LOS GASTOS E INCREMENTANDO LA ENTRADA ECONÓMICA EN SU HOGAR, LA LLEVO HASTA DONDE ESTA HOY (SU PROPIO NEGOCIO)

LAS CONDICIONES DEL NEGOCIO SON MEJORES, AHORA CONSTA DE UN LOCAL UBICADO EN LA ACERA CON UN EXHIBIDOR DONDE MUESTRA LA MERCADERÍA. ANTES DE PONER SU NEGOCIO LE AYUDABA AL ESPOSO EN OTRO NEGOCIO.

CARLA SE SIENTE FAMILIARIZADA CON CEPRODEL YA QUE LA HA AYUDADO MUCHO A SUPERARSE DESDE HACE 1½ AÑO CON UN RÉCORD DE 8 CRÉDITOS.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
For ten years now, Martha Luz has devoted herself to wholesale and retail sales of cosmetics, watches, undergarments, shoes, and gold or silver plated accessories. She began her business with an initial capital of C/$10,000.00, her own savings. Like so many others, she began her business as a traveling merchant, managing to acquire a stall in the central Chinandega market after much hard work. Martha is happily married and has two school-aged children who are her main source of motivation, as she wants to provide them with a better future. She has around two years experience working with CEPRODEL. During this time, she has held 12 credits that she has used to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

MARTHA LUZ SE DEDICA A LA VENTA AL POR MAYOR Y DETALLE DE COSMETICOS, RELOJES, ROPA INTERIOR, CHINELAS, PRENDAS DE PLATA Y ORO LAMINADO DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS. EL NEGOCIO LO INICIA CON UN CAPITAL FRUTO DE SUS AHORROS DE C$10,000.00. AL IGUAL QUE EN LA MAYORÍA DE LOS CASOS COMENZÓ VENDIENDO DE MANERA AMBULANTE SIN EMBARGO LUEGO DE MUCHO ESFUERZO LOGRA ADQUIRIR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE CHINANDEGA.

MARTHA ES CASADA Y SU FAMILIA CONSTA DE SU FELIZ MATRIMONIO Y DOS HIJOS QUE AUN ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, LOS CUALES HAN SIDO SU PRINCIPAL MOTIVO DE ESFUERZO YA QUE DESEA BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR A ELLOS.

CON CEPRODEL YA LLEVA TRABAJANDO ALREDEDOR DE DOS AÑOS CON UN RÉCORD DE 12 CRÉDITOS LOS CUALES LE HAN SERVIDO PARA INCREMENTAR SU INVENTARIO Y MEJORAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Crispín

texts.es:
Mr. Crispin B. Ayala is 50 years old, and is married to Mrs. Hermelinda who is 47 years old. They live on San Isidro street, in the Navidad neighborhood of the Guayaybi district. They have 6 children, all of whom attend school.

Crispin is a farmer who grows various crops, including sesame, tobacco, cassava, and yucca, among others. He also has cattle, which he uses to sell milk and meat. His wife also has small food store that she runs. Through all of these commercial activities, they work to care for their family.

Crispin would like to purchase more land to increase their crops and their annual yield. Becasue they have always had successful harvests, by doing this they will be able to increase their income which will allow them to improve the quality of life for them and for their family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Crispin B. Ayala tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Hermelinda de 47 años de edad, viven en la calle San Isidro Barrio Navidad distrito de Guayaybi tienen 6 hijos, todos van a la escuela.

Crispín es agricultor, y posee diferentes tipos de cultivos, entre ellos sésamo, tabaco, mandioca o yuca, entre otros; también tiene animales vacunos de los cuales comercializa la leche y vende la carne. Su esposa tiene una despensa que ella administra y con todas estas actividades ellos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Quiere comprar más terreno para poder aumentar los cultivos y la producción cada año, ya que siempre obtiene buenos resultados de su cosecha, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of land for farming

loans.name: Maria Angeles

texts.es:
Maria Angeles is the head of her family. She is a hard working woman who has fought hard to improve the lives of her three children. She began her business as a traveling saleswoman when she was about 15 years old so that she could feed her children. Before she ran this business she was a domestic employee, but her salary could not cover her basic needs. She rents the shop where she maintains her business. For two years she has worked with Ceprodel and has received 13 loans. Thanks to Ceprodel she has been able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

MARÍA ÁNGELES ES JEFA DE FAMILIA ESFORZADA QUIEN HA LUCHADO DURO POR SACAR A SUS TRES HIJOS ADELANTE. INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE ALREDEDOR DE 15 AÑOS COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE PARA DARLE DE COMER A SUS HIJOS. ANTES DE TENER SU NEGOCIO ERA UNA EMPLEADA DOMESTICA PERO EL SALARIO NO CUBRÍA SUS NECESIDADES BÁSICAS

EL LOCAL DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO ES ALQUILADO. DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS TRABAJA CON CEPRODEL CON UN RÉCORD DE 13 CRÉDITOS. GRACIAS A CEPRODEL HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR LAS VENTAS.

loans.use: The purchase of products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is a 35 year old widow who owns her own home. After losing her husband in an accident more than 10 years ago, Isabel took over his shop.

Thanks to her creativity, ingenuity, and hard work, she has been able to overcome all of the obstacles that have come up over time. The shop is now prosporus, and busy.

She is asking for this loan to purchase angle iron, elastic bands, and metal bars, etc.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel de 53 años de edad, es viuda, y tiene casa propia. Luego de perder a su esposo en un accidente hace más de 10 años Isabel tomo el mando del taller que tenía su marido.

Gracias a la creatividad, el ingenio y las ganas de trabajar, logró superar todos los inconvenientes que se le presentaron a lo largo del tiempo. En la actualidad el taller es prosperó y los trabajos realizados en él son constantes.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de planchuelas, centro elásticos y varillas de hierro, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of angle iron, elastic bands, and metal bars.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia lives in the Boquerón neighborhood in Ciudad del Este, Paraguay. She is separated and has two young children who live with her and attend elementary school.

Antonia has a grocery store that she succeeded in opening with some savings and a loan that she received through a previous job. Her payments have all gone well.

She is asking for credit in order to purchase merchandise such as flour, rice, milk, sodas, baking supplies, meat, vegetables, fruits etc.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Antonia vive en el barrio Boquerón 2 de Ciudad del Este, ella es separada, tiene 2 hijos menores que viven con ella y van a la escuela primaria.

Antonia tiene una despensa que logro abrir con unos ahorros y una indemnización que cobro en un trabajo anterior. Cuenta le va bien.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como harina, arroz, leche, gaseosas, panificados, carne, verduras, frutas, etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as flour, rice, milk, sodas, baking supplies, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Ponsiano

texts.es:
Mr. Ponciano S. has a store in the neighborhood of Fátima of the Eastern City; he is married to Fidencia and they have 4 children who are all married.

Ponciano has had his store for more than 20 years, and his was one of the first in the neighborhood. One of his daughters lives with the family and helps with the business.

The store is well-stocked, however Ponciano would like a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as pasta, meat, fruit, sugar, chicken, eggs and other items since this is the time of year when demand increases quite a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Ponciano S. tiene un mí mercado en el barrio Fátima de Ciudad del Este; el esta casado con la señora Fidencia y tienen 4 hijos que ya están todos casados.

Ponsiano tiene una despensa hace ya más de 20 años, el mismo fue uno de los primeros en el barrio. Una de sus hijas vive con ellos y le ayuda en el negocio.

Su negocio esta bien surtido, no obstante, desea adquirir un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como fideos, carnes, frutas, azúcar, pollo, huevos entre otros ya que en esta época del año la demanda aumenta bastante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pasta, meat, fruit, sugar, chicken, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Nydia

texts.es:
Nydia is 64 years old, is married and has 4 children. She is the owner of a well-stocked grocery store and she has had it for the past 8 years. In addition, she is a retired teacher (she retired 10 years ago).

Nydia would like to use her loan to purchase products in bulk such as sugar, spices, beef, chicken, oil, pasta, rice, beer, soda, and other daily food products. Buying in bulk allows her to keep her store well-stocked, since her turn-over each week is quite high and in the warm season cook drinks are in especially high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nydia tiene 64 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida y lo tiene hace más de 8 años, además es jubilada docente desde hace 10 años.

El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de productos en gran cantidad como ser, azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz, cerveza, gaseosas, entre otros productos de consumo diario ya que la compra al por mayor permite que su negocio se mantenga bien surtido, ya que sus movimientos de ventas cada fin de semana es bastante alto y en temporadas de mucho calor sus productos de mayor rotación son las bebidas heladas.

loans.use: For the purchase of meat, oil, sugar, beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Since Dora married her husband, she has nearly always thought that she didn't want to leave the tremendous responsibility of providing well being for her family to her husband alone. Rather, she wanted to try to become and important support to him, and despite their economic limitations, she worked heard to open a business and to convert it into a great help in providing income to the home and family expenses. She now would like to convert her small store into a mini-mart in order to offer a greater variety of products to the people who come in, and in doing so increase her sales while maintaining momentum and working hard each day. Dora has decidd to request a loan by which we can help her make her dreams a reality. With your collaboration we can motivate a mother who has much to give.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Dora, desde que se casó siempre pensó en no dejar solo a su pareja con la inmensa responsabilidad de brindarle bienestar a su familia, sino que trataría de convertirse en un importante apoyo para él, y a pesar de sus limitaciones económicas puso todo su empeño para abrir un negocio y convertirlo en una gran ayuda para elevar los ingresos del hogar y solventar los gastos familiares.Anhela convertir su pequeña bodega un mini mercado para poder ofrecer una diversidad de artículos a la población entera, y aumentar sus ventas; sin embargo las costosas sumas de inversión en la educación de sus hijos han hecho que Dora deje de ahorrar para ampliar su negocio, mas sigue manteniendo su ímpetu para no dar cabida al desanimo y trabaja con más esmero día tras día. Sin embargo hoy Dora decidió hacer una petición en la que podemos ayudar a fin de que pueda convertir sus deseos en realidad y con vuestra colaboración podremos motivar a una madre que tiene mucho que dar.

loans.use: Implementation and supply of a new sales space to convert it into a mini-mart.

loans.name: Alberto Abel

texts.es:
Alberto comes from a humble family. 16 years ago he saw the need to become independent and to work hard to ensure his own welfare and security. He is now working as a custodian in the Continental Bank of the city of his birth, Juliaca. At the same he is studying computing in a prestigious institute in the city where he lives. This enterprising young man would like to purchase an optical drive and update his computer, which he obtained through much hard work and sacrifice. He would like to offer typing and printing services, ans by doing so generate extra income so that he can shortly open a small service business. To complete his project, Alberto is asking for a loan. He promises to repay your kind support within a lapse of six months.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Alberto, proviene de una humilde familia; desde los 16 años se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y trabajar arduamente para velar por su seguridad y bienestar. Actualmente se desempeña como personal de limpieza en el Banco Continental de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, y al mismo tiempo estudia computación en un instituto muy prestigioso de su ciudad. El deseo de este emprendedor muchacho es comprar una lectora y repotenciar su computadora que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio adquirió, con el fin de ofrecer servicios de tipeos e impresiones, y así tratar de generar ingresos económicos extras a fin de emprender en mediano plazo su pequeña empresa de servicios.Para concretar su proyecto Alberto solicita un préstamo y te extiende su compromiso de reembolsar tu noble apoyo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Update his computer and purchase an optical drive in order to begin his service business soon.

loans.name: Dyrlyd

texts.es:
Dyrlyd is 34 years old. She is a single mother and has one young son. She has her store (which she opened five years ago) in the market of San Lorenzo, but she also travels to different cities in order to sell her products. She buys and sells general merchandise such as teddy bears, frames, clothes, handbags, etc

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for the year end. In the future she would like to expand her business and buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Dyrlyd tiene 34 años, es soltera y madre de un hijo aún menor. Dyrlyd se dedica a la compra y venta de mercería en general como peluches, porta retratos, cuadros, carteras, ropas, etc.

DYRLYD tiene su local en el mercado de San Lorenzo pero también sale a recorres diferentes ciudades llevando sus productos para venderlos. Hace ya cinco años que abrió su propio local.

El crédito solicitado será destinado para la compra de mas mercadería para fin de año. En el futuro ella desea ampliar su negocio y tener su propia casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as perfumes, teddy bears, frames, handbags, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia is a 34 year old elementary school teacher, though for lack of opportunities she is unable to use the degree which she eagerly obtained from a prestigious university in this fair city. This enterprising mother, upon realizing that the small salary of her beloved husband who works as a police officer was not enough to meet all of the family's needs, she decided to open a business of her own offering jackets which she sells in the San Jose de Juilaca Plaza. She would like to increase the amount of merchandise that she offers, in order to save sufficient income to finish building a second floor onto her home. This will allow her to offer wellbeing, security, and comfort to ther three young children. To make her dream a reality, she is asking for a loan. Your selfless help and your generous heart will make it possible for her to realize her plans quickly.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Lucía de 34 años de edad, es profesora de educación primaria, pero por falta de oportunidades no puede ejercer su profesión que muy ávidamente concluyó en una prestigiosa universidad de su bella ciudad. Ésta emprendedora madre, al observar que las necesidades de su familia no eran satisfechas totalmente, debido al pequeño ingreso de su querido esposo que se desempeña como policía; decidió emprender su negocio de venta de casacas, mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria en la Plaza San José de Juliaca.El deseo de esta hacendosa madre es aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, para ahorrar lo suficiente y terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casita con el fin de ofrecerles bienestar, seguridad y comodidad a sus tres hijos menores y para concretar su anhelo solicita un préstamo de dinero que gracias a tu ayuda desinteresada y a tu generoso corazón generoso le posibilitará concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to obtain greater variety and amount of jackets to be sold to the general public.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Ever since she married Esperanza has dedicated all of her time to creating beautifully woven and colorful sweaters. She began this work thanks to the initiative of her husband, Vincente, who has worked with this beautiful and noble art since his childhood. Due to their diligence and great desire to prosper, both of them put their full interest and dedication into their work.

Recently they fixed up and began work in a small work shop through which they are receiving a large volume of revenue. They receive so much that they are completely covering the necessities of their home. The great desire of this entrepreneurial mother is to purchase a home and to provide their young five year-old daughter, Melany, with a comfortable home of their own. Melany is the motivation to struggle forward each day.

In order to fulfill the dreams of this young couple a loan is requested. This loan will serve to help them acquire a larger quantity of basic materials which they will use to continue creating their beautiful sweaters. The added revenues from their work will enable them to purchase their home. Let us help this entrepreneurial family to continue to prosper through their noble profession.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que contrajo matrimonio, Esperanza se ha dedicado por completo al tejido de hermosas, variadas y coloridas chompas, trabajo que emprendió gracias a la iniciativa de su esposo Vicente, quien se dedicaba desde su niñez a este bello y noble arte. Ambos desempeñan esta labor con mucho interés y dedicación, gracias a su diligencia y deseos de prosperar. Hace poco acondicionaron e implementaron su pequeño tallercito, mediante el cual están generar cuantiosos ingresos económicos que les posibilita la satisfacción plena de las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de esta emprendedora madre es comprar su casita y ofrecerle una morada propia y cómoda a su pequeña niña Mélany de cinco años de edad, quien es el motivo importante para esforzarse día a día; para concretar sus anhelos esta joven pareja solicita un préstamo dinero que les servirá para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para seguir fabricando sus hermosas chompas, y con los beneficios económicos que obtenga poder comprar su casita.Ayudemos a esta emprendedora familia a que siga prosperando con su noble labor.

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials for use in creating beautiful and colorful sweaters.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
We find Beatriz in one of the busiest streets of her hometown, Juliaca. There she sells delicious, incomparable doughnuts (a typcial pastry on the Peruvian coast). Thanks to Beatriz's kindness in caring for her customers and the wide range of prices that she sells this dessert, she is securing devoted customers and thus generating high revenue allowing her to adequately cover the education costs of her two dear children. This enterprising mother also sells delicious, nutritious juice from 6am to 11am. The doughnuts she sells from 2pm to 6pm when she closes shop. This hard-working mother wants to rent a spot where she can offer her delicious doughnuts at the same time as offering her customers greater convenience. In order to carry out her plans, Beatriz is asking for a loan. Thanks to your selfless support, she can continue to encourage the dreams of her darling children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Beatriz, en una de las calles más comerciales de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, vendiendo sus deliciosos e incomparables picarones ( bocadillo caliente típico de la costa peruana) que gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende y a la variedad de precios con las que vende este apetitoso postre; está obteniendo asiduos comensales que le están generando muy buenos ingresos económicos, permitiéndole cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de estudios de sus dos queridos hijos.Esta emprendedora madre también se dedica a vender deliciosos y nutritivos jugos de quinua desde las 6:00 hasta las 11:00 de la mañana, y el postre que describimos líneas arriba a partir de las 2:00 de la tarde y hasta las 8:00 de la noche, hora en la que termina su jornada.El deseo de esta empeñosa madre es alquilar un local donde pueda ofrecer sus agradables picarones y al mismo tiempo brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes, para concretar sus planes Beatriz solicita un préstamo con el que gracias a tu desinteresado apoyo pueda seguir endulzando con sus excelentes manos los sueños de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: To rent a space in order to offer customers more convenience and excellent service.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica, 21, is a young mother. Four years ago she decided to build a life with Alex, and from their love Juancito was born. He is an active, sweet three year old. Both parents work diligently in their store where they repair and sell used cell phones. They were able to begin this business thanks to the support of Nieves and Vidal, Alex's loving parents. This young, enthusiastic couple, who have big dreams in life, want to expand their small business, which has seen an increase in demand and attention in recent months. In order to do this, they are asking for your generous investment in their business so that in the future they can increase their income and then soon be able to build a house. Right now the young couple is waitng for your support. Give them the chance to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica, es una joven madre de 21 años, hace cuatro decidió formar su hogar junto a Alex y como fruto del amor que se tienen nació Juancito, niño inquieto y muy cariñoso de tres años. Ambos trabajan diligentemente en su tiendita de reparación y venta de celulares usados, negocio que emprendieron gracias al apoyo de doña Nieves y Vidal, padres amorosos de Alex.El deseo de esta joven y entusiasta pareja, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, es el de ampliar su pequeño negocio, que en estos últimos meses va obteniendo gran cantidad de acogida y demanda y para concretar sus planes recurren a vuestra generosa ayuda que les permitirá invertir en su negocio, para más adelante obtener beneficios mayores y en un tiempo no muy lejano construir su casita.En estos momentos esta joven pareja espera tu apoyo, brindales la oportunidad de prosperar.

loans.use: To expand and equip their daily working space.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose is 53 years old. He has been together with Basilla for more than 30 years. They have 5 children, ages 34, 32, 25, 21, and 17. The youngest still attends school, while the the older ones are married and living independently.

Jose worked for many years as a driver for the public transportation system. Later he left his job, and purchased a truck which he used to sell fruits and vegetables in different neighborhoods. He now works together with his wife making and selling inflatable dolls of various designs for children. They also make children's chairs.

Their business is going well, and they would like to increase production. They are asking for a loan which they will use to purchase imitation leather, paint, metal, cloth, thread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José de 53 años de edad vive en pareja hace más de 30 años con la señora Basilia, juntos tienen 5 hijos de 34, 32, 25, 21, y el último de 17 años, quien está todavía en el colegio, los mayores ya están casados y viven en forma independiente.

José trabajo varios años como chofer de transporte público, luego renunció y compró una camioneta, con la que empezó a vender frutas y verduras por los barrios. Hoy día fabrica y vende junto co su esposa muñecos inflables con diferentes diseños infantiles, además de sillitas para niños.

El negocio marcha bien, y desea incrementar su producción, para ello solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir cuerina, pinturas, hierros, telas hilos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of imitation leather, paint, metal, thread, etc.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
In an urban neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Juliaca, Jacoba runs her small grocery store. Jacoba is a hard-working and delightful mother of five, three of whom are already living on their own and working. While she dedicates herself to best care for her small children, her husband Gregorio, 52, is a temporary master builder, a job which is very difficult at his age. Jacoba, just like all mothers, is worried about her children's welfare. She has seen an increase in demand for her products and plans to increase her stock to offer her customers a wider variety of products. This way she can try to meet the needs of her demanding clietele while at the same time generating more revenue for her family. To carry out her plans, Jacoba, 52, is asking for a loan. With your valuable contribution we can make this mother's dream become a reality now.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

En uno D. los barrios urbano marginales D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, está ubicada la pequeña bodeguita D. Doña Jacoba, madre encantadora y trabajadora D. cinco hijos, tres D. ellos ya independientes y profesionales.Mientras ella se dedica a brindar el mayor cuidado y dedicación a sus hijos pequeños, su esposo Gregorio D. 52 años D. edad se desempeña como maestro D. obras en diferentes trabajos eventuales, labor muy sacrificada para la avanzada edad que posee.Doña Jacoba, como toda madre preocupada por el bienestar D. sus hijos, observó que la demanda D. sus productos va en ascenso y planea aumentar el stock D. su mercadería, para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad D. productos y D. esa manera tratar D. satisfacer las necesidades D. su exigente clientela y al mismo tiempo generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia.Y para concretar sus planes doña Jacoba D. 52 años D. edad solicita un préstamo. Con tu valioso aporte podemos hacer que el anhelo D. esta madre se concrete pronto.

loans.use: To buy better quality and a wider variety of products for the small grocery store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
For 15 years now, Victoria has been traveling her city's streets on her small tricycle cart selling a wide variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables; right now she is diligently selling delicious and nutritious corn, a primary product in Peru, for which there is a great demand at this time. Victoria is an industrious businesswoman and mother of three who works tirelessly along with her husband, Francisco, who works in a mine located far from home. The very reason he works is to be able to offer his little ones an education and a decent life. Victoria wants to buy even more products so that by selling them she can generate greater revenue and then be able to save and finish refurbishing her home. She was very devoted to building this house along with her life-long partner, her husband. To make her plans a reality, Victoria is asking for a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Right now they are eagerly awaiting your response.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria, desde hace quince años, diariamente transita las calles de su ciudad en su pequeña movilidad (triciclo), ofreciendo una inmensa variedad de frutas y verduras por temporadas; ahora la encontramos vendiendo diligentemente sus deliciosos y nutritivos choclos, producto bandera de su país Perú, que por esta temporada tiene gran demanda por la población.Ella es una diligente y emprendedora madre de tres hijos, que trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo, Francisco, quien se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su pueblo, con el único propósito de ofrecerles educación y bienestar a sus retoños.El deseo de Victoria es aumentar aún más sus productos, para que con la comercialización de estos pueda generar mayores ingresos económicos, para finalmente ahorrar y terminar de refaccionar su pequeño domicilio, que muy ávidamente construyó junto a su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo. Para concretar sus planes Victoria solicita un préstamo y les extiende su compromiso de reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. En estos momentos ellos esperan ansiosos tu respuesta.

loans.use: More capital in order to offer more products

loans.name: Rómulo

texts.es:
Rómulo is an exemplary and hard working father of 32 years. Since he was 5 years old he has dedicated himself to carpentry in the small workshop he has with his wife Felipa. With the small amount of saved money that they have, Rómulo has decided to dedicate himself to sculpturing, owing to the fact that he has an excellent ability to work wood and form beautiful figures. His great works are granting Rómulo satisfaction and good economic income, thus allowing him to offer a better quality of life to his beloved son Frank and his lovely wife, who supports him unconditionally in his endeavors. To realize his plans Rómulo requests a loan that will allow him to obtain raw material (wood) in great quantities. Let us support this head of family so that he can keep on artistically forming the dreams of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Rómulo, es un ejemplar y esforzado padre de 32 años de edad, desde hace cinco años viene dedicándose a la carpintería en el pequeño taller que aperturó junto a su esposa, Felipa, con el poco dinero ahorrado que tenían, ahora, este padre decidió dedicarse a la escultura debido a su excelente habilidad para tallar la madera y formar excelentes figuras. Sus excelentes trabajos les están otorgando mucha satisfacción y buenos ingresos económicos, permitiéndole así ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su querido hijo Frank y a su amada esposa, quien la apoya incondicionalmente en su labor.Para concretar sus planes Rómulo solicita un préstamo que le permitirá adquirir materia prima (maderas) en mayor cantidad. Apoyemos a este jefe de familia para que siga tallando artísticamente los sueños de su familia.

loans.use: The purchase of a greater quantity and variety of raw materials

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Family and economic problems never consumed Nemecia, a humble mother of one son, Alex. Thanks to her unconditional love, Alex is cruising through his fifth semester of study in medical school at a prestigious university in the city. Nemecia is a hard working mother who diligently travels the streets of her city day by day selling a variety of her colored shawls and sheets. Thanks to her perseverance and ability, this business has brought her much happiness. The desire of this exemplary mother is to have a commercial store, a place where she can distribute her merchandise to the public. In order to fulfill her plans she requests a loan that she will completely invest in this aspiration. She counts on your support so that the work of this brave mother moves forward.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Sus problemas familiares y económicos nunca derrotaron a Nemecia, madre humilD. D. Alex, quien gracias al apoyo incondicional que le brinda viene cursando el V semestre D. estudios en la Facultad D. Medicina D. una prestigiosa universidad D. su ciudad.Ella, es una empeñosa madre, que a diario recorre diligentemente las calles D. su ciudad, ofreciendo sus variadas y coloridas mantas y cobertores, negocio que gracias a su perseverancia y habilidad le viene otorgando muchas alegrías. El deseo D. esta ejemplar madre es contar con un local comercial, lugar desD. donD. anhela distribuir su mercadería al por mayor y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo, para invertirlos completamente en este anhelo. Contamos con vuestro apoyo para que la labor D. esta valerosa madre siga adelante.

loans.use: To rent a better located store to distribute merchandise

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
About 20 years ago, Edgar's parents decided to open up their own tailor shop thanks to their great talent for sewing. They make the best and most elegant work and due to this they are well-known throughout their community. Their small tailor shop is very popular and people from all over the community travel there to get their sewing done. Due to the high demand that they get on a weekly basis, they are unable to do their job because they don't have the necessary equipment/material. This is the reason why Edgar is requesting a loan to purchase another sewing machine and to also purchase more equipment so that he can help his parents on his days off.

Edgar would also like to make money so that he can pay for his schooling/education. He's currently going to college to get a degree in accounting. Let's suppor this talented family so that they can all achieve a promising future!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Los padres de Edgar hace veinte años decidieron abrir su pequeño taller de sastrería, gracias al don especial que poseen para la costura; realizan excelentes, elegantes, y finos acabados en sus trabajos y actualmente este pequeño taller es muy visitado por los pobladores, teniendo gran cantidad de solicitudes semanalmente, pero no disponen de suficientes herramientas de trabajo para cumplir con sus pedidos.Es por esa razón que Edgar, solicita un préstamo que le permitirá comprar una máquina de coser y demás herramientas que les hacen falta con el propósito de apoyar en sus horas libres a sus padres en la confección de sus prendas de vestir, con gran ingenio y creatividad para la satisfacción de su exigente clientela, y del mismo modo generar sus propios ingresos para terminar de cubrir los gastos de sus estudios superiores de contabilidad que muy anhelantemente sigue.Apoyemos a esta familia talentosa a que siga sembrando un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more equipment/material

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
About 5 months ago, Fidelia's mother suffered some health problems. Since then, they had to spent a good sum of money to treat her illness and to make sure her dear mother return to good health. Now she's greatful to see that her mother is in good condition. She wants to make sure that her mother has peace of mind and economic stability. Fidelia works very hard each day. She provides telephone services to everybody in her neighborhood. She started this business after she noticed that her neighbors would travelled long distances to communicate with their loved ones over the telephone.

Another goal, that this young 24 year old woman has in mind, is to also get involve in the arts & crafts and for that she needs a sewing machine. Fidelia believes that she can make good money with the addition of this side business. In order to accomplish her goal, she needs a loan which she commits to repay within 6 months. At this time, this up-beat young woman, awaits for your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace cinco meses atrás, la mamá de Fidelia venia pasando por problemas de salud, desde entonces tuvieron que invertir una importante cantidad de dinero para tratar de recuperar el bienestar de su querida madre, ahora, ya con la alegría de ver a su progenitora en muy buenas condiciones; trata de ofrecerle bienestar, tranquilidad y estabilidad económica, para ello trabaja arduamente brindando muy amigablemente sus servicios de llamadas telefónicas a toda su vecindad, labor que emprendió al ver que sus vecinos recorrían enormes distancias para hacer uso de esta importante herramienta comunicativa.El deseo de esta joven muchacha de 24 años es también incursionar en la noble labor de la artesanía y para esto desea comprar una máquina de tejer, Fidelia cree que con este oficio podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos.Para concretar sus planes requiere obtener un préstamo, que promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses. En estos momentos esta encantadora muchacha espera ansiosa por tu colaboración.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita, as her friends and clients lovingly call her, is dedicated to the sale of food. She sells her food from her small transport that she obtained for her work and with which she procures more regular customers day by day. She thanks her success to the delicious stews she prepares, which she learned from her loving mother Luisa, who also delights the clients with exquisite meals. Rosita yearns to open a restaurant and offer her clients better food and excellent service. In order to realize her dream she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils. Thus little by little she will finish up making her small store. Let's make Rosita's desires possible so that she can fulfill her dreams with little delay.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosita , como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, está dedicada a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en su pequeña movilidad que ingeniosamente adecuó para dicho oficio y con el que va obteniendo día a día asiduos clientes; gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara debido a la habilidad que heredó de su querida madre, Luisa, quién también deleita a sus clientes con sus exquisitos platos.El deseo de Rosita es abrir su restaurante y ofrecer a sus comensales mejor comodidad y un excelente servicio, para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de utensilios de cocina, y así poco a poco terminar de implementar su pequeño local. Posibilitemos los deseos de Rosita para que concrete sus planes en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: The purchase of kitchen utensils in order to realize her dreams little by little

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 35 year-old widow and mother of two minor children. She has owned a butcher shop for the past four years in the Luque city market.

Catalina supplies wholesale meats to merchants, occasional clients, and butcher shops. She sells many different cuts of meat: carnaza (a cut of beef popular in Paraguay), puchero (stew meat), loin, ribs, etc, as well as sausage such as chorizo (highly seasoned pork sausage), morsilla (blood sausage), mortadelas (bologna), etc.

The loan that Catalina requests will be used to purchase pork and sausage casings in bulk. This will allow her to increase her income since the end of the year approaches and there is great demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina es viuda, tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos aún menores de edad. Posee una carniceria en el mercado de la ciudad de Luque hace mas de 4 años

Doña Catalina provee al por mayor, a comerciantes, clientes ocasionales y carnicerías, carnes en los diferentes cortes: carnaza, puchero, lomito, costilla, etc. y embutidos como chorizos, morsilla, mortadelas, etc.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de carne de cerdo y embutidos en gran cantidad lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos atendiendo que se acerca fin de año y tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: To purchase pork and sausage casings

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married to Natalicio Riquelme and they have three young children, all studying at the primary level.

Yolanda has been a business woman for 6 years. She has a store where she sells all types of goods, especially basic food staples including sugar, flour, milk, meat, fruit and vegetables. Her husband has worked as a distributor of pasta for the past 3 years. They work seven days a week in order to meet the family’s needs because the economic situation is difficult.

They are dynamic people who want to get ahead in order to give their children an education. They are asking for this credit in order to purchase merchandise to sell and thereby augment their income.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Yolanda Rodríguez esta casada con el Sr. Natalicio Riquelme y tienen tres hijos menores, todos estudian en el nivel primario.

La sra. Yolanda es comerciante hace 6 años, tiene una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad como azúcar, harina, leche, carne, frutas y verduras; su marido trabaja en una distribuidora de fideos hace 3 años. Ellos trabajan de lunes a lunes para el sustento de le familia ya que esta difícil la situación económica.

Son personas dinámicas que desean salir adelante, para brindarles a sus hijos educación. Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su venta y así aumentar su ingreso.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, Christmas bread, soda, wine, fruit, milk products, etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 48, owns a food stand at the market near Offinsu. As Christmas is nearing, Yaa is preparing for the business that she will be receiving. Families will be gathering and cooking large meals with rice. Yaa hopes to be well-stocked so people will come to her for their Christmas foods.

The profits from her shop will be reinvested into the business and in finishing the home for herself and her three children. They are currently living in a half-built house. There are only two complete rooms. The rest have dirt floors.

Yaa is a member of the lending group, Eye Nyame. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her stock for Christmas by purchasing tomatoes, onions, rice, oil, canned fish, and other food products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 51, balances taking care of her yam stall at the market and taking care of her ten children. All ten of her children are in school right now. The oldest one is in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her primary goal is to earn enough profit so that she can take care of them and provide them the opportunity to go to university.

Yams are a staple of Ghanaian dishes. They are used in fou-fou, yam balls, palava dishes, and just plain yams. There is a constant demand for yams from her customers, but it is more expensive for her to purchase during this time of the year. This is why she is requesting a loan to help buy enough to supply her customers.

Cecilia is a member of the lending group, Eye Nyame. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of Eye Nyame have developed close relationships. They take care of each other’s businesses while they are away.

loans.use: To purchase yams as they are becoming more expensive this time of the year.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
On top of being an entrepreneur, Martha, 50, takes care of her seven children. Three are in high school and one is studying electrical engineering. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible.

Martha is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her stall in the market. Her foods sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding eggs to her store to diversify what she carries.

Martha is a member of the lending group, Eye Nyame. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of Eye Nyame have developed close relationships. They take care of each other’s businesses while they are away.

loans.use: To diversify her stock by adding eggs and to expand her business by purchasing more rice, oil, vegetables, and other foods.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia L. is a single mother with an eleven-year-old little girl that always helps her mother so they can both get ahead together. Zonia began her business making tamales at home and selling them to all her neighbors. Little by little she earned her customers, who recommended her for her rich, delicious tamales. After a while, she realized her daughter was growing up, but lacked a mother figure at her side. That’s why she decided to alter a small part of her house and establish her tamale sales from there.

Nevertheless, the high season is coming when customers have money and there are many parades. Zonia wants to use this time to invest so she can make more tamales and secure greater earnings. Therefore, Zonia is requesting a credit of $925 that she will repay in a span of six months. With this money, Zonia will be able to help her daughter forward and offer her a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Zonia L., madre soltera de una pequeñita de 11 años, quien le ayuda a su mamá para que juntas puedan salir adelante. Zonia comenzó su negocio haciendo tamales en su casa y ofreciéndolos a todos sus vecinos. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes, y la recomendaban puesto que los tamales que hacía, estaban muy ricos. Después de un tiempo se dio cuenta que su hija estaba creciendo y le hacía falta la figura de una madre a su lado. Y fue por es oque decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio en su casa para poder establecerse a vender la comida ahí.

Sin embargo la temporada alta en que todos los clientes tienen dinero y hacen las posadas, es cuando Zonia quiere invertir para poder hacer más tamales y obtener mayores ganancias. Por lo tanto Zonia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Zonia podrá sacar a su hija adelante y ofrecerle un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients for cooking her products

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
For a long time, Fernando T. worked as a skilled laborer until his employer was forced to cut personnel and he was fired. After this blow to his family, he began to seek employment, but without success. At one point, the money was almost completely gone, and that’s when he began to see a way to use his last savings to open a business that could support his family. He began to buy a little merchandise, such as gifts and bags that he later sold out of his house. Little by little, he gained clients who requested other paper goods, which is how he began to introduce papers, markers, and other goods that he sells today.

Nevertheless, his shop continues to be very small, so there isn’t much variety to ensure his customers are satisfied with just choosing the best brands. That’s why he’s requesting a loan of $375 that he is willing to pay within six months. With this money, Fernando will be able to buy new merchandise and improve his business some. With your help, Fernando can help his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Fernando T. trabajó durante mucho tiempo como obrero, hasta que en la empresa en dónde trabajaba hicieron un recorte de personal en el que lo corrieron a él. Y después de este terrible golpe a su familia comenzó a buscar trabajo sin tener victoria. Llegó un momento en el que el dinero que le habían dado se estaba terminando y fue por eso que comenzó a ver de qué manera utilizaría sus últimos ahorros para poder poner un negocio que le dejara el dinero suficiente para poder mantener a su familia. Y fue ahí que comenzó a comprar un poco de mercancía de regalos y bolsas y así se puso a vender en su casa. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes que le iban pidiendo material de papelería y fue así que comenzó a introducir, papeles, marcadores, y otro tipo de artículos que hoy vende.

Sin embargo el local sigue siendo muy pequeño y por lo tanto no hay mucha variedad para que sus clientes estén satisfechos de escoger la mejor marca. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Fernando podrá comprar mercancía nueva y arreglar un poco su negocio. Con tu ayuda Fernando podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock his store

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga Lidia has three small children in school. She desires to give them only the best so that they can progress and improve. One day she realized that she did not have any money to buy the books one of her children needed and thus Olga decided to begin selling something in order to make money and cover the costs of her house.

Nevertheless Olga doesn't have enough merchandise for the winter sales season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $275 so that she can buy winter clothes to sell, like heavy pants, sheepskin coats, and scarves among other things that people buy for winter weather. With your help Olga will be able to improve the lives of her children and offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Olga Lidia tiene tres pequeños hijos estudiando, a los cuales les desea dar lo mejor para que salgan adelante. Un día no tenían para poder comprar los libros que le habían pedido a uno de sus hijos y fue por eso que Olga decidió comenzar a vender algo para poder sacar dinero y cubrir los gastos de su casa.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mercancía para la temporada de invierno es por eso que Olga está solicitando un crédito de US $275 para poder comprar ropa de temporada de invierno como son las chamarras, pantalones, bufandas entre otras cosas que son las que las personas compran en esta temporada. Con tu ayuda Olga podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y así poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Sandra Aurora

texts.es:
Sandra Aurora is a woman who likes to get ahead for the sake of her two small children, who need her completely. Sandra is in business for herself selling shoes and cosmetics by catalog. At one point her husband lost his job, and his severance pay was not enough to cover the household expenses, much less those of the little ones. Four years ago, she began by selling to her friends and family, little by little gaining more customers. Thanks to her insistence upon moving ahead, she is becoming known in her town.

Nevertheless, Sandra wishes to continue her business’ growth so she will be ready now that her children are starting school and for any unforeseen event that may occur. For these reasons, she is requesting a credit of $750 that she is prepared to pay within six months. With this money, she can purchase more shoes and cosmetics so she can offer greater variety to her customers. With your help, Sandra can move her family ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra Aurora es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante por sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes necesitan totalmente de ella. Sandra trabaja por su cuenta como vendedora de zapatos y cosméticos por catálogo. Pero en un momento su esposo perdió el trabajo en el que estaba y lo que le dieron de liquidación no le alcanzaba para poder cubrir todos los gastos que se generan en su casa y menos los gastos que sus hijos tenían al ser tan pequeños. Hace 4 años comenzó por ofrecerle a sus familiares y poco a poco se fue haciendo de más y más clientela, gracias a su insistencia por salir adelante se a dado a conocer en su colonia.

Sin embargo Sandra desea seguir creciendo para prepararse ahora que sus hijos comienzan a estudiar y tener dinero ahorrado para cualquier imprevisto que pase. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero podrá comprar más zapatos y cosméticos para tener mayor variedad qué ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María T. M. is a single mother of two children, one of whom is in the United States and the other has returned to live with her. María lived in the United States for many years. However, after María’s mother began her illness because of her old age and could not take care of herself anymore, María decided to return to her home town, Sabinas Hidalgo. And with the small amount of money she was able to save, she bought a small sewing machine and began to offer dressmaking services. Little by little she became well-known in her town and, now, she has more clients than ever.

Apart from her services, she also sells merchandise. She is seeking a loan of $325 because she does not a large inventory. She plans to repay the loan in four months and with the money, María will be able to buy more merchandise to have a greater variety to offer to her customers because with the Christmas season approaching, more people are beginning to do handcrafted work. With your help, María can help her mother live her last few years with dignity and help her to progress in Mexico.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

María T. M., es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de los cuales se encuentra en Estados Unidos estudiando y su hija se regresó con ella. María vivió durante mucho tiempo en Estados Unidos sin embargo la mamá de María comenzó a enfermar debido a la avanzada edad y ya no se podía cuidar sola es por es oque María decide regresarse a su pueblo natal Sabinas Hidalgo. Y con los pocos ahorritos que había hecho compró una máquina de coser y comenzó a ofrecer, adaptaciones, costura de prendas y arreglarlas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia y ahora ya tiene más clientes.

Sin embargo aparte de hacer prendas, vende productos de mercería, y no tiene mucho surtido es por es oque está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para poder pagarlo en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad ahora que muchas amas de casa comienzan a hacer manualidades para la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda María podrá ayudar a su mamá que está ya muy grande a vivir con dignidad sus últimos años y ayudará a ue su hija salga adelante en México país del que no debió haber salido.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to fix clothings.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
An Lac is a poor region of Soc Son District due to the threat of floods constantly which make it hard to maintain stable income. To fight against poverty, women of An Lac has worked hard year-round and Mrs. Bui Thi T., 50 years old, is a prime example. During 2001, she had courageously joined YTM to request for a business development loan. Everyday, she brings eggs from her farm to sell in the Ni-Trung Gia market, earning about 2.5 to 3 USD of profit. She also encourages her husband to learn the welding trade and used half of the last loan to open up a store and buy raw materials for him to produce buckets and basins. Because of that, she had met no difficulties in the last loan payments and this time around, she would like to ask for a loan of 1200 USD to buy poultry eggs and corrugated iron and expand her business. Her family monthly income is about 200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

An Lạc là một vùng quê chiêm trũng, nghèo khó của Sóc Sơn, quanh năm lụt lội, việc làm kinh tế rất khó khăn. Chính bởi sự nghèo khó đã thôi thúc chị em phụ nữ nơi đây quyết chí làm kinh tế vượt qua đói nghèo trong đó chị Bùi Thị Tuất, 50 tuổi, là một điển hình. Năm 2001, chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Hàng ngày, chị đi lấy trứng tại các trang trại rồi đem bán tại chợ Nỉ - Trung Giã, mỗi ngày cũng thu được khoảng 2.5 - 3USD tiền lãi. Chị động viên chồng đi học nghề gò hàn và dùng một nửa số tiền vay từ Quỹ để mở cửa hàng và mua nguyên liệu sản xuất thùng, xô, chậu. Do đó, việc trả tiền tuần rất thuận lợi với gia đình nên vòng vốn này chị quyết định xin vay 1200 USD. Hiện tại, thu nhập của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy poultry eggs, corrugated iron

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is a 31-year-old woman who devotes herself to selling general merchandise, including electronics, audio equipment, and books. She is a single mother with a nine-year-old son who is currently attending a public school in the area. They both live at Margarita’s parents’ home, where she and her son share a bedroom. Hers is a one-man business, and she has four and a half years of experience with this type of work. During this time, thanks to her sacrifice, she has been able to make it grow. Her competency in the field is partly due to the fact that there are few vendors that devote themselves to electronic and audio items. The key to her success is excellent customer service and prices that are within reach of her clientele. With the current loan request, she will purchase:
* 10 AKITA stereos for $500
* 6 AKITA radios for $180
* 3 ceramic boxes for assorted gifts for $150
* 3 boxes of children’s novelty toys for $170
Her current request is the third that Margarita has made from Agrocapital. Her previous credits were for $1500 and $2500 respectively, and both were paid off responsibly and on time. She has no negative history in her credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita es una señora de 31 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de artículos en general, artefactos electrónicos, musicales y de librería. Margarita es madre soltera de un niño de 9 años de edad, que actualmente está estudiando en un colegio fiscal de la zona. Ambos viven en el domicilio de los padres de Margarita, donde comparten un dormitorio para ella y su hijo. El negocio es de tipo Unipersonal, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de cuatro años y medio, en los cuales, gracias a su sacrificio, pudo lograr que el mismo creciera. La competencia en la zona es mediana debido a que hay pocos puestos de comerciantes que se dedican a la comercialización de artefactos electrónicos y musicales. La clave para su desarrollo es la excelente atención que da a sus clientes y los precios que oferta que son accesibles al público de demandante. Con la presente solicitud comprará: 10 Minicomponentes AKITA en $us. 500.- 6 Radios AKITA en $us. 180.- 3 Cajas de Cerámicas para Regalo Surtidas en $us. 150.- 3 Cajas de Juguetes Novedades para Niños en $us. 170.- La presente solicitud es la tercera que tiene Margarita con Agrocapital, sus anteriores créditos de $us. 1.500.- y $us. 2.500.- respectivamente fueron cancelados de una manera responsable y puntual, no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase of electronics for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is one of the first members of TYM Fund (KIva Partner) in Minh Phu province, Vietnam. Before joining TYM, her life was very difficult. Her husband Le Xuan Tu is a veteran. He did not have a fixed job; their children are all small; and they did not have any fund to start a business. Since 1992, she started to borrow from TYM Fund but she did not use her loan quite effectively. In 1999, with the new trend of economic model that focuses on all three components: farming, fishing, and breeding, Mrs. T. discussed with her family and decided to change to his new model. She now has 3.2 acres of garden, 7 perches of pond with hundreds of fruit trees, and 750 ducks, chickens, and grooses. She would like to borrow 450USD to buy food for her poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thành là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình thương tại xã Minh Phú. Khi chưa có Quỹ, cuộc sống của gia đình rất vất vả. Anh Lê Xuân Tự, chồng chị, là bộ đội phục viên, không có việc làm ổn định, các con còn nhỏ, gia đình lại không có vốn để làm ăn. Từ năm 1992, chị liên tục vay vốn từ QTT để phát triển kinh tế với nhiều mô hình kinh tế khác nhau nhưng chua thực sự hiệu qủa. Năm 1999, được sự góp ý của cán bộ kỹ thuật phụ trách và ban lãnh đạo thôn về chuyển đổi mô hình kinh tế VAC, chị Thành đã bàn bạc cùng gia đình và mạnh dạn dồn điền đổi thửa, tập trung làm kinh tế trang trại với diện tích 3,2 mẫu đất với vườn cây, ao cá, và các loại gia cầm (750 con vịt, gà, ngan, ngỗng, 7 sào ao cá, và hàng trăm cây ăn quả). Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn gia cầm của mình.

loans.use: Buy chickenfeed

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Shall you want to taste authentic, rare vietnamese dishes in a peaceful setting of a village, go to the restaurant of Ms Tạ Thị Dư in Xuân Bách hamlet, Quang Tiến village. Ms Dư, 54 years old, is a TYM member since 1999. She has always borrowed the maximum amount to invest in her restaurant. Her husband, Nho, is an excellent cook. He always tries new recipes, cooks delicious dishes that had been adapted to his own style of cooking. The customers are satisfied, even the picky ones. Ms Dư is a very skillful hostess, greets her customers warmly. This is why the restaurant is bustling. In 2003, with her own savings and loans from family and friends, she has built a 1000 square feet house. This time she requests a loan of 1200 usd to buy groceries to add new dishes to the restaurant's menu. The revenue from the restaurant is 300 usd a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Nếu bạn có nhu cầu thưởng thức những món ẩm thực đặc trưng và hoà mình vào không khí trong lành, yên tĩnh của làng quê Việt Nam, xin mời bạn hãy đến với cửa hàng của chị Tạ Thị Dư, 54 tuổi, tại trung tâm thôn Xuân Bách, xã Quang Tiến. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1999, chị luôn vay các vòng vốn với mức cao nhất cùng chồng kinh doanh hàng ăn. Anh Nho, chồng chị, là một đầu bếp giỏi, chế biến các món ăn hấp dẫn và luôn làm vừa lòng khách hàng, kể cả những thực khách khó tính nhất. Chị Dư lại là một bà chủ khéo léo, luôn niềm nở với nên cửa hàng của gia đình chị lúc nào cũng đông khách. Năm 2003, chị đã xây được ngôi nhà 2 tầng với diện tích trên 100m2 từ số tiền tích lũy được và vay thêm của họ hàng, bạn bè. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua thực phẩm chế biến thức ăn. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 300USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy groceries for her restaurant

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Hải is 54 years old. She is a TYM member since 1999. Today she and her husband own a construction materials supply business in Minh Phú village, Sóc Sơn. Their warehouse's location is easily accessible. It's located on route 35 that relies highway QL 2 and QL 3. They even have their own truck to deliver materials to construction sites. She has a warm personality, always has a smile on her face. This is one of the reason for her success. She also owns a 1/2 acre land where she plants fruit trees and flower shrubs that are of high value. Her family lives happily in a nice 3 storey house. This time she's requesting a loan of 1200 usd to buy construction materials like concrete, iron.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Trần Thị Hải, 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1999. Hiện nay chị cùng chồng đang kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng tại xã Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn. Cửa hàng 5 gian của chị Hải nằm tại vị trí kinh doanh rất thuận lợi trên đường 35 nối liền QL 2 và QL3. Gia đình chị còn có cả ô tô vận tải chở vật liệu tới tận các công trình. Chị có khuôn mặt rất phúc hậu và nụ cười tươi tắn trên môi, đây chính là yếu tố làm nên sự thành công trong việckinh doanh của chị. Ngoài ra chị còn làm kinh tế trang trại với trên 2000m2, trong đó có nhiều loại cây ăn quả và cây cảnh có giá trị kinh tế cao. Cuộc sống gia đình chị khá đầm ấm, sung túc trong khuôn viên rộng rãi với ngôi nhà 3 tầng khang trang, đẹp đẽ. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm xi măng, sắt thép.

loans.use: Buy cement, iron, steel

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Phượng, 54 years old, joined TYM fund in 1998. Her initial loan of 60 usd was invested in pig breeding and retails business. The profit that she made from the pig breeding business was used to buy things that were needed for her family. After 3 years, she concentrated solely on the pig breeding. With the support from her husband who is a veterinarian, Ms Phượng has become one of the most successful TYM members. Her income is 150 usd a month. She's requesting a loan of 950 usd and she's planning on expanding her pig breeding farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Phượng, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Với mức vay đầu tiên là 60USD chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Kết quả thu được từ chăn nuôi tích lũy giúp chị mua sắm được một số tiện nghi trong gia đình. Từ năm thứ 3 chị tập trung vốn vào phát triển đàn lợn. Với sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng, một bác sĩ thú y, chị Phượng là một trong những thành viên sử dụng đồng vốn có hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 150USD/tháng. Dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 950USD để tiếp tục mở rộng dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Trí, 38 years old, joined TYM fund in 1997. Her first loan was 50 usd which was invested in a small pig breeding farm. The result was quite encouraging so she continued borrowing more money from TYM to invest in the business. With time and experience, it has become successful. On top of pig breeding, she also has a fish pond (1 acre in superficial area) and a few dozens ducks. Her revenue is about 125 usd a month. She's requesting a loan of 625 usd to expand her breeding farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1997 với mức vay đầu tiên là 50USD chị Nguyễn Thị Trí, 38 tuổi, đã đầu tư vào mô hình chăn nuôi nhỏ. Kết quả thu được bước đầu từ chăn nuôi giúp chị thêm phần tự tin và mạnh dạn tăng dần đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ. Với những kinh nghiệm tích lũy được chị Trí đầu tư ngày càng có hiệu quả. Bên cạnh việc chăn nuôi lợn chị còn đầu tư vào 1 mẫu ao cá và vài chục con vịt. Hiện nay mức thu nhập của chị Trí là 125USD/tháng. Dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 625USD để mở rộng chăn nuôi, tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy mash, fishes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Ngân is 30 years old. She joined TYM fund when her first child was 3. Her family living condition was very difficult at that time. She contracted a loan of 125 usd from TYM which was invested pig breeding . She has made some money, this has helped her cover the family living expenses. After 3 years, she had switched from pig breeding to selling pork: she has a butcher stand at the market. She buys pork from the butchery in her hamlet or from one of her relatives. She makes about 5 usd a day which is enough to raise her 2 children and put them to school. She's requesting a loan of 625 usd to expand her butcher stand, offering more selection to her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngân, 30 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ khi đứa con đầu mới lên 3 tuổi. Hoàn cảnh gia đình lúc đó hết sức khó khăn, chị Ngân xin vay 125USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Kết quả thu nhập từ vòng vốn đầu tiên giúp chị có thể trang trải một phần những chi phí trong gia đình. Từ năm thứ 3 chị đã chuyển sang kinh doanh buôn bán thịt lợn. Nguồn hàng được lấy từ trong xóm hoặc ngay trong gia đình. Mức thu nhập 5USD/ngày hiện nay đủ để chị Ngân nuôi 2 con ăn học đầy đủ. Dự tính chị sẽ xin vay 625USD để tăng thêm lượng hàng bán ra hàng ngày.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Samir Yusef

texts.es:
Mr. Samir sells cell phones, which he buys outside of Nicaragua. He has been working 10 years in this business, which took an initial investment of $1,000 that he got through a loan. He came up with the idea of this business after seeing that people at the market La Terminal had a need for cell phones in order to be able to communicate. Before he started this business, Mr. A. worked for the city hall of Leon. Thanks to the loans that he got (this one will be used to buy cell phones and accessories) he was able to established his business, which has helped him get ahead and take care of his five children (three of them of school age) and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Don Samir se dedica a la venta de celulares, realizando compra de los productos fuera de Nicaragua. Lleva 10 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $1,000 gracias a un primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la necesidad que tenia la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon para acceder a un medio de comunicación. Antes de tener este negocio, el Sr. A. era trabajador asalariado de la alcaldía de Leon pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como celulares y accesorios, ha logrado salir adelante, manteniendo a sus 5 hijos, tres de ellos en edad escolar y el cuido de su querida madre.

loans.use: To buy cell phones and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Eugenia sells food such as fried chicken, sodas and rice with beans (some of the national products). It has been 20 years since she began this business. Thanks to the $500 she received from her first loan, she was able to successfully invest in her business. After seeing the great demand for her food, she decided to have this business. Before, she used to deliver her food, but then her clients at the market La Terminal in Leon asked her to station herself in order to offer a greater variety of food. Before she had this business, she sold traveling with fried pork and yuca (Chancho con Yuca). As a single mother, she has been able to move forward, and maintain her business and her children in primary school, thanks to the idea of having a business and the help that she has received from previous loans. With the loans, she buys products to serve her plates of food, such as wood, rice and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Eugenia se dedica a la venta de comidas como Pollo Frito, Gaseosas, arroz con Frijoles...etc, realizando compra de los productos Nacionales. Lleva 20 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $500 gracias a un primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la buena demanda que tenia su comida, pues antes vendia a domicilio la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon le pidio que se estableciera para que ella ofreciera mas variedad. Antes de tener este negocio ella vendia ambulante el cerdito frito con yuca cocida (Chancho conYuca), pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como platos para servir la comida, leña, arroz, Arina y otros, ha logrado salir adelante, manteniendo su negocio y a sus 2 hijos en edad escolar pues es madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase products to make her food to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Antonia sells clothes and footwear that she buys wholesale and then resells it. She began her business seven years ago with $8,000 that she was thankfully able to save up many years before her first loan. The idea to have this business occurred to her when she realized the necessity to have a source of income to support her family. Her clients include customers from the La Terminal market in Leon. Before she had this business, she sold food to homes. But thanks to the idea of having this business and with the help of the previous loans that she used to purchase products such as clothing and footwear, she has successfully moved forward with her business and, in particular, her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Antonia vende ropa y calzado, compra al mayorista y realiza sus ventas al detalle. Lleva 7 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $8,000 gracias a un ahorro que tenia de muchos años mas su primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la necesidad de tener una manera de recibir ingresos para mantener a su familia. Tiene como clientela a la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon para acceder a un medio de comunicación.
