Antes de tener este negocio, antes vendia comida a domicilio pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como ropa y calzado ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio y con su familia sobre todo.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and footwear to resell.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mrs. Phen N., 51, is a mother of five children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To make her living, she works with two of her children (pictured because Phen N. was unavailable) at an open-air market selling various kinds of vegetables, earning collectively about $9/day in revenue.  Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning around $2.50/day of income, while the rest of her children are enrolled in school.  Mrs. Phen N. hopes to use this loan to purchase more vegetables to improve her business, and to buy a motorcycle to assist in her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to improve her business, and to buy a motorcycle to assist in her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheam S. N., 27, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a housewife, while her husband has to cover all the family’s expense by working as a Tuk-Tuk driver, earning around $10/day in revenue. This couple doesn’t have any children. They have humbly applied for a loan of $1000 to fix their Tuk-Tuk in order to keep running their business.

Mrs. Chem S. N. is approved for the loan, but her husband is the one who covers all her family’s expenses by operating a Tuk-tuk, so they share in the profit of this business ( Her husband is pictured because his wife, Mrs Chem S. N. is un available).

loans.use: To repair her husband's Tuk-Tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motor-bike).

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Cheam Srey Neang start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk N., 25, is married with three children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her income, she works as a garment worker, earning around $2/day. Mrs. Uk N. has applied for a loan to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi, to enable him to generate more income for his household.

Because Mrs. Uk N. is the approved borrower, she is being pictured here. The motorbike business is a family run business and they share the profit.

loans.use: To operate a motor-taxi  to generate more income for the household.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru:
Maksuda R. is 26 years old, she graduated from high school, is married and has two children. Maksuda is a house wife and aside from house work she breeds farm animals. Once she receives this credit, she plans to purchase several cows, which she will feed and then resell every 40-45 days. After selling, she again buys young animals to feed and resell. Maksuda's husband helps her in this business. The profit is used to support the family and create savings. The main buyers are people who live in Maksuda’s region. When they purchase her cattle, they either resell it and gain profits or obtain milk and meat products from it. The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахматова Максуда, возраст – 26 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 2-х детей. Максуда домохозяйка и помимо домашнего хозяйства занимается разведением домашнего скота. На полученнйы кредит она планирует приобрести несколько голов круного рогатого скота, который она откармливает и через каждые 40-45 дней продает его. В этом бизнесе ей помогает ее муж. После продажи откормленного скота, она приобретает молодый скот для откормки, а полученную прибыль использует на содержание семьи и накопление сбережений. Основными покупателями являются жители данного района, которые приобретая откормленный скот, во – первых используют его для дальнейшей перепродажи и получения прибыли, во-вторых использует его для получения и продажи молорка, в третьих для дальнейшего производства и продажи мяса и мясных продуктов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng B., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To cover her family’s expenses, she works as a tailor at home, earning around $5/day in revenue.  Her husband, meanwhile, is self-employed as a construction foreman, earning about $2/day.  Mrs. Leng B. has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine to make her business more productive, faster and easier.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to make her business more productive, faster and easier.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en: Sanam is a mother of 4 children.  She has a friendly family with her husband and her children helping her in her food store.  She became a client of Microinvest in January 2007.  Her first loan was for about 1000 somoni and she spent it on the expansion of her assortment of food products.  During the 5 years of her activity, she could attract many clients with her beautiful smile and high quality services.  All her clients say that she services them quickly and politely.  They can always find all food products which they need in high quality at her shop.  Today, she has good turnover of her working capital and she is going to spend her future loan for further developing her business.

loans.use: Purchasing food products for food store.

loans.name: Norallah

texts.en:
Norallah lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 2 children: one son and one daughter. He is living with his own family. He is a carpenter. He has good experience in his job.

He has a shop. He would like to expand his business, so he requested an individual loan to buy extra materials and increase his stock. He wants to make a good income for his family and help his father and mother. He is happy now.

loans.use: To buy extra materials and increase his stock

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is one of the most active clients of MicroInvest. He became a client in 2005 and during his activity, he increased the volume of his food products and attracted a lot of  new clients. His food shop is located in Spitamen,Tadjikistan. Today, he has a wide assortment of food products. With the loan from MicroInvest, he purchased refrigeration. It has given him the opportunity to include milk and meat products to his assortment. From KIVA, Husein has asked for extra capital, which he plans to spend for purchasing  2 sacks of flour and 50 liters of oil to sell.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod is a father of two children, and he has a very friendly family.  He became client of Microinvest in January in 2003.  His first loan was about 500 somoni and he spent it for expanding of his assortment of food products.  During four years of his activity he showed himself to be an excellent seller and punctual borrower.  All his clients say that he serviced them quickly and politely.  In 2006 he included to his assortment soft drinks and alcohol drinks.  Today his capital has a quick turnover rate, as food products and drinks have always been in good demand among customers.  From KIVA he wants to receive loan for the purchase of a refrigeration system and four lamps for his food shop.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigeration and four lamps for his food shop.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing K., 56, is a widow and lives with her six children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She works on her rice paddy growing rice crops, earning around $0.50/day, while four of her children are employed at a garment factory and the rest are unemployed.  Mrs. Hing K. is requesting a loan to open a grocery store selling various products to the people in her area. She believes this new business will enable her to make her family’s income bloom.

loans.use: To open a new grocery store

loans.name: Asr Group

texts.en:
Shafoat is leader of the ASR group. She is married and has 5 children. She has been in business for over 10 years. She has an education as designer. She has her own workshop where she has several assistants. With one of them (her best friend, Hursheda) she decided to take a loan from Microinvest in 2004. (Shafoat is on the right and Hursheda is on the left.) Hursheda has talent as good designer, but her family condition was hard and she could not get higher education. Shafoat took her into her workshop and taught her all she knows.

Today they both are active clients of Microinvest and their business is developing every day. With their KIVA loan, they want to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Pair Mohammad

texts.en: Pair Mohammad lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop. He has been engaged in business for over 6 years. He is married and has 4 children. His business is located in the main city of Kabul. He has lots of clients, but he has few materials in his shop. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like bars of chocolate, sweets, and baskets to make a good monthly income and help his family more. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like bars of chocolate, sweets, and baskets.

loans.name: Ocih

texts.en:
Ocih is 41 years old and the mother of a 13-year-old daughter. She has a small shop that sells snacks, vegetables and household goods. She can earn about $25 per day.

Her husband, O., has a fish farm and usually earns $50 a month. However, she still needs a $50 loan to buy more goods and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Entin

texts.en:
Entin is 25 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old son. She has a small shop that sells snacks and household goods. She can earn about $6 per day.

Her husband, H., is a driver who earns $8 income per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and make her shop sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton S. is a seller of construction materials in the Spitamen market, Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children.  His elder son is his business partner.  They together sells their goods.  Sulton has been engaged in the construction trade for over 6 years.  He bought his goods from supplies in Russia and orders goods brought by van / wagon.  He has a constant stream of clients from remote districts of Khujand,Tadjikistan.  Now he is requesting 4100 somoni for purchasing the next batch of goods.

(He is on the left in the photo)

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Kamin Agha

texts.en: Kamin Agha lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, and he lives with his family. He is the only one who helps his family. He has a cosmetics shop, and he has been working in this business for more than 5 years. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new kinds of cosmetics materials. He wants to buy products especially for the young generation to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family. He is happy, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of cosmetics materials

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi is 32 years old and the mother of a 13-year-old daughter. She has been selling clothes on credit. She has to go around to various places to offer and sell her goods and usually earns $5 per day.

Her husband, I., is a driver who earns $10 income per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede is 26 years old and married with a 7-year-old child. She sells clothes on credit and also household tools. She usually earns $5 per day.

Her husband, Endih, sells fruit in Jakarta and earns $15 income per day. She really needs a $50 loan to buy more goods and to expand her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sati

texts.en:
Sati is a 37-year-old widow and lives with her daughter and her son-in-law. She sells some snacks and beverages and usually earns $5 per day.

She wants to expand her business and really needs a $50 loan to buy more food to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and snacks

loans.name: Minah

texts.en:
Minah is 33 years old and married. She sells mats on credit and usually goes around to various places to offer and sell her goods. She can earn about $5 per day.

Her husband, U., sells vegetables at the market and usually earns $15 per day. However, she still needs more income to cover her family needs. She requests a $50 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more mats to sell

loans.name: Ojah

texts.en:
Ojah is36 years old and the mother of a 7-year-old daughter. She has been selling sheets on credit, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She can earn about $5 per day.

Her husband, A., sells vegetables and earns $15 in income per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mrs. Mich M., 54, is married and lives with her husband (who is pictured because Mrs. Mich M. was unavailable) and five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She works with her husband on their rice paddy growing rice crops, earning collectively around $2/day.  Three of her children work at a garment factory, earning together $150/month.  Another one is unemployed and the other is a student.  Mrs. Mich M. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business.  With the help of the loan, her family will have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Mich Malay has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 24 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old daughter. She has been running her business by selling cosmetics on credit. She usually earns $2 per day.

Her husband sells vegetables at the market and earns $20 income per day. She wants to add to her working capital and requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her working capital

loans.name: Abdulahai

texts.ru:
Abdulahai A., 40, established his farm 20 years ago, when he inherited his cattle from his father. At that time, steep inflation made life very difficult: Abdulahai and his father would sell their cattle within a few months, but they would have to use the money to sustain themselves for entire year. Then, MicroInvest helped Abdulahai and his father to improve the situation. Today, in addition to having a farm, Abdulahai works as a construction worker in the city.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абидов Абдулахай 40 лет организовал своё хозяйство 20 лет назад, когда его отец только начинал и передал свой скот Абдулахаю. Большие проблемы создавала непомерно высокая инфляция. Они с отцом свой скот продавали в течение нескольких месяцев, а жить на эти деньги предстояло целый год. Для этого, им помог улучшить положение Микроинвест. В настоящий момент Абдулахай также работает строителем жилых домов в городе.

loans.use: To raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat has been engaged in  business for many years.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her business is located in the food market in Spitamen, a district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She started her business from selling macaroni and cookies which she bought from workshops and had little profit. 

Mahfirat became a client of MLF Microinvest in 2003 and, from the loans, she expanded her assortment of food products. Gradually she  increased her working capital and could rent one food shop from the market owner in Spitamen.Today she sells different kinds of food products and also has the opportunity to buy meat and milk product as she has refrigeration at her food store.  She is requesting 4100 somoni from KIVA lenders to make the next purchase for her food store.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.ru:
Ayubjon sells a national sour dairy product “Kurut.” He brings Kurut from Ashta and sells it to retailers. He plans to expand his business to other parts of the city. Ayubjon also spends part of his time working in construction.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбджон продает национальный кисломолочный продукт «Курут». Он привозит курут из Ашта и раздает розничым торговцам . Он планирует расширить свой бизнес и в других частях города. Часть своего времени он работает в качетсве строителя

loans.use: dairy products

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat did not have startup capital and she started with nothing. At first her parents helped her with the resale of a sour dairy product “kurut.” With time Muhabbat received her first loan from MLF MicroInvest at the city market

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ёрбекова Мухаббат начального капитала не было, начинала с нуля. В начале помогли родители для перепродажи кисломолочного продукта «курут» . Со временем получила первый кредит в Микроинвест. На данный момент продает свою продукцию на городском рынке.

loans.use: Sale of dairy products

loans.name: Sameboi

texts.ru:
Самебой Сангинов разводит и перепродает скот. Для этого у него имеется большой двор с коровником, где он держит скот. Опыт в данной деятельности 15 лет. Получив кредит, он увеличил свой каптал для развития своего бизнеса. Также получив молоко о коров он продает молоко и кисломолочные продукты. Sameboi S. raises and sells livestock. He also sells dairy products that he makes from his cows’He has a big yard with a barn where he keeps his livestock. Sameboi has 15 years of experience in this field. After getting a loan he increased his capital to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Самебой Сангинов разводит и перепродает скот. Для этого у него имеется большой двор с коровником, где он держит скот. Опыт в данной деятельности 15 лет. Получив кредит, он увеличил свой каптал для развития своего бизнеса. Также получив молоко о коров он продает молоко и кисломолочные продукты.

loans.use: Livestock and production of dairy products

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 35, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She and her husband run a stand selling beef soup and some grocery items to the people in their community, earning around $3/day of profit.  Two of her children work in construction, making collectively $8/day, while the other is a student.  Mrs. Touch S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory and to buy equipment to make wine.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, and to buy equipment to make wine.

loans.name: Gustavo Sansão

texts.pt:
Gustavo lives with his girlfriend and their daughter. He joined the credit program this year and this is his second loan. He plans on using this loan to buy the material to make sandals and flip flops. Gustavo’s business is growing, in the future he wants to open his own shoe shop but for now he works in his home underneath a tree. His daughter is too young to attend school but Gustavo is planning on enrolling her as soon as she reaches school age. Gustavo hopes to one day have a son and to teach him his craft.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo é solteiro, mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 1 filha.. Gustavo entrou para o programa de crédito ainda este ano. Este é o 2º empréstimo que vai tomar. Ele quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mercadori para a confecção de sandálias e chinelos que é a sua especialidade. O seu negócio está a desenvolver. Se tudo continuar a correr bem ele pensa no futuro abrir uma sapataria, pois que de momento ele trabalha em sua casa debaixo de uma àrvore. A sua filha ainda não tem idade para ir a escola. mas logo que esta atinja a idade escolar será matriculada. Gostaria de ter um filho para poder ensinar-lhe a sua arte.

loans.use: To buy material to make sandals and flip flops

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.ru:
Shahrabonu N. started her business by purchasing two bulls. After that her family kept up to 11 cows and raised bulls for sale. They have been doing this for 8 years. Having 8 years of experience, she continues to expand her business and plans to work with MLF MicroInvest in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахрабону Назарова начинала все с приобретения двух бычков. Затем уже сами, своей семьей, держали до 11 коров и выращивали бычков на продажу. И так, с переменным успехом, 8 лет. Имея 8 летний опыт за спиной, она продолжает развивать свой бизнес и планирует сотрудничать с Микронвест в будущем.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Maria Carla

texts.pt:
Maria Carla lives with her boyfriend and 3 children. Her boyfriend works as a driver for a company. Maria joined the credit program this year and this is her first loan. With the income from the business she wants to help with the household expenses. Her boyfriend’s salary is not enough to cover all expenses. All their children are in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Carla é solteira , mas vive com um homem com quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Maria é motorista numa empresa privada. Maria entrou para o programa de crédito aind este ano. Este é o 1º empréstimo que ela vai tomar. Com os rendimentos ela do negócio se correr bem, ela pensa em ajudar o marido a custear as despesas da casa. O seu marido recebe um salario baixo, precisando da ajuda da esposa para pagar todas as despesas. Os filhos de Maria estão a estudar no Ensino primario.

loans.use: To buy more products for the grocery store

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Mrs. Tep P., 48, is a widow and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  To cover her family’s expenses, she runs a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits and candy to students passing by, earning around $3/day of profit.  One of her children is employed by a private company and the other two are married.  Mrs Tep P. hopes to use this loan to expand her business by opening a new stand selling biscuits and other food to generate additional profits.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening a new stand selling biscuits and other food to generate additional profits.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru:
Nasimjon K. is a barber. He learned from his uncle. After gaining experience, Nasimjon rented a place of business with his friends and later worked at home. He will use this loan to rent a location in the center of the city in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Насимджон Козибобоев предлагает свои услуги в качестве парикмахера. Был учеником у своего дяди. Имея опыт , он продолжил свое ремесло в помещении, где арендовал с друзьями. Сейчас получив кредит, планирует арендовать помещение в центре города для продвижения своего бизнеса, на данный момент он парикмахер на дому.

loans.use: услуги парикмахера

loans.name: Berta Albuquerque

texts.pt:
Berta is married and mother of 3 children. She lives in Vila Macia in the Bilene district. Her husband works for a private company as a clerk but his salary is not a lot. Berta joined the credit program in 2007, she wants to use this loan to buy more products for her bar especially for the holiday season. Her children are all in school. With the income from the bar she has helped her husband with the family’s expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta é casada e mãe de 3 filhos. O marido de Berta trabalha numa empresa privada como escriturário. Mas o seu salário é baixo. Berta entrou para o programa de crédito em 2007. Ela quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de mercadoria para o seu bar. principalmente nesta quadra festiva que se avizinha. Os filhos de Berta estão a estudar no ensino secundário. Com os rendimentos do negócio ela tem ajudado o marido a custear as despesas da casa. O casal vive na vila da Macia, sede do distrito do Bilene.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Kendjanisso

texts.ru:
Kendjanisso Y. and her sister started their business 5 years ago. Kendjanisso’s sister brought golden jewelry from Turkey and Kendjanisso sold it. Today, they have a small jewelry store. Kendjanisso and her sister plan to use the loan to increase assortment of the jewelry sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кенчанисо начала свой бизнес с сестрой 5 лет назад. Ее сестра привозила ювелирные(золотые) изделия из Турции и давала на продажу Кенчанисо. Теперь у нее есть свой ювелирный магазинчик Получив кредит она планирует увеличить ассортимент.

loans.use: Increase assortment of the goods sold

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en: Muhabat M. has sold bedspreads for over 5 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is located in Spitamen, Tadjikistan, in the big clothes market. She sells her goods at a high rate and she has many constant clients. Her trading place is profitable as it is situated in the center of the market. Every day, she helps her clients enthusiastically and they continue to be satisfied with the quality of her goods.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Somina

texts.ru:
Somina M. teaches in a school. However, the salary that she receives from the school is insufficient to feed a family of 4. A year ago she decided to start a business and resell gold. She has come to MicroInvest for help because she does not have a sufficient amount of capital to use as her startup fund.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Сомина Мухидинова работает преподавателем в школе, но оклад, который она получает в школе не достаточно прокормить семью из 4 человек. Год назад решилась заняться бизнесом и перепродавать золото. При недостатке оборотных средств она обратилась в Микроинвест .

loans.use: Jewlery sales

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
Mavdjuda has started her business together with her husband. After the divorce she took the business in her hands. She has been working on the market for the past 15 years. Seasonal fruits have been brining in a good profit. With time, her now ex-husband has stopped helping her out with the business. She has decided to obtain a credit that will allow her to increase the selection of goods she has for sale, which is currently impossible due to low turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мавджуда начинала свой бизнес с мужем, после развода она взяла бизнес по продажи фруктов в свои руки. На рынке 15 лет. Сезонные фрукты приносили ей не плохой доход. Со временем, когда муж перестал помогать решила взять кредит, для улучшения ассортимента и из-за нехватки оборотного капитала.

loans.use: Fruit sale

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Marifat is a seller of children's clothes for over 5 years.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her business is located in the Spitamen big clothes market, Tajikistan.  She became a client of Microinvest in 2003 and she used her first loan to expand her assortment of goods. She purchases goods weekly.  Today she has a good turnover of goods and has a constant stream clients.  Her trade place is profitable as it is situated in the first  clothes row at the market.  Now, she is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase winter clothes.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab N., 61, is a widow and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  To cover her family’s expenses, Mrs. Preab N. runs a stand near her house selling various kinds of desserts to the people in her area, earning about $15/day in revenue.  She has to get up very early in the morning to cook all different kinds of desserts, in order to be on time to sell to a number of garment workers passing by.  Her two daughters also help her sell before they go to work in the morning at a factory.  Her son can make around $5/day from working as a construction foreman.  Mrs. Preab N. hopes to use this loan to purchase more equipment and utensils to improve her business, and to buy a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment to improve her business, and to buy a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat has sold children clothes for over 5 years.  She is married and has two children.  Her business is located in Spitamen.  She buys her goods from wholesale markets in Istaravshan.  She goes to purchase goods every week.  Due to her first row position in the market she is able to maintain a steady profit.  She will use her Kiva loan to purchase winter children clothes.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat trades electronics at the store. She lives with her mother who is ill and needs constant care. She started her business 5 years ago when her father died. Before that, she was working as a sales clerk at the store. Her dream is to increase her capital and purchase a trading spot instead of renting it. Most of her profit she uses for medication for her mother.

loans.use: Trade of electronics

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mr. Tong S., 36, lives with his wife and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  To support his family, he is currently employed at a private company as a driver, earning around $7/day.  His wife works selling vegetables at an open-air market, making about $5/day.  This couple hopes to use this loan to expand their inventory by adding more vegetables to meet their clients’ needs, and to repair their house.  Mr. Tong S. is the approved borrower for this loan, but the money will be used to expand inventory for their jointly owned business.

loans.use: To expand inventory by adding more vegetables, and to repair his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying plastic pane materials and an engraving knife set.

loans.name: Alihon

texts.en: Alihon and his wife make a living by preparing and selling shish kebabs and baked pies. They have been doing this for 7 years. They have no other permanent jobs and their business is the only source of their income. Alihon and his wife travel among all markets in the region so they have to work every day of the week. Selling at a single market brings them $100 in earnings. He plans to take another loan to increase the volume of their business. The Mamajonovs are in the photo.

loans.use: To increase the volume of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand pullovers for sale.

loans.name: Hakimjon

texts.en: Hakimjon has been doing business for quite some time.  He is married and is 29 years old.  He sells spare parts for cars in spare parts.  A year ago Hakimjon came to Microinvest for a loan.  He used this loan to expand his business.  The loan gave him the opportunity to increase the assortment and improve the quality of the parts he sells.  He now plans to expand his business again with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his  business

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda M. is married and has 3 children. She has sold shoes since 2002. She buys and transports shoes from the Istaravshan and Isfara districts of her country and sells them in Spitamen. During the last 5 years of her activity, she has attracted many clients with her friendly attitude and high quality service. Her returns on the loans have been fast and now she is seeking extra capital so that she can expand her assortment of shoes in order to satisfy customer demands and improve her income.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Victoria Fabião

texts.pt:
Victória works as a seamstress and elementary school teacher. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is also a teacher. She joined the credit program this year. She wants to use the loan to buy more fabric. Her daughter is attending technical school in Inhamussua in the province Inhambe. With the income from the business Victória wants to help her husband with the family expenses and her daughter’s studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Victória, é modista. Para além de ser modista é professora numa escola primária. Victória é casada e tem 1 filha. O marido de Victória tambem é professor. Victória entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Ela quer tomar o dinheiro para a compra de tecidos para a confecção de roupa para a venda. A filha de Victória está a estudar numa escola técnica de Inhamussua na Província de Inhambane. Com os lucros ela quer ajudar o marido a custear as despesas da casa e a pagar a escola da filha.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of assorted second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Sarneta Xavier

texts.pt:
Sarneta lives with her boyfriend and 5 children. Her boyfriend works odd jobs to support the family. All Sarneta’s children are in school except the youngest. She has just joined the credit program. And this is her first loan. She plans on using this loan to buy more used clothes to sell.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Sarneta é solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. O marido de Sarneta vive de pequenos negócios. Os filhos de Sarneta estão a estudar com a excepção dos mais novos que ainda não têm idade para ir a escola.Sarneta quer usar o dinheiro para aumentar o seu stock de roupa usada para a venda. Sarneta está entrando ainda este ano para ao programa de crédito. Este empréstimo é o primeiro que ela vai tomar.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza is one of the active clients of Microinvest.  She became client in 2003 and during her activity she has increased the volume of her goods and attracted a lot of new clients. She has good skills at selling and her clients say that she has services them quickly and politely. They like her good assortment of clothes and now she requires another loan of 900 USD to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is married and has two children. For more than two years, she has sold women's clothes from her shop in Spitamen's main market. Her husband has a car and helps her by bringing goods from their home to the shop. He also acquires new inventory from nearby wholesale markets. Matluba has done very well as a businesswoman, with quick turnover of her inventory and many regular customers. She has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase winter clothes, which she knows will be very popular and sell very quickly during the busy holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes to sell in busy holiday season

loans.name: Palmira

texts.pt:
Palmira is married. She is 52 years old and works selling groceries with her husband. They live in Voz da Frelimo an agricultural area and also work planting vegetables for the family. Palmira joined the credit program in the beginning of the year and has already received two loans. This is her third loan and she plans to invest in her grocery store. Her children are all in school. In the future, Palmira plans investing in her agricultural work as well.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Palmira é casada e tem 52 anos de idade. Ela vende produtos de primeira necessidade na sua pequena mercearia. O marido de Palmira trabalha juntamente com ela. A Voz da Frelimo por ser uma zona com potencialidades agricolas o casal tambem pratica agricultura de subsistencia. Palmira entrou para o programa no início do ano. Ela tomou já dois emprestimos anteriores. Este que ela vai tomar é o terceiro empréstimo. Ela usa o dinheiro para investir na mercearia.. Os filhos de Palmira já estão crescidos e ja estão casados. Ela vive com alguns netos. Os netos de Palmira estão a estudar. o negócio está a correr-lhe bem. Ela pensa no futuro juntar dinheiro dos lucros para ver se compra uma alfaia agrícola.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is 35 years old and the mother of a 10-year-old son. She started her business selling sandals on credit after joining MBK. She has to go around to various places to offer and sell her goods.

During the festive season, she can sell more sandals and earn more income, too. Her husband, M., sells vegetables at the market and usually earns $2 per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
Titin is a 28-year-old widow. She prepares and sells Indonesian salad (gado-gado) and also fried snacks. She can earn about $8 per day.

She has to work hard to cover her family's needs and save the money for her child's education. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her working capital

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en:
Mimin is 45 years old and the mother of a 10-year-old daughter. She sells cosmetics on credit and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, U., sells some fruit in Jakarta and earns $10 income per week.

She requests a $50 loan to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics and fruit. She hopes that she can earn more income for her child's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and fruit

loans.name: Encih

texts.en:
Encih is 38 years old and the mother of a 15-year-old daughter. She sells clothes and household tools on credit. She has to go around to various places to get more customers and sell her goods. She usually earns $5 per day.

Her husband, T., sells vegetables and usually earns $2 per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and hopes that she can earn more income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Piah

texts.en:
Piah is 45 years old and a married woman. She sells coconut milk rice and usually earns $5 per day. She requests a loan of IDR 500,000 (about $75) to expand her business and sell porridge.

She works very hard. Because her husband does not have a job, she has to support their daily needs by herself. She hopes that she can continue doing this business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Neni

texts.en:
Neni is 32 years old, and the mother of a child aged 10. She sells clothes on credit and usually goes to places to offer her goods. She usually earns $7.50 per day.

Her husband does not have regular income, so her income is just enough for daily needs. She requests IDR 1,000,000 (about $125) to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en: Yulduz is 41 years old and has three children. She and her husband are hard-working entrepreneurs who sell women's clothing and haberdashery. This is their only source of income, because other types of jobs are hard to come by in this area. She and her husband acquire their goods at wholesale markets in Istaravshan and Tashkent (the capital of Uzbekistan) before selling them in Spitamen. Yulduz received her first loan from Microinvest three year ago, and used it to increase the supply of items she had for sale. Her business benefited greatly from this loan, which is why she has applied for a new one to continue the expansion of her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To continue the expansion of her business

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.en: Mukkaram runs a small business that specializes in the sale of onions, a popular item in her town, Spitamen. She sells them from a stall in the central market, and makes a substantial contribution to her family's income. Her husband works, but his income is not regular. She has applied for a loan to purchase new supplies of onions to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To acquire new supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Agali

texts.en: Agali H. owns and operates a small video and music shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is a single young man who has become an entrepreneur in Azerbaijan’s transitional economy. He is looking for funding in the amount of $600 so that he can invest in his business by increasing his inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase inventory stock of music and videos

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is 45 years old and married. She runs a small business in Spitamen selling fruits and plastic bags that she buys wholesale in the regional capital, Khujand. Her income is not large, but it covers her family's expenses. She has been a Microinvest customer for more than a year, and has always made good use of the money lent to her. She has applied for a loan to buy new items to sell to her customers, and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Esker

texts.en: Esker B. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is one of Azerbaijan’s new entrepreneurs trying to make his business grow in this transitional economy. Esker has already successfully repaid one loan with Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that he is a customer that can be trusted. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

loans.name: Behram

texts.en: Behram I. owns and operates an auto parts store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is currently living in Devechi with his wife and three children. Behram has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit, proving that he is a customer that can be trusted. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $700 so that he can finish the repairs he has begun in his shop.

loans.use: To finish repairing his shop

loans.name: Haver

texts.en: Haver M. operates a woman’s clothing and accessories stand at the bazaar located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Haver is a widow and is currently living in Devechi with her four children. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $800 so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda sells perfume and small goods in the central market of her home town, Spitamen. Her shop is open every day and generates a large portion of her family's income. Over the last year, she has used loans from Microinvest to expand her business. She has come to us for a new loan to increase the selection of perfumes and small goods she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy community phones.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla B. (pictured on the left) makes traditional Azerbaijani carpets with the help of her business partners in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She currently lives in Devechi with her husband and child. This will be Leyla’s fourth loan from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is one of our valued customers. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that she can purchase more of the high-quality supplies she utilizes in making these beautiful traditional carpets.

loans.use: To purchase supplies used in the carpet-making process

loans.name: Mehreli

texts.en: Mehreli G. owns and operates a market in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He sells everything from bread to women’s purses. He lives in Devechi with his wife and two children. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can expand and diversify his inventory further.

loans.use: To further expand and diversify his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is 44 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver while she sells clothing for children and men in a shop in her town's central market.  On most days she works long hours, often with her older daughter (seen here in the photo).  She has been a Microinvest client for one year, and in that time has used several loans to successfully expand her business. She has come to us for a new loan to buy additional winter clothing to sell to her customers now that the weather has turned colder.

loans.use: To expand her assortment of winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik G. is a sheep farmer in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last six years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can invest in his business to make it more efficient and profitable.

loans.use: To invest in his sheep business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an assortment of cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Noheddin

texts.en: Noheddin E. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last 10 years and lives in Devechi with his wife and two children. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en: For the past two years, Maksudjon has made a living preparing and selling shish kebab. Business is good because his customers like his products and his cooking, and he believes that this is a good time to increase his sales. He has come to us for a loan to make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur A. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last six years. He is one of Azerbaijan’s many entrepreneurs that have come about after the breakup of the Soviet Union. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $600 so that he can make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en: Suraiyo is a teacher by profession and has taught in school. She is 39 years old and married, although her husband is away working in Russia. Because teacher salaries are low in Tajikistan, she decided to go into business for herself. When she taught, Suraiyo sold a small number of food products to the people at her school. She went into business selling these products full-time in the central market of Spitamen, and has used several loans from Microinvest to increase the assortment of goods she sells. Business is good, and she has applied for a new loan of $500 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan E. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last six years and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make repairs and enhancements to his cab. There are currently many taxi cab drivers in Azerbaijan, so he wants to invest in his cab so that he can remain competitive with the other cabs on the road.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is married and the mother of two children. Several years ago, she began selling children's clothes in the central market of her town, Isfara. She loves being in business and turns over her inventory quickly because she has many faithful customers who like to shop at her store. Karima buys her goods in the nearby city of Istaravshan, and has come to us for a loan of $500 so that she can go there to purchase a new assortment of winter clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of winter clothes

loans.name: Terlan

texts.en: Terlan M. owns and operates a car wash in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working with this business for the last ten years. Terlan currently lives in Devechi with his wife and two kids. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can invest in improving his car wash.

loans.use: To invest in improving his car wash

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif M. (his employee is pictured) owns and operates a small office supply store that also offers printing services. His business and his home are located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. This will be the fifth time that Yusif has received credit from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that he is one of our most valued customers. He is currently looking for funding so that he can expand the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To expand the quantity and variety of his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Munishon

texts.en: Munishon began working in her town's market years ago, when she was helping her daughter run a local business.  After her daughter's marriage, Munishon went into business on her own, selling goods she purchased from wholesalers. Munishon has made good use of loans from MicroInvest to expand her business, which has grown large enough for her to hire her younger son as an employee. She has come to us for a new loan which will allow her to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mavludahon

texts.en: Mavludahon is 49 years old, married and has three children. For the last few years, she has sold fabric from a booth at the central market in her town of Isfara. She buys her products in Karosu, Kirgizstan, a nearby city that has a large wholesale market. Muvludahon is happy that her business has been a success because she is her family's sole means of support. We are confident that she will be able to repay her loan because she has invested her own personal resources in her business, and has made good use of the other loans she has received from Microinvest over the last year and a half.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her hotel business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane W. N. is 36 years old lady married with one child. She resides in Nakuru town. Jane is the sole breadwinner because her husband is jobless. She is a business entrepreneur owning a hotel in Nakuru town. She has been operating the business for a long time and she has gained a lot of experience. Her busiest time is at lunch time when she has to serve different people from different walks of life. Her cooking skills are renowned which has created a huge client base for her. This has led her to start thinking of expanding her business. However, she faces challenges like lack of funds to meet the rising demand. To expand her business, she is requesting for a loan of US$ 400 which she intends to use as follows; US$ 350 to buy more cooking ingredients and US$ 50 employ someone to help her. Jane is confident that she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand her hotel business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his retail business.

loans.name: Nikusekela

texts.en:
Mrs. Nikusekela M. is an enterprising business woman who manages to run two businesses at once! One is a shop selling foodstuffs and other miscellaneous items and the other is a fruit and vegetable farm. Nikusekela is requesting a loan of TSH 800,000 to expand both businesses. The loan will be used to buy additional stock for the shop and to purchase seeds and equipment. Nikusekela sends her greetings to all potential Kiva lenders!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her shop, and seeds and equipment for her fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Hair, hair and more hair! Suzana can sell you long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair and then attach it to your head and make it look like your own. She is a funky, young entrepreneur who needs a loan of TSH 1,000,000 to expand her business by purchasing new equipment and stock. Perhaps her eight year-old daughter Jospehine will follow her into the family business!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and stock for the salon.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mrs. Halima M. runs a colourful fruit and vegetable stall in the colourful market town of Kigogo, Tanzania. Halima is married with three children, aged 6 months, 4 and 14. She is requesting a loan of TSH 300,000 to buy more produce to expand her business, including the delicious in-season fruits available here, such as mangoes, bananas, pawpaw, watermelon and pineapple.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additonal fruit and vegetables for her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his shop business.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Muslima S., affectionately known by most people as Mama Mwanjaa, which in her native tribe, the Mdigo, means that she is the mother of a girl. She runs a cosmetics shop in Mwananyamala, a busy commercial sector of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. With your help, Mama Mwanjaa will receive her first loan of TSH 200,000 from Kiva, which she plans to use to purchase additional stock such as moisturizing cream, soap, shampoo and weird and wonderful hair pieces!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the S. client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics and hair pieces for her shop.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mrs. Mariamu M. runs a shop in Temeke Mji Mpya, a suburb of Dar es Salaam, 500km from her home town Mmakonde, which is on the border of Tanzania and Mozambique. She sells a mixed bag of cosmetics, cleaning products and soft drinks and requires a loan of TSH 600,000 to purchase additional stock, such as soap, shampoo, bleach and unnamable brands of soft drink (we don’t want to provide free advertising to the multinationals!).

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Place your orders for African batik shirts here! Mrs. Joyce J. runs a clothing shop in the shanty town of Manzese Darajani. She uses the profits from her business to support her three children, assisted by her husband Jonathan, who works for the Tanzanian Evangelical Lutheran Church. Joyce is requesting a loan of TSH 800,000 to purchase dyes and cloths to make new styles of batik clothing. And sorry, but we don’t actually provide online ordering services. If you’re really interested you’ll have to come to Tanzania!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dyes to make and sell new styles of batik clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Eunike

texts.en:
Ms. Eunike L. is a single, independent businesswoman who runs a clothing boutique, where she makes and sells beautiful batik cloths and dresses. She is standing on the left-hand side of the photo modeling a red, white and black creation. One of her employees is standing to the right. Eunike requires a loan of TSH 1,200,000 to purchase a hand-operated embroidery machine, which she will use to meet the demands of her customers for even more beautiful and detailed dresses!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a hand-operated embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail, 37, owns a hardware shop inside the timber market in Tema. The past two months business has been a little bit slower, but it is picking up right now. She is hoping for a loan, as she does not have enough capital at the moment to purchase the stock her customers are demanding. With the loan, she will purchase laced cloth, jeans, watches, necklaces, and hardware. 

Abigail plans to save her profits to expand the store. She hopes by next year she can expand her stock with cement and roofing sheets. Abigail also takes care of her 10-year-old son. They are currently living in mission housing, provided by the church. If her business goes well, she will build a house for her family.

Abigail is a member of the lending group, Zion. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her stock by purchasing laced cloth, jeans, watches, necklaces and hardware.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. has been selling natural products for more than a year. This business is his family’s source of income. One of his daughters and himself are in charge of it. Luckily they are doing well with the store, but they are needing additional merchandise. They are requesting a loan in order to buy more natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco A. se dedica a la venta de productos naturales desde hace ya más de un año. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia. En el trabajamos una de mis hijas y yo. Gracias a Dios les ventas van muy bien pero nos esta haciendo falta más mercancía. Solicitamos un préstamo para la compra de productos naturales.

loans.use: Buying goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa has owned a grocery store for more than two years. This business is the family’s source of income for both her and her husband. Luckily it is doing well and they would like to invest in more merchandise. They are requesting a loan for US $800.00 for these purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Teresa tiene un negocio de abarrotes desde hace más de dos años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de la familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Gracias a Dios nos está yendo muy bien en el negocio y queremos invertirle más en mercancía. Solicitamos un préstamo de US $800.00 para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: Buying goods

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
I have been selling meat for more than three years. My business is selling and delivering meat to various places in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This business is my family's only source of income. I need an additional delivery truck to be able to make more daily deliveries. I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a truck for delivery of my products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de tres años en la venta de carnes. Mi negocio es la venta y entrega de carne a varios lugares de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia. Me esta haciendo falta una unidad mas para la repartición de la mercancía y tener mas entregas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de una camioneta para la entrega de la mercancía.

loans.use: Buy a small delivery truck

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
I have more than 10 years of experience in my grocery business. This business, in which I work with my wife, has been the family's source of income during those 10 years. We want to invest in additional inventory for the business. We are requesting a loan of $1000 for the purchase of merchandise for our store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 10 años con mi negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio ha sido el ingreso de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertirle más en mercancía al negocio. Solicitamos un préstamo $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: Stock his grocery store with additional inventory

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Mr. Marco M. has worked selling fruits and vegetables in various parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 2 years. This business is his family's source of income; Mr. M. and wife both work in the business. Because they want to make an additional investment in the business without leaving themselves without working capital, they are applying for a loan of $1000 for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Marco M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en varias partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo desde hace mas de 2 años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia en el trabajan su esposa y el. Queremos invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarnos por eso solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es:
Maria Yadira has a business selling clothing for more than 20 years. She began with CS$1500. capital. She is the head of the family with two school-aged children who have been the source of her strength to succeed in her business.

She is a hard-working woman. Before having this business she had a job where she washed and ironed clothing, but it didn't generate sufficient income to cover her basic needs, and that was the main impetus to start her own business.

She has been working with Ceprodel for around 2 years with a record of 11 credits. This has benefited her as she has been able to grow her business thereby increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARÍA YADIRA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ROPA AL DETALLE DESDE 20 AÑOS. EMPEZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$1,500.00. JEFA DE FAMILIA CON DOS HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR LOS CUALES HAN SIDO SU MOTIVO PRINCIPAL PARA ESFORZARSE EN SU NEGOCIO.

HA SIDO UNA MUJER LUCHADORA ANTES DE TENER SU NEGOCIO SE DEDICABA A LAVAR Y PLANCHAR ROPA, SIN EMBARGO NO ERAN SUFICIENTES INGRESOS PARA CUBRIR CON SUS NECESIDADES, RAZÓN PRIMORDIAL PARA PONER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO.

CON CEPRODEL LLEVA TRABAJANDO ALREDEDOR DE DOS AÑOS CON UN RÉCORD DE 11 CRÉDITOS. ESTO LE HA BENEFICIADO YA QUE HA LOGRADO CRECER SU NEGOCIO OBTENIENDO ASÍ MAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Miss Luz Marina is 22 years old, single, and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of Carapeguá with her mother. She does not have any children. Luz sells clothing and has a stall in the Municipal city market

She was not fortunate enough to have finished high school, as she comes from a very poor family. From a very young age she had to go and work to help her family survive. As a teen she traveled to Argentina in search of better work opportunities, and after working several years and saving a good amount of earnings, she decided to return to Paraguay and open her own business.

Today she has achieved her goals with much effort, as her business is going well; she wishes to buy summer seasonal clothing like t-shirts, shorts, shirts, tank tops, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Luz Marina tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive en el barrio San Miguel de Carapeguá, junto con su madre; no tiene hijos. Luz se dedica a la venta de ropas y tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado Municipal de la ciudad.

Ella no ha tenido la suerte de terminar sus estudios secundarios ya que proviene de una familia muy pobre, por lo que desde muy pequeña tuvo que salir a las calles a trabajar para ayudar a su familia con el sustento. Siendo adolescente viajo a Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, y luego de trabajar varios años y juntar un buen capital, decidió volver al Paraguaya y abrir su propio negocio.

Es así que con mucho esfuerzo hoy día ve logrados sus objetivos, ya que su negocio marcha muy bien; ella desea adquirir ropas de temporada verano tales como remeras, shorts, camisas, camisillas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
Melba is owner of a small clothing fabrication business. Two years ago she began her business making and selling clothing, starting with CS$6000.00 capital that was from the liquidation of the business in which she worked.

She began with eight industrial machines in a rented shop, thanks to her efforts she was able to purchase the shop. All her energy has been focused in giving her mother a better life and meeting her basic needs.

She has been working with Ceprodel for 4 months with a record of 2 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MELBA ES PROPIETARIA DE UN TALLER DE COSTURA. DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS MONTO SU NEGOCIO DE ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE ROPA EMPEZANDO CON UN CAPITAL DE C S$6,000.00 MISMOS QUE ERAN DE SU LIQUIDACIÓN DE LA EMPRESA EN LA LABORABA.

INICIO CON OCHO MAQUINAS INDUSTRIALES EN LOCAL ALQUILADO, GRACIAS A SU ESFUERZO LOGRO COMPRAR EL LOCAL. TODO SU ESFUERZO LO HA ENFOCADO PARA DARLE UNA MEJOR VIDA A SU MAMA Y CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES.

CON CEPRODEL LLEVA TRABAJANDO 4 MESES CON UN RÉCORD DE 2 CRÉDITOS

loans.use: Purchase raw material to make clothing

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma is an enterprising young woman and mother of a beautiful 11 year old girl. She has accomplished her goal of having her own beauty salon.

Zulma opened her salon with some savings that she had, and even though she hadn't studied cosmetology and didn't have any previous experience, she decided to open her salon. Today it is one of the busiest salons in the area, has a very good clientele and has five employees that help her in the salon.

She has had this business for seven years, and during those years she has been taking different trainings around the world, seeking to perfect these techniques that she naturally possesses.

She is seeking a loan to purchase different types of beauty products such as colors, shampoo, conditioners, hydrogen peroxide, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Zulma es una mujer joven y emprendedora, madre de una hermosa niña de once años, ella ha logrado cumplir su meta de tener su propio salón de belleza.

Zulma abrió su peluquería con unos ahorros que tenía, y aún sin haber estudiado peluquería y sin experiencia previa, decidió abrirlo. Hoy día es uno de los salones más concurridos de la zona, posee muy buena clientela y ya posee cinco personales que la ayudan en el salón.

Hace siete años que tiene su negocio, y durante esos años ella ha ido cursando diferentes tipos de capacitaciones en diferentes partes del mundo, buscando perfeccionar esas técnicas que ella posee naturalmente.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar diferentes tipos de productos de belleza como tintes, shampoo, acondicionadores, agua oxigenada, etc.

loans.use: Purchase shampoo, conditioner, hair color, creams, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
This woman is originally from Chinandega city. Her business is located in the Bisne market. She began two years ago with a modest amount of capital, only C$1500 córdobas (US$80), from her savings.

She decided to start this business, beginning with a few products, selling candy from a table and basket. As fruit of this labor and perserverance with great sacrifice she was able to acquire her permanent location.

She now offers a wide variety of products, although always on a small scale. The first loand she asked for from CEPRODEL, was for C$1500 córdobas and she has been working for more than one year (as she was still selling from the street), with a history of 5 payments. Thanks to CEPRODEL she has been able to increase her inventory and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado el bisne. Empieza hace más de 2 años con un modesto capital de trabajo de apenas C$ 1,500 córdobas (U$$ 80 dólares), fruto de sus ahorros.

Ella decide iniciar dicho negocio, el cual al principio contaba con algunos productos, vendia golosinas en una mesa y una canasta. Como fruto de su esfuerzo y perseverancia con mucho sacrificio logró adquirir su local.

Ella ahora oferta una amplia variedad de productos,aunque siempre menor escala. El primer crédito que le otorgó CEPRODEL, fue de C$ 1,500 córdobas con quien tiene más de 1 año de trabajar (desde que aún vendía en la calle), con un récord de 5 creditos. Gracias a CEPRODEL ha logrado incrementar su inventario y sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
Maria Monica C. M. is 60 years old, single mother of 8 children, 3 of whom live with her. She has been a seamstress for more than 30 years. During this time she has been able, little by little, to buy her sewing machines to the point that now she has two electric machines and one manual machine, the latter enabling her to work when there isn't any electricity. In addition she has purchased a machine to cover buttons. Maria has her best income during the months of December, January and February, because of the graduation of students and the beginning of the school year at the start of the year. Her main clients are the parents of students in the neighborhood, but she has also been able to acquire contracts with institutions to make their work uniforms. 

Today Maria needs to purchase raw material (fabric and buttons) in order to make student uniforms and also design mosquito nets. Polyester is US$1 per yard, mosquito nettings is US$1 per yard, interface is US$.90 per yard, gabardine is US$1.80 per yard and a gross (quantity of 144) of buttons is $3 each.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Monica C. M. tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 8 hijos pero solamente 3 viven con ella. Se dedica a la costura desde hace mas de 30 años. En este tiempo a podido ir comprando poco a poco sus maquinas de coser a tal punto que ya tiene dos maquinas electricas y una mecanica, esta ultima le permite trabajar cuando no hay energia electrica. Ademas a comprado una maquina para forrar botones. Doña Maria tiene sus mejores ingresos en los meses de Diciembre, Enero y Febrero, esto por la promociones de estudiantes finalistas y por inicio del año escolar al inicio de cada año. Su principales clientes son los padres de familias de estudiantes  de su barrio, pero tambien a logrado tener contratos con instituciones para hacerles los uniformes de trabajo. 

Actualmente doña Maria necesita comprar materia prima (tela y botones) para poder confeccionar uniformes para estudiantes y tambien diseñar mosquiteros. La yarda de tela dacron la compra en US$ 1 dolar cada una, la yarda de tela para mosquitero la compra a US$ 1dolar cada yarda, la entretela a US$ 0.90 dolar la yarda, la yarda de tela de gavardina la compra a US 1.8 dolares cada yarda y la gruesa de botones valen US 3 dolares cada una.

loans.use: Buy 70 yards of mosquito netting, 30 yards of interface, 80 yards of polyester, 2 gross of buttons, and 60 yards of  gabardine.

payments.comment: La cuota es de US$ 24.25. Esta pagando hasta hoy ya que las oficinas estaban cerradas por vacaciones de fin de año.

La cuota real es de $ 26.92 dólares lo pago el 05 de febrero no se pudo notificar a tiempo porque uno de los promotores esta de vacaciones y el otro estaba de subsidio por presentar problemas de salud.
La cuota completa es de US$ 21.58, ya que el mes de Febrero por error se reporto US$ 26.92 y lo correcto es US$ 24.25
La cuota real es de $ 24.25 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 24.25 dólares.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac, 51, sells sawed wood at the Tema timber market. With the loan, Isaac will buy wood from the Eastern Region of Ghana. He will then process the wood to sell to furniture makers. Isaac’s business has expanded greatly over the past eight years. He now has five employees. 

Isaac hopes to expand even more in the future. His passion is making furniture, not just processing the wood for other people to build furniture. If he has the time and capital, he will open a furniture store. 

Isaac is a member of the lending group, Zion. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
John is a single man who owns a warehouse of construction materials. He sells bricks, cement, lime, wood, among other things. He also manufactures cement floors that are known to have good strength and good quality.
