He worked for several years as an assistant in a warehouse where construction materials were sold, then the business owners, seeing his good work and dedicated effort, helped John set up his own warehouse.

Today, his business has progressed well and he already has two trucks loaded with transporting floors and brick. He wants the loan to buy sand and cement in large quantities, because they are the best selling products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Juan es un hombre soltero, es dueño de un depósito de materiales de construcción. Vende ladrillos, cemento, cal, maderas, entre otras cosas, también fabrica pisos de cemento y que tienen bastante resistencia y buena calidad.

En principio el trabajo por varios años como ayudante en un depósito de materiales, luego sus jefes, viendo el buen trabajo y esfuerzo, lo ayudaron a montar su propio depósito.

Hoy día ha progresado bastante y ya posee dos camiones de carga con los que transporta pisos y ladrillos. Desea el préstamo para comprar arena y cemento en grandes cantidades ya que son los productos de mayor venta.

loans.use: Purchase of sand and cement. (compra de arena y cemento.)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 52, has been working in the timber market in Tema for 15 years. She is now running two businesses at once. One is selling second hand clothing, and the other is a public bathroom for workers at the market to shower/use the toilet. 

Currently the toilets are just pits under cement holes. With the loan, Rebecca would like to build a reservoir and a new structure for flushable toilets with tiled floors. Not only will she be able to charge more for use of the toilets, it will also create a more sanitary environment for the community. With the remainder of the loan, Rebecca will purchase second hand clothing for her shop in the market.

Rebecca is a member of the lending group, Zion. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To construct a public reservoir for a public toilet and to purchase second hand clothing.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
I have had this business for more than a year inside a school in Nuevo Laredo city, where I am in charge of preparing the meals that they sell to the children. This business is very important to me as it is a way to sell the children meals that are convenient, healthy, and freshly prepared. I need a stove and merchandise to sell. I am asking for a loan of US $1000 dollars to purchase a stove and merchandise.



Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de un año que tengo este negocio dentro de una escuela de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, me encargo de preparar los alimentos que se les venden a los niños. Este negocio es muy importante para mi ya que es una forma de vender les a los niños cómoda sana y recién echa. Me esta haciendo falta una estufa y mercancía para vender. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de una estufa y mercancía.

loans.use: Buy a stove and merchandise

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
Jose Eduardo started in the business of welding when he helped a friend who used to do this type of work. Little by little he realized that this business makes enough of a profit where one can live off of it. That is why after he trained with his friend, he decided to buy the materials necessary to carry out welding work on his own. He began by constructing gates, windows and other things that people needed to be able to protect their home. Slowly, he began to gain customers and currently has an established business.

Jose's struggle continues and he constantly seeks ways in which to grow his business. That's why we are requesting an appropriation of $325 USD, to be repaid within 6 months. With this loan, Jose will purchase materials to manufacture goods that he can offer to his customers. With your help Jose will be able to support his family and move them forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

José Eduardo comenzó en el oficio de soldador al ayudarle a un amigo a hacer este tipo de trabajos. Y poco a poco se fue dando cuenta que este negocio deja suficientes ganancias como para poder vivir del negocio. Es por esto que al aprender lo suficiente con su amigo decidió comprar el material necesario para poder realizar trabajos de soldador y fabricar, portones, ventanas entre otras cosas que la gente necesita para poder proteger su casa. Poco a poco comenzó a obtener clientes y actualmente ya tiene un negocio establecido.

Sin embargo la lucha continúa y José sigue buscando la manera en que pueda crecer su negocio. Y es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar material para fabricar artículos para así tener mercancía que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda José podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase materials in order to enhance his product base. (Comprar mercancía para elaborar sus productos)

loans.name: Angel Mario

texts.es:
Angel Mario is a man who has struggled greatly for his children's future. He worked for a long as an assistant carpenter in a carpentry shop, but went through jobless times, and so he began to look for work in other places. During some of the time spent without work, he began to think about the possibility of undertaking his own carpentry business, since he was very good at making furniture. And so it was with very little tools and all his savings that he decided to buy wood to make his first furniture. And this is how his business began 14 years ago, one client at a time.

But Angel's struggle still continues, and this is why he's thinking of making furniture to sell to his clients on credit (this way he'd be able to get more of his furniture out there). He is now applying for a loan of $925 USD, which he's willing to pay within 6 months. This loan will make it possible for Angel to purchase raw materials to make furniture to sell on credit.

With your help Angel can move forward with his family and enable his business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel Mario es un hombre que a luchado por sacar s sus tres hijos adelante. Después de haber trabajado mucho tiempo como ayudante de carpintero en una carpintería , se quedó sin trabajo, por lo tanto Ángel empezó a buscar trabajo en oto lugar, sin embargo el tiempo pasaba y no conseguía trabajo, es por eso que comenzó a pensar la posibilidad de emprender su propia carpintería puesto que se le daba muy bien hacer los muebles. Y fue así que con muy poca herramienta y con los últimos ahorros que tenía compró madera para poder fabricar sus primero muebles. Y así fue haciendo poco a poco sus clientes, hoy ya tiene 14 años de haber iniciado esto.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue en pie, y es por esto que está pensando en hacer muebles para poder darlos a crédito y así colocar más muebles entre sus clientes. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ángel podrá comprar materia prima para poder realizar muebles para vender a crédito. Con tu ayuda Ángel podrá sacar adelante a su familia y crecer un poco su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase material of good quality to enhance his product offering. (Comprar materia prima para poder elaborar sus productos)

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Two years ago, with some fried foods and some soft drinks in the refrigerator, Maria began her business of food sales. This was due to the fact that her husband was a contract worker, and often had no available work, so there was no money to pay for household expenses and the expenses of their three children who are small and need food and clothing. Gradually, Maria Elena began concentrating on making things for her business. Today, she sells tortillas, oil, eggs, milk, soap, among other things. She also has a special cooler to make soft drinks available to her customers.

Her situation now is that she has too little to offer, since her customers come to her for items she doesn't have, and cause them to go to her competition. This is why she's applying for a loan of $375 USD, which she's willing to repay within 6 months.

With your help Maria Elena can bring her family ahead, and in the future can put up a tacos shop which will also help in improving her situation and future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos años, con un poco de frituras y unos cuantos refrescos en el refrigerador, María comenzó a vender, puesto que su esposo trabaja como obrero por contratos, y hubo un largo tiempo que se quedó sin trabajo. Y no tenían dinero para pagar los gastos de su casa y menos los de sus tres hijos que están pequeños y necesitan de comida y ropa. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de cosas para su negocio. Hoy ya venden tortillas, aceite, huevo, leche, jabón, entre otras cosas. Además de contar con un enfriador especial para los refrescos.

Sin embargo lo que tiene actualmente es muy poco, puesto que sus clientes le siguen pidiendo cosas que ella no tiene, y estos pueden irse con la competencia. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda María Elena podrá sacar adelante a su familia y en un futuro podrá poner un local de tacos que los sacará adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise which will add variety to the existing products she sells. (Comprar mercancía para tener más variedad en el negocio)

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana Silvia is a woman who likes to fight for what she wants. And from the beginning she wanted to give her children an education so they could succeed. That's why 6 years ago she began selling skin creams, perfumes and cosmetics to her neighbors and friends. She gradually began to acquire customers who bought from her often.

Now, Ana is applying for a loan of $1,100 USD, which she's willing to repay within 6 months. This money will be used to buy products so that she can do demonstrations to groups of neighbors who come together to her house. With your help Ana may use this holiday season to be able to make available more merchandise, and make enough money to buy everything she needs for her home and her family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Silvia es una mujer que le gusta luchar por lo que quiere. Y desD. un inicio quiso darle a sus hijos educación para que pudieran salir adelante. Es por eso que hace 6 años que comenzó a vender cremas para L. piel, perfumes y cosméticos a sus vecinas y amigas. Y poco a poco comenzó a adquirir clientas que le compraban constantemente.

Sin embargo actualmente está solicitando un crédito D. US $1,100 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses con este dinero podrá comprar mercancía y así poder hacer demostraciones a grupos D. vecinas que se juntan en una casa. Con tu ayuda Ana podrá aprovechar esta temporada naviD.ña para poder colocar más mercancía y así tener dinero para comprar todo lo necesario para su casa y para los gastos D. su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in order to sustain her business. (Comprar mercancía para poder surtir su negocio)

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca Lidia, at 48 years of age, finds herself with a bronchial illness that does not allow her the freedom to work a job with set hours. In some instances she feels well enough and very motivated to work, and at other times she is bedridden because her lungs are congested and she can’t breathe. Unfortunately, she cannot obtain the medications she needs through her social security and must purchase it on her own at very high prices. Her husband works as a driver, and his income is not enough to meet her medical needs and day-to-day living expenses. Despite her illness, Blanca continues on and sells cosmetics and beauty products to her friends and neighbors to be able to earn some money to pay for her medicine and help her husband with the expenses for their three children.

Unfortunately, she does not currently have a wide variety of products which is why she is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, Blanca will be able to buy more merchandise to offer her clients particular during the holiday season when they are looking for gifts to give. With your support, Blanca will be able to improve her health condition.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca Lidia a sus 48 años, ya cuenta con una terrible enfermedad en los bronquios que no la deja trabajar en una empresa con horarios fijos. En ocasiones se siente muy bien y con muchos ánimos para trabajar y en otras se mantiene en cama enferma, puesto que siente que se le cierran los pulmones y no puede respirar. Desgraciadamente el seguro social no tiene el medicamento que ella necesita, por lo tanto tiene que comprarlo por fuera y son muy caros los medicamentos. El esposo de Blanca trabaja como chofer y lo que gana no les alcanza para pagar las medicinas y los gastos del hogar es por eso que Blanca a pesar de su enfermedad sigue adelante y vende a sus vecinos y amigas cosméticos por catálogo para poder sacar dinero para pagar las medicinas que tiene que comprar y de paso poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus 3 hijos.

Sin embargo actualmente no tiene mucha variedad en sus productos es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes en esta temporada de navidad donde todos compran para regalar. Con tu ayuda Blanca podrá superar esta terrible enfermedad.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen is a woman who married with the dream of building a life at her husband’s side. Unfortunately, he abandoned her after they had three children. The time that followed was a sad one for María, who also experienced depression. For a long time, she let herself go, had no will to live, and neglected her children completely. Regardless, one day she realized she could not continue in this manner and that the ones suffering the most from these problems were her children. She began looking for something to occupy her and that would, at the same time, generate some income to help her support the family. This led to her beginning to sell beauty products by catalog. She began building her customer base little-by-little, as well as her self-esteem.

Regardless, even though eight years have passed, she has not been able to get ahead because she cannot always generate enough sales and living expenses are too high. María is asking for a $700USD loan which she is prepared to repay over a period of six months. With this money she can purchase more merchandise, and therefore have more items to offer her customers. With your support, María can get ahead and prove to herself that she can succeed on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Carmen es una mujer que se casó ilusionada pensando que su vida la podría hacer alado de su esposo. Sin embargo después de tres hijos la abandonó. María entró en una terrible tristeza y depresión. Durante mucho tiempo se dejó caer y sin esperanzas para vivir, descuidando totalmente a sus hijos. Sin embargo un día se dio cuenta que ella no podía seguir así puesto que quienes más estaban resintiendo este problema eran sus hijos y fue así que comenzó a buscar algo en qué ocupar su mente, tiempo y que a su vez le dejara dinero para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Fue así como comenzó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes y recuperando su autoestima.

Sin embargo a 8 años de haber pasado esto. No a podido salir totalmente adelante puesto que en muchas ocasiones las ventas no son muy altas y los gastos en su casa son muchos. María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía que le servirá para poder tener más cosas que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante y demostrarse a ella misma que no necesita a un hombre para ser feliz.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the holiday season.

loans.name: Martha Olivia

texts.es:
Martha is a woman who likes to feel useful and contribute toward living expenses. As a result, she began looking for a business from which she could generate some income but that would not cause her to neglect caring for the needs of her children. With three children, Martha struggles always to help them get ahead and provide them with an education so they may have a brighter future and more opportunities than she had.

Regardless, in order to meet her customers’ demands, she must continuously replenish and vary the types of novelty products she markets. Therefore, she is asking for a $700USD loan to be repaid over a period of six months. The funds would be used to purchase additional merchandise, particularly important at this time of year since her customers are looking for gifts for their families. With your help, Martha will be able to help her business get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer que le gusta sentirse útil y contribuir a los gastos del hogar. Por lo tanto comenzó a buscar un negocio en el que ella pudiera obtener ganancias, y al mismo tiempo no descuidar a sus hijos que tanto la necesitan. Con tres hijos Martha lucha siempre por sacarlos adelante y darles educación para que ellos tengan un futuro mejor al que tuvo oportunidad Martha.

Sin embargo este tipo de trabajos necesitan estarse renovando constantemente puesto que las clientas necesitan ver novedades puesto que eso es lo que vende. Por lo tanto Martha está solicitando un crédito de US $700 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía que le servirá para tener en esta temporada navideña algo nuevo que ofrecerle a sus clientes que andan buscando los regalos para sus familias. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá salir adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the holiday season.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
It’s been eight years since Yolanda began selling beauty products by catalog. She started this endeavor to be able to help with their cost of living, given that they have three children and the school supplies and books that are required by the school are very expensive. She does not like the idea that her children go through what she did by not having the opportunity to get ahead and have an education. For this reason, she does even the impossible to assure that they can continue with their studies. With much effort, and little by little, her customer base has grown. Despite this, the struggle continues to earn enough money to cover basic living expenses.

Yolanda is asking for a $700USD loan to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, she will be able to purchase merchandise to give demonstrations to women in her town. With your help, Yolanda will be able to help her family get ahead and share in her successes. She wants to treat them to special, delicious meal for the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ocho años que Yolanda comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos cosméticos por catálogo. Y desde ese entonces lo hizo para poder ayudar con los gastos en el hogar, puesto que tienen tres hijos y los materiales y libros que le piden en la escuela son muy caros y a Yolanda no le gusta la idea de que sus hijos pasen por lo mismo que ella al no tener la oportunidad de salir adelante por falta de estudios. Por lo tanto ella hace hasta lo imposible por que sigan estudiando. Con mucho esfuerzo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su cartera de clientas sin embargo la lucha sigue para poder sacar dinero para pagar las cosas del hogar.

Yolanda está solicitando un crédito de US $700 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para hacer demostraciones entre mujeres de su colonia. Con tu ayuda Yolanda podrá sacar adelante a su familia y podrá compartir sus triunfos con ella. Porque les quiere regalar de navidad una cena muy rica entre familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
"I have a cart where I sell hot dogs on an avenue in the city. I'd like to invest in the purchase of another cart, which I'll install in another part of the city, as a way of increasing my earnings. With this business I have been able to feed my family and give them what they need. They are my motivation for wanting to grow my business and for looking for ways to increase my earnings. I am applying for a loan of $800 to invest in the purchase of a hot dog vending cart. "

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo un carrito en donde vendo hot-dog en una avenida de la ciudad, pero me gustaría invertir en la compra de otro carrito para instalarlo en otro lugar de la ciudad y así obtener más ganancias, de este negocio que tengo he podido alimentar a mi familia y darles lo que necesitan por eso también quiero crecer y buscar la manera de obtener más ganancias. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de un carrito para vender hot-dog."

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a hot dog vending cart.

loans.name: Guadalupe Francisca

texts.es:
Guadalupe F. has five children ages six to fifteen. Her husband, retired and of advanced years, is no longer able to work. He receives a small pension, but it is not enough to support the family. So, Guadalupe decided to open a stationery/variety goods store to sell to the children who pass by her house as there is a school across the street. Her customers are asking her for different types of items and Guadalupe, in many cases, cannot meet their demands for certain products.

For this reason, Guadalupe is asking for a loan of $1,025 which she is prepared to repay over a term of six months. With these funds Guadalupe will be able to purchase more merchandise and better outfit the space in her house for her store. With your support, Guadalupe will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe F. es madre de 5 hijos desde los 6 hasta los 15 años, su esposo es jubilado y es de la tercera edad, es por eso que ya no puede trabajar, lo que recibe el señor de pensión es muy poco como para poder mantener a todos sus hijos por lo tanto Guadalupe decidió abrir una papelería para poder venderle a los niños que pasan por su casa puesto que frente a ella está una escuela. El negocio de la papelería a sabido mantenerse es por esto que cada vez le están pidiendo cosas diferentes y Guadalupe en muchos de los casos no puede venderles lo que sus clientes le piden.

Es por eso que Guadalupe está solicitando un crédito de US $1,025 qie está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Guadalupe va a poder comprar más mercancía y para poder adecuar el espacio de su casa como una papelería. Con tu ayuda Guadalupe podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Adapt a space for stationery/variety goods store.

loans.name: Jaloma

texts.es:
Jaloma V. is a mother a six children who has struggled to help them get ahead. She has succeeded, as they are now married. Regardless, Jaloma ended up alone since, as her children grew, their father abandoned them and left her with sole responsibility for taking care of them. Thanks to her desire to improve their lives, she did not need a man to become what she is today: well-known in her community for her courage and her dedication to sales. Thirty-one years ago, she began selling beauty products from house to house, covering the surrounding area.

Despite this, being alone has created financial difficulties for her and she finds herself unable to invest in her business during this busy season, a time when customers have money and are looking to buy gifts for friends and family. For this reason, Jaloma is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a six-month period. With these funds, she will be able to buy more merchandise that her customers will like. With your help, Jaloma will be able to succeed despite her loneliness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Jaloma V. madre de 6 hijos, a luchado por sacar a sus hijos adelante. Y lo logró, todos ya se encuentran casados. Sin embargo Jaloma, se quedó sola puesto que mientras sus hijos iban creciendo el papá de ellos la abandonó y le dejó la responsabilidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante. Gracias a sus ganas de superarse no necesitó de un hombre para poder ser lo que hoy es. Una mujer reconocida en su comunidad por su coraje y entrega a las ventas. Comenzó hace 31 años a vender productos de belleza casa por casa recorriendo todo lo que se encontrara a su alrededor. Sin embargo el quedarse sola, le a implicado muchos problemas económicos por lo tanto no tiene dinero suficiente para invertir en esta temporada que para ella es muy buena puesto que la mayoría de sus clientes tienen dinero y ganas de comprarle un regalo a sus familiares. Por lo tanto Jaloma está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía que le gustará a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Jaloma podrá salir adelante a pesar de la soledad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
" I have a grocery store in my house. I opened the store a few months ago but I have lacked the money I need to properly invest in it. I would like to buy merchandise as a way of increasing my earnings, since my children and I live from this business. It has taken a lot of effort for me to move this business forward, since I am a single mother. However, I have confidence that I can move my family ahead and understand that to do so I have to work hard. I am applying for a loan of $500 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una tienda de abarrotes en mi casa, hace algunos meses que la abrí pero en realidad me ha faltado dinero para invertir, me gustaría comprar mercancía y así obtener más ganancias ya que de este negocio nos alimentamos mis hijos y yo, me ha costado mucho trabajo salir adelante ya que soy madre soltera, pero tengo la confianza de que puedo sacar a mis hijos adelante y para eso tengo que trabajar mucho” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio”.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
My husband and I have a bakery. Little by little we have been gaining customers and the business has gone well, thank God. Now we want to buy a vehicle in order to be able to sell bagged bread on the street and also visit other stores where they could sell our bread, thereby increasing our earnings. I am seeking a US$1200 dollar loan to buy a vehicle to deliver bread.



Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo tenemos una panadería, poco a poco hemos logrado tener nuestros clientes y nos ha ido bien gracias a dios, ahora tenemos la intención de comprar un vehículo para poder vender el pan en bolsas por las calles y también visitar otras tiendas donde vendan nuestro pan, de esa manera obtendremos más ganancias” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar un vehículo para repartir el pan.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of a vehicle in order to sell bread in other stores and in the street.

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 26073

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
María Guadalupe is the mother of 13 children for whom she has had to fight to maintain healthy and motivated to succeed. Some time ago they lived in a smaller home and due to the size of the family they needed to move out of their neighborhood. After moving, Maria observed that there wasn't a grocery store nearby and decided to begin her business. She began with a small amount of items that she purchased in the supermarket and little by little went increasing her offerings. Thanks to the strength Maria has to take care of her 13 children and manage her store she has found a way to progress. At this time, her husband does not work and is able to help Maria with her store. Maria constantly fights to ensure her business continues.

Nonetheless she currently has little merchandise and is therefore requesting a loan of US$925 to be paid within 6 months. With this money, she will purchase merchandise in order to increase the variety of offerings to her customers in the neighborhood. With your help, Maria and her large family will be able to move ahead and celebrate a Christmas with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es madre de 13 hijos a quienes a tenido que luchar por mantenerlos sanos y con ganas de salir adelante. Hace tiempo que vivían en una casa un poco más pequeña y debido al gran número de integrantes en la casa tuvieron que cambiarse de colonia. Al cambiarse de colonia María observó que no había una tienda cercana de abarrotes, y fue por eso que se le ocurrió poner su negocio. Comenzó con un poco de mercancía que compraba en el supermercado y poco a poco fue incrementando los productos. Gracias a la fuerza que tiene María de cuidar 13 hijos y atender su negocio es que han sabido salir adelante. Actualmente el esposo ya no trabaja y le ayuda a María en el negocio es por eso que María lucha constantemente porque el negocio se siga manteniendo.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene muy poca mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad qué ofrecer a sus clientes de la colonia. Con tu ayuda María y su gran familia podrá salir adelante y pasar navidad con todos los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Mrs. Te H., 33, is married with one school-aged child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling women’s clothes, earning around $5/day in revenue, while her husband works at a construction, making about $3/day of profit. Mrs. Te H. has applied for a loan to expand her inventory by adding more clothes to meet her client demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more clothes to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Karla Evelyn

texts.es:
Karla Evelin began the business of selling footwear in order to help her mother. After a while she saw that her mother made good profits, and told her mother that if she could have some of the goods, Karla would pay her what was gained from the sales . This is how her mother decided to help start Karla's business, which Karla runs and which helps provide the income needed so tha she can continue studying.

But school costs are high, so they are asking for a loan of $ 925 USD, which she is willing to pay within a period of 6 months. With this money, she'll be able to buy more goods at wholesale prices, and get material to build a space solely for the sale of shoes to her clients.

With your help Karla can move forward and finish her career.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Karla Evelin comenzó el negocio de venta de calzado ayudándole a su mamá, después de un tiempo vio que su mamá tenia buenos ingresos y le dijo a su mamá que si le podía surtir mercancía y posteriormente Karla le pagaba de lo que fuera ganando de las ventas. Fue así como la mamá decidió ayudarla a comenzar el negocio que actualmente maneja Karla y que le ayuda a sacar dinero para poder seguir estudiando.

Sin embargo los gastos que tiene en la escuela son mucho por lo tanto necesita un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía a precio de mayoreo y así tener material para poder poner un local para que sus clientas puedan buscarla en un lugar establecido. Con tu ayuda Karla podrá salir adelante y terminar su carrera.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.  (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es:
After many years working in a nutrition club, Epifania decided to become independent and directly distribute for a brand of natural products, and right now she has gained recognition among her acquaintances. This is how she has built for herself a trade which provides her with money to help her husband, since in some occasions they did not have money to pay for electricity, gas, or water. At the same time this job does not take away precious time she needs to take care of her four children, since they need attention so that they do not go the wrong way, and instead they devote themselves to study to become honorable and hardworking people.

Epifania is requesting a loan for US$750, which she is willing to pay back in a period of 6 months. With this money, Epifania will set up a room in her house to establish her own nutrition club and continue with this business. With your help, Epifania will achieve her dreams and at the same time those of her family, which are to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Después de haber trabajado durante mucho años en un club de nutrición Epifanía decide independizarse y ser distribuidora directa de una marca de productos naturistas, actualmente ya tiene un reconocimiento entre sus conocidos. Es por eso que se a hecho un oficio que le deja dinero para poder ayudar a su esposo, puesto que en ocasiones no tenían dinero para pagar la luz, el gas, el agua y que no le quita tiempo valioso que necesita para poder atender a sus cuatro hijos, puesto que necesitan de atención para que no se vayan por el mal camino de la vida y se dediquen a estudiar para ser personas honorables y trabajadoras.

Epifanía está solicitando un crédito de $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Epifanía va a acondicionar un cuarto de su casa para establecer su propio club de nutrición y seguir con este negocio. Con tu ayuda Epifanía logrará sus sueños y al mismo tiempo los de su familia que es la de mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Acommodating a room for a nutrition club (Adecuar un lugar para un club de nutrición)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
For 27 years, Mr. Juan has worked selling tacos in his taco stand, since he was 26 years old. He started with the desire of forming a family and being able to give his children a better future than he had since he only completed elementary school and with such schooling the quality of potential jobs decreases. During these 27 years, he has gone through all kinds of things, good and bad times in which he almost closed his business and others in which he has even thought about expanding starting other locations.

However, the times they are going through right now have not been very good, and this is why he is requesting a loan for US$925, which he is willing to pay back in a period of 6 months. With this money, Juan will renovate his taco stand because the one he has is very old and needs to be renovated given that competing businesses have started around him with new, attention grabbing carts. With your help, Juan will be able to move his business forward, which is his passion in life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 27 años el señor Juan se ha dedicado a vender tacos en su taquería desde los 26 años comenzó con la ilusión de formar una familia y poder darle a sus hijos un futuro mejor que el que él tuvo. Puesto que estudió hasta la primaria y con ese estudio la calidad de trabajos va bajando. Sin embargo en estos 27 años han pasado todo tipo de cosas buenas y malas temporadas en que casi se cierra el negocio y otras en que dan ganas hasta de hacer sucursales. Pero a pesar de todo este negocio ha mantenido toda su familia y ah dado educación a sus hijos, los cuales ya son mayores.

Sin embargo la temporada que están pasando actualmente no a sido muy buena por eso está solicitando un crédito de $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Juan va a renovar su puesto de tacos ya que el que tiene ya es muy antiguo y necesita renovarse, puesto que los que la competencia está llegando a su alrededor con carritos nuevos y muy llamativos. Con tu ayuda Juan podrá sacar adelante su negocio que es su pasión por vivir.

loans.use: Remodeling his taco cart (Remodelar el carrito de tacos)

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Since he was little, Alfredo saw her father fix air conditioner and refrigeration equipment, and he took an interest in that. As he grew up, Alfredo started going into the business to learn everything that her father knew, and little by little his dad began to hand him over jobs so that he would fix them himself. This is how Alfredo gained in confidence, and as a grown up decided to go to the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas, a border town, in which he perfected his profession by studying in a technical institute. Alfredo now has his own repair shop of air conditioners and he has been working this traD. since then.

However, he currently has several jobs of air conditioners that his clients left to repair taking advantage of the winter season, which the air conditioners are not being used. This is why Alfredo is requesting a loan of US$925, which he is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money, Alfredo will be able to buy spare parts for the refrigeration units he commercializes. With your help, Alfredo will be able to make his business succeed and support his wife and two children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

DesD. pequeño Alfredo veía a su papá arreglar aires acondicionados y equipos D. refrigeración, y le llamaba la atención, cuando creció comenzó a meterse en el negocio y a aprender todo lo que su padre sabía, poco a poco su papá le fue soltando trabajos para que sólo los corrigiera y así Alfredo tomó confianza y ya D. granD. decidió cambiar D. ciudad a Reynosa Tamaulipas una ciudad fronteriza en la que perfecciono su profesión estudiando en un instituto D. capacitación y hoy tiene su propio taller D. reparación D. aires acondicionados y desD. entonces se dedica a este oficio.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios trabajos D. aires acondicionados que le dejaron clientes para reparar aprovechando que es temporada D. invierno y que no lo ocupan por lo tanto Alfredo está solicitando un crédito D. US $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses con este dinero Alfredo podrá comprar refacciones para las unidades D. refrigeración que comercializa. Con tu ayuda Alfredo podrá sacar adelante su negocio y a su esposa y dos hijos que tiene.

loans.use: Buying tools and spare parts to repair air conditioners (Comprar herramientas para reparar climas)

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
She started her business selling basic necessity products as a mini-mart 10 years ago with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses, as these were starting to increase when their two children grew and were asked for a lot of materials for school. Being a stay-at-home mom, Maria de Jesus decided to do something that would make her money in addition to giving her the opportunity to use her time in a commercial activity.

Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for US $925, which she is willing to pay within a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria will be able to improve the walls of her locale, which are made out of wood and are in very bad shape. Maria de Jesus wants to make them out of concrete so that the merchandise is not affected by the humidity sometimes brought by wood. With your help, Maria de Jesus will be able to support her children and renovate her locale for the benefit of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ella inicio el negocio de la venta de abarrotes en la modalidad de mini super hace 10 años, con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares puesto que comenzaban a incrementarse ya que sus dos hijos crecieron y les pedían muchos materiales para la escuela. Al ser ama de casa María de Jesús decidió hacer algo que le retribuyera dinero además de ocupar su tiempo libre en una actividad comercial.

María de Jesús está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá mejorar las paredes de su local ya que son de madera y están muy maltratadas. María de Jesús desea construirlo de material para que la mercancía no se moleste con la humedad que a veces provoca la madera. Con tu ayuda María de Jesús podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y renovará su local para el bien del negocio.

loans.use: Remodeling her business (remodelar su negocio)

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mr. Ung B., 35, is married and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.
To cover his household’s expense, Mr. Ung B. works as a construction foreman, earning around $16/day in revenue, while his wife works as a housewife looking after her child and cooking food for him. Mr. Ung B. hopes to use this loan to purchase wood frames and some construction tools to facilitate his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood frames and some tools to facilitate his business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is 44 years old, married, and has 1 child. She has been in the clothing business for over 4 years. Her business is located in the Isfara clothing market. She buys her goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. For the coming winter she wants to purchase winter assortment of children clothes which will be in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase winter assortment of children clothes

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is married and has one child.  Mavjuda first came to Microinvest 5 years ago. With her first loan she was able to expand her business and become more poriftable. Mavjuda plans to get a new loan to purchase an assortment of children clothes and expand her business once again.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: for purchasing winter assortment of children clothes

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara D. owns a food stand, conveniently located at the Spitamen food market in Tajikistan. She sells a variety of groceries but specializes cookies and sweets. She has grown her business and developed strong relationships with loyal customers. She urgently needs a loan to be able to meet the increased demand, for food and sweets in her community, caused by the holiday season.

loans.use: To grow her food supply

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en: Ruzigul has been selling a wide assortment of cookies and candies in the central market of Spitamen for two years. Ruzigul is a teacher by profession, but the salary of a teacher is not enough to support her and her family. She has received a loan a few months ago and it has helped her to expand the volume of her business. She plans to further expand the variety and volume of her business now with her upcoming loan.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a single mom of three little ones and in her work she isn't paid enough to support the three children and offer them schooling. Thus, Celia decided to start looking for an extra job besides the one she already had and that is how she started selling cosmetics by catalogue, making the sales in her free time. Little by little, and with a lot of faith, she started gathering customers and now she is recognized in her neighborhood as the woman who sells the cosmetic products.

However, she currently does not have a lot of merchandise to do demonstrations. Celia realized that the best way to sell and make the most of her time is to do demonstrations in the homes of her customers, gathering more women, so that they put in a larger order. Right now she has an order to fulfill and she wants to do more demonstrations and this is why she is requesting a loan for US$325, which she is willing to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Celia will be able to buy more merchandise to fulfill her orders. With your help, Celia will be able to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Celia es madre soltera de tres pequeñitos y en su trabajo no le pagan lo suficiente como para mantener a los tres niños y darles escuela. Por lo tanto Celia decidió comenzar a buscar un trabajo extra al que ya tenía y fue así como comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo haciendo las ventas en sus tiempos libres. Poco a poco y con mucha fe fue haciéndose de clientes y hoy ya la reconocen en su colonia como la mujer que vende los productos cosméticos.

Sin embargo actualmente no tiene mucha mercancía para hacer demostraciones, y es que Celia se dio cuenta que la mejor manera de vender y aprovechar el tiempo es haciendo demostraciones en las casas de sus clientas, juntando a más señoras y así le hacen un pedido grande. Actualmente tiene un pedido por surtir y más ganas de hacer demostraciones es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Celia podrá comprar más mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda Celia podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to demonstrate to her customers (Comprar mercancía para hacer demostraciones a sus clientes)

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en: Oygul is married. She is selling small goods in the Spitamen central market. You can always purchase necessary goods from Oygul. Business is from her family income. Now she plans to increase the turnover of business and is asking for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase the selection.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe has always been interested in the world of beauty and beauty salons. When she started out she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon and she fell in love with the profession. At home her father was not able to bring in much money so she decided to take a course in esthetics and when she finished she started her own business as an esthetician. Along the line she had a baby boy that today is the light in her eyes - being a single mother she works hard to make it through. And she also manages to help her parents with their expenses.

The hard work continues even with tough competition. Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $550 US to be repaid in a term of 6 months. With this loan Maria will be able to purchase chairs and tables to make her beauty salon more presentable and this way clients will feel more comfortable in the salon wher they have their beauty make-overs. With your help Maria will be able to provide for her son and help her parents so that all will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

María Guadalupe siempre se interesó por el mundo de los salones de belleza, cuando comenzó a crecer trabajó como ayudante en una estética y después de ahí le tomó mucho cariño a esa profesión y dado que en su casa su papá no llevaba mucho dinero ella decidió meterse a un curso de belleza y después de que terminó inició su carrera independiente como estilista. En el camino tuvo a un pequeño niño que hoy es la luz de sus ojos, siendo madre soltera y por quien ahora lucha para salir adelante. Además de ayudar con los gastos de sus papás.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue y la competencia es muy difícil. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar sillas y mesas para poder tener un mejor aspecto en su salón y así más clientes vayan con la confianza de que ese es un lugar en dónde se hacen buenos trabajos de belleza. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su hijo y ayudar a que sus papás tengan una vida de calidad.

loans.use: To purchase furnishins for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Neida Elizabeth

texts.es:
Six years ago, Neido became pregnant and she vowed to work with all her might so that her son might be happy and not be lacking in anything. With the help of her mother she started to make food to sell and slowly she and her food stand started to become known and her through her effort and dedication, and her success can be seen in the good work that she does. Today she has more clients and many have become regulars. But unfortunately her stand is too small.

Nedia requests a loan in the amount of $750 US to be repaid in a term of 6 months. With this loan Nedia will be able to purchase a new and bigger stove to be able to make more food in the same amount of time, and she will also purchase tables and chaires so that her clients can sit while Nedia makes their order. With your help Neida will be able to support her son and will be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 6 años, Neida se dio cuenta que estaba embarazada, y decidió luchar con todas sus fuerzas para que su hijo fuera feliz y no le falte nada. Con la ayuda de su mamá comenzó a hacer comidas para vender y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida su comida puesto que el esfuerzo y la dedicación de salir adelante se ve reflejado en el buen trabajo que realiza. Actualmente ya tiene más clientes y muchos se han hecho constantes. Pero desgraciadamente el local sigue siendo muy pequeño.

Es por eso que Neida está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Neida podrá comprar una parrilla más grande para hacer más comidas al mismo tiempo y mobiliario para que sus clientes se puedan sentar a esperar la comida que prepara Neida. Con tu ayuda Neida podrá sacar adelante a su hijo y podrá crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To furnish her business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia R. is originally from Dr. Arrollo, a town in Neuvo Leon, Mexico. She moved to the capital of Neuvo Leon to find a better future for herself, her husband, and their two daughters. Her husband's job is better than the one he had before, but it still does not cover the higher cost of living in Monterrey. So she started taking orders for tamales for sale. Slowly she started to be known. In the mornings she goes out to the houses and companies to offer her tamales. And today she has many clients especially in December, especially the companies that make orders of hundreds of tamales.

Silvia's kitchen is not adequate to make so many tamales and she wastes much time and effort by making them only in small batches. Silvia is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 US to be repaid in a term of 6 months. With this loan Silvia will purchase larger pots and pans to make more tamales at a time. She also plans on the purchase of a new stove with more burners as well as more ingredients to make her products. With your help Silvia will be able to succeed in her business and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia R. es nativa de Dr. Arrollo un municipio de Nuevo León México. Se cambió de residencia a la capital del estado de Nuevo León para poder luchar por un mejor futuro para ella, su esposo y sus dos hijas. Sin embargo el trabajo que consiguió su esposo es mejor que el que tenía antes, pero no es tan bueno como para pagar todos los gastos que genera vivir en Monterrey. Por lo tanto comenzó a vender tamales por pedidos. Y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida. Por las mañanas salía a las casa y empresas a ofrecer sus tamales. Y hoy ya tiene varios clientes que en la época de diciembre le piden tal es el caso de fábricas que le piden por cientos.

Sin embargo la cocina de Silvia no está preparada para elaborar tantos tamales y pierde mucho tiempo y esfuerzo en hacerlos en pocas cantidades. Por lo tanto Silvia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Silvia comprará hoyas mas grandes para hacer más tamales, y una estufa con más parrillas además de comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Silvia podrá sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase of ingredients to make tamales and a new stove.

loans.name: Yannette

texts.es:
Yanette needed to move away from her exhusband and decided that it was time to go on her own and filed for divorce. "Being divorced has forced me to look for work", comments Yanette. She started to look for work but the money that she earned was not enough to to support her three children and it was not enough to send them to school. After work Yanette started selling fried foods from her home with only one small table and a few little bags of fried foods with salsa, and she started to makes some sales. Today she has more variety in her products but she it's still a daily struggle to establish her business.

Yanette is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 US to be repaid in a term of 5 months. With this loan Yanette will be able to purchase a larger table and add to her sales merchandise so that her clients will have more choice. With your help Yanette will be able to support her children without having to depend on her exhusband.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Yannette no aguantó vivir con su ahora ex esposo y decidió que era momento de seguir por su cuenta por lo tanto se divorció “El estar divorciada me obligo atener que buscar trabajo”, comenta Yannette Así fue que comenzó a buscar trabajo, pero el dinero que ganaba no era suficiente como para poder mantener a sus tres hijos quienes necesitan de dinero para poder estudiar. Fue por eso que después de trabajar Yannette comenzó a vender frituras afuera de su casa, tansolo con una pequeña mesa y unas cuantas bolsitas de frituras con una salsa comenzó a vender y los clientes a llegar. Actualmente ya tiene más surtido de frituras sin embargo la lucha continúa por establecer su negocio.

Por lo tanto Yannette está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Yannette podrá comprar una mesa más grande y surtir de más mercancía su negocio para que sus clientes tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Yannette podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos sin la necesidad de su ex esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and a larger table where to display her products.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Marifat is a teacher at a local school. Besides teaching, she engages in business by selling men’s and women’s footwear. This brings additional contributions to the family budget. She is married, 42 years old, and has 3 children. She asks for a new loan to further the expansion of her business.

loans.use: for further expansion of business

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: M. Dilfuza is married and she lives with her family in Spitamen. She has worked in a bazar since 2003 and during her experience i.e. 5 years, in clothes sale she showed herself as very capable of making business, she is quick and smart. All these qualities allow her to make good business and has succes in it. Now she wants to expand her business and her family will have another source of income with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Several years ago, U. Gulnora started her own business with very little capital. She is now an extremely talented businesswoman and is able to support her family through her business. This experience as strengthened both her and her family. U. would like to enlarge and expand her business with this loan to improve the variety and amount of merchandise available to her clients.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar I. is a young woman with 2 children. She plants her household land, and sells her harvest in the bazar. She has used the money from selling her agricultural goods to start another business of selling clothes, from which she can earn a better income. She will use the loan to expand her clothing  business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Holida

texts.en: Holida and her husband are engaged in business selling men’s wear and shirts.  In addition, her husband is engaged in cattle lending. Both businesses form Holida’s family income. With the last loan from MicroInvest, she purchasing shirts for her business. It gave her an opportunity to increase her assortment and improve the quality of her stock. Now she is going to expand business and wants to use a loan to purchase warm sportswear.

loans.use: To purchase warm sportswear

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru:
Hamida U. is a widow with 2 children. Economic instability at home forced Hamida to sell to sustain her family. Hamida’s primary focus now is on getting her children into college, so that they have a better chance to succeed in the future.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Юлдошева Хамида - вдова с двумя детьми. Во времена экономической нестабильности была вынуждена заняться торговлей - для обеспечения и содержания своей семьи. Ближайшей ее задачей является забота о поступлении ее детей в высшее учебное заведение, чтобы дети повзрослев могли самостоятельно найти свою дорогу в жизни.

loans.use: To expand assortment of the goods sold by adding better quality items and winter clothing

loans.name: Patiniso

texts.en: Patiniso N. opened a children’s clothing store in Spitaman, Tajikistan in 2003. She has grown her business into a profitable store that offers a variety of clothes. Her friendly personality and business sense have allowed her to develop strong relationships with clients. She needs a lone to continue to expand her inventory and further grow her business, her continued success would allow her keep providing a necessary service to her community.

loans.use: to expand inventory and grow business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina K. is a young woman who has been occupied with the selling of mens’ clothes since 2004. Despite of her young age, she is very smart and a very quick businesswoman. She has a stable business and her assets are increasing every month. She reimburses her loans in time without any problem. Now, she wants to enlarge her business and is hoping for another loan. Madina thanks you in advance.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en: Zulhumor is one of the active clients of Microinvest.She is married and has 3 children.She has been  in trade for over 2 years. Her business is to sell underwear and heardscarf,which she buys from Istaravshan,Khujand,Tadjikistan.She makes purchases weekly.Her elder daughter works at her business.Presently she has good turnover of her goods and she plans to get more profit from holiday trade. She is asking $ 800 from KIVA for purchasing warm heardscarves and other goods.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat sells men’s clothing in the Spitamen bazaar. She started borrowing in 2003, and has since then been both an active and a responsible client. In her sales, she is both accurate and accountable. Due to the quality of her products she can easily make more for the large number of clients she has every year. She would like to apply for a loan to vary the assortment of her goods, and attract new clients to satisfy their demands.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Hairiniso

texts.en:
Hairiniso is an experienced business woman. Her business is in furniture; her store is located in the Sitamen big market.

To start her furniture-making process, Hairiniso buys her goods from a furniture factory in Khujand, Tadjikistan. She already has an agreement with a local workshop, from whom she buys beds, armchairs and chairs. She has solid turnover of her working capital since she has a great number of clients. Some of them prefer the locally-made furniture as it is cheaper then foreign, imported furniture. However, this month, she has received two orders for furniture from Uzbekistan but needs extra capital for making these orders.

loans.use: To purchase furniture from Uzbekistan for sale.

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.en:
Uguloi has been engaged in business for over three years. She is married and has three children. Her business is located at the big market in Spitamen, which resides in the district of Khujand,Tadjikistan.

Her starting capital was given to her by her husband. She spent it for the purchase of the first batch of goods, of which she obtained from Somon bazaar, Khujand.

She became a client of MLF Microinvest in2007 and her first loan was for 500 somoni. During her partnership with MLF Microinvest, she has consistently repaid her loans in time without any delays. The turnover of her business is good as she always tries to innovate her assortment. Presently, she will recieve loans from KIVA for expanding her assortment of goods.

loans.use: To purchase the next batch of goods.

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru:
After getting a divorce and having a young child to provide for without a higher education, trading was the only way for Sanobarhon to earn a respectable living. She liked sewing since she was young and knew about fabrics, so she decided to sells fabrics at the markets in her region. After 3 years of experience she decided to take out a loan and establish a credit history. She is currently working on expanding and strengthening her business in order to respond to the demands of her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

После развода с мужем - с ребенком на руках - без высшего образования - выход на базар оказался для этой женщины единственно приемлемым путем для достижения достойного существования. С юности увлекаясь шитьем и имея опыт и знания относительно женских материалов - Санобархон решила заняться поставкой и реализацияей именно этого товара на рынки своего района. Трехлетний опыт предпринимательства позволил ей без страха и риска для своего бизнеса начать свою кредитную историю. Думая о будущем - Атахонова Санобархон - работает над расширением и укреплением устойчивости своего бизнеса - что позволит ей без волнения отвечать все растущим потребностям своей маленькой семьи.

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Fabrics

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram has been engaged in business for over 10 years. She is married and has five children. Her business is located at the big food market in Spitamen, district of Khujand,Tadjikistan.

She became a client of MLF Microinvest in 2007 and her first loan was for 200 somoni. During her experience in the market, she has attracted many clients and has learned much about their taste preferences.She always tries to meet their needs and quickly innovates her assortment according their needs.

She sells macaroni products from local workshops and presents herself as both a responsible and punctual business partner. Now, she wants to add confectionery products to her assortment, as she knows that the demand for these kinds of products in the holiday season will be more expansive then other time.

loans.use: To purchase confectionery  and macaroni food products.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., 47, is a widow and lives with her four children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family income, she works selling chicken at an open-air market, earning up to $10 each day in revenue. One of her children works selling clothes, another is a student and the rest are unemployed. Mrs. Sok S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business. She believes this motorcyle will enable her and her family to have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.en:
Tashbubu successfully completed the full cycle of her first loan from KIVA. Tashbubu continues her activity of producing handmade carpets and selling these.

Both her daughter and daughter-in-law help her in Tashbubu's business. Now, she wishes to increase the quantity of raw materials and thus, asks for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Oysuluv

texts.ru:
Oysuluv U.’s husband went abroad in search of employment. The money he was making was not enough to satisfy the growing demands of Oysuluv U.’s family, and Oysuluv decided to start a business. She has been selling fabrics for more than 4 years. Now, Oysuluv U. wants to expand the business to help pay for her son’s traditional upbringing and education.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Во времена возникновения сложной экономической ситуации и невостребованности рабочей силы муж Уроковой Ойсулув принял решение выехать на заработки за пределы республики. Однако со временем из-за экономической ситуации и из-за роста потребности семье стало не хватать этого дохода - и тогда в помощь своему супругу она решила заняться предпринимательством. В настоящий момент она занята в этом уже более 4 лет и в расширении бизнеса видит верный путь к устройству жизни своего выросшего ребенка - согласно традиций.

loans.use: Expand inventory of fabrics sold to include more expansive better quality products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.en:
Umidjon has been engaged in his current business for over two years. His business is the trade of coal.

His business place is located at his home in Spirtamen,Tadjklistan. He buys coal and raw materials from Krgyzstan. He purchases in sacks by tons. His turnover is quick and he has a lot of return, loyal customers. For the winter season, the price for coal is high so he wishes to obtain a loan from KIVA in order to purchase the biggest batch of his goods. He wishes to receive more profit during this time of holiday trade.

loans.use: To increase the volume of his goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase turnover and the amount of goods for sale

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en: Abdumajid is both married and has three children. He has been selling pet food for the past three years. He purchases these goods on wholesale markets and then sells them in the central market. His wife no longer works so his business is the only income of the family. Abdumajid asks for a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: H. Farogat has sold women's clothes for 2 years. Her business stand is located in bazar of Spitamen,Tadjklistan. She sells her goods at a high rate, and she has many regualar clients. She will use the loan to diversify the kinds of clothes that she sells, and she hopes to do good business during the holiday season.

loans.use: purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a  41 year old woman. She lives with her child, she is single and provides for her family alone. She barely makes ends meet, tried to sell different types of goods, but as most people in the bazar are occupied with other types of business, she decided to start a business with jewerly, which gets a better income. She wants to get a loan to expanding her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en: Guzal has been employed with her business for 6 years. She is married and has 2 children. She started her business by selling detergents and now she sells cosmetics (she found out that this niche is more profitable). She has a stable business and her assets are increasing every month. She repays her loan in time without any problem. Now she has decided to enlarge her business and is seeking a loan.

loans.use: Business expansion
